Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Catch the Goodhabitz sparkle

Welcome to GoodHabitz, one of the fastest-growing international Ed-Tech companies in Europe. Our mission? To make learning as accessible, engaging, and fun as binge-watching your favorite series, scrolling through your news feed, or watching your team score a winning goal. How do we do it? We craft unique training experiences now available in 20 countries worldwide, all produced in-house at the GoodHabitz Studios. But we're not all work and no play. We invest in fun outings and events, ensuring our team has the time of their lives.

Behind the scenes, we're a team of goal-driven individuals who thrive on mutual inspiration and support. We're positive, creative masterminds always looking on the bright side, eager to tackle every challenge that comes our way.

The challenge

Welcome to the world of data insights at our dynamic organization! As a Product Data Analyst, you're not just crunching numbers; you're steering the ship by deciphering the intricate details of our product. Ready to dive into the heart of strategic decision-making? Let's break down your journey:

What You'll Do üéØ


Data Discovery: Dive into colossal datasets, unraveling the magic behind our SaaS product metrics. Create dashboards that tell tales of user behavior and product performance. Provide actionable insights and recommendations to drive product strategy and decision-making.
Data Guardian: Your mission? Ensure the harmony of information from our platform data and CRM data, and every nook and cranny. You're not just a data guardian; you're the one setting the standards, making data integrity a company-wide anthem
Teamwork Trailblazer: In your journey, you're not alone. Engage with Product Managers, Designers and Developers. Be the storyteller, presenting insights that resonate with data aficionados and rookies alike
Continuous Thrills: Being a perfection seeker, you'll spot areas for improvement. Recommendations based on data revelations? That's your specialty. Stay ahead of the curve with the coolest data tools and industry best practices



Requirements

This role is a perfect match for you because ...


Your Toolkit: Hold a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Business Management, Computer Science, or a related field. It's your academic armor!
Experience Expedition: Navigate the data landscape with at least three years of data analysis experience in a product environment, preferably in the SaaS realm. You've got a trail of insights behind you.
SQL Sorcery: Speak the language of data with proficiency in SQL. Tableau is your go-to Business Intelligence tool for day to day analytics.
Analytical Jedi Skills: Your analytical lightsaber is sharp, coupled with critical thinking and problem-solving prowess. You have a good understanding of Google Analytics.
Communication Charisma: Your ability to narrate the data story is unparalleled. Excellent communication and presentation skills are your secret weapons
Language Proficiency: Fluency in English. You speak the global language of insights. Bonus points if you are acquainted with Dutch
Solo Explorer and Team Trailblazer: Whether wandering the data wilderness alone or part of a cross-functional team, you're a force to be reckoned with



Benefits

Join us, and you'll become a valued part of a lively and dynamic team. We nurture a flexible and supportive work culture that strikes the perfect balance between your professional life and your well-deserved downtime. Step into our magical office space (yes, it even features a campfire!), fully equipped with all the tools and resources to empower you. Prepare for unforgettable team-building experiences and company events that will leave you inspired. And, of course, we've got your back with complimentary coffee and snacks to keep you energized.

Here's a glimpse of what's waiting for you


A competitive salary package that rewards your hard work
25 paid vacation days. And if that's not enough, you can add up to 10 more
A world of growth and development opportunities to enhance your skills. You'll have unlimited access to our treasure trove of GoodHabitz resources and MyAcademy
Access to mental coaching through our partner, OpenUp, to keep your mind in top shape
An annual do-good-day, fully paid, so you can contribute to a cause you're passionate about
Travel and expense reimbursement because we've got your journey covered
Pension and disability insurance, securing your financial well-being in the long run
A hybrid way of working
A work from anywhere policy after your first year;
Working in a company that welcomes artificial intelligence and uses it to improve internal processes and push AI-powered features quickly
No non-technical managers! Have a manager who gets it, who inspires and leads the way as a champion for engineering excellence
M3 MacBook Pro


Ready to take the next step in your career and join a team that's as vibrant as it is supportive? We can't wait to have you on board!
Show more

  • No non-technical managers! Have a manager who gets it, who inspires and leads the way as a champion for engineering excellence
  • M3 MacBook Pro

Ready to take the next step in your career and join a team that's as vibrant as it is supportive? We can't wait to have you on board!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (CRM Specialisation)




As Data Analyst with CRM Specialisation, you will contribute to the success of the Sales & Marketing teams of Everfield's portfolio across Europe:

Use your experience in Sales & Marketing analytics to present actionable insights to our Sales & Marketing teams (HQ & Portfolio).
Work with implementation partners and portfolio companies to ensure CRM systems are implemented in alignment with Everfield standards.
Cooperate with Data Engineers to create sustainable data pipelines from various CRM systems.




The company:

Everfield is a platform with a mission in acquiring, building and operating vertical market and specialist software companies, focused on European businesses. We invest in and provide support and best practices to software companies in order for them to live up to their full potential by offering a very established approach to promote growth.




Everfield seeks to deliver innovation and growth to its acquired companies by providing best practices and operational support to help identify opportunities and install proven methodologies to accelerate customer and market share. Everfield is located throughout Europe, with offices in UK, Germany, the Netherlands, France, Poland, Spain, and Latvia.




The team:

You will join the Business Intelligence (BI) team as the fourth member. Currently the team consists of two Data Engineers and a hands-on team lead. The BI team creates value for various stakeholders (CEO, Finance, COO, Sales, Marketing, and Everfield‚Äôs portfolio companies), by creating insights, delivering analysis, automating reporting processes and improving data quality.




The team builds pipelines with Synapse to ingest the data into our data platform, uses Databricks for data transformation and Power BI for data visualization. For analytics the team also uses SQL.




The scope of the team is expected to scale with the company‚Äôs growth and maturity level. Everfield will scale from 16 portfolio companies currently, to approximately 90 companies in the next 4 years.




Responsibilities:

Requirements gathering

Align with key stakeholders to understand reporting requirements
Create feature development and communication plans

Data Analysis

Perform Sales & Marketing analysis such as Cohort, Funnel, Pipeline coverage analyses, Revenue forecasting, etc.

Data Visualization

Design proof of concept solutions to showcase new features with shortened feedback loop
Create and maintain Power BI reports used by hundreds of users

Data Ingestion, Verification and Validation

Extract raw data from upstream sources
Improving data quality and efficiency‚Äã

Data modelling and Transformation

Build data systems and pipelines‚Äã based on a medallion architecture

Structure sales processes

Go beyond the data and work together with Everfield‚Äôs Sales Lead to structure sales processes in the portfolio companies
Support portfolio companies in implementing Everfield‚Äôs suggested data structure on CRMs and ensure consistency of definitions across the portfolio




Ideal candidate profile:

The position requires a self-starting personality, that fits into an environment that is characterised by entrepreneurship and has a customer centric approach.
The candidate will have at least 3 years of experience within an international or complex environment and the right drive and ambition to make the difference.
Experienced with Sales analysis and business partnership with sales teams.
Relevant experience with Synapse or Azure Data Factory and Databricks is a plus-point.
Knowledge and hands on experience with Python (PySpark, Pandas).
Experienced with data modelling.
Experience with working in a DevOps team, following a structured, iterative Agile development process.
Fluent in English.
Above all, a great colleague, enthusiastic, approachable, honest, committed, result focused, a team player who wants to achieve the best results together.




What‚Äôs in it for you?

Grow your career in a fast-paced and growing organization.
Enable exponential growth by designing a world class data platform.
Working with the latest Data Analytics & Data Visualisation technologies.
Long term career opportunities.
Working closer to leadership teams within the Head Quarters and Portfolio.
Flexible work environment with offices around Europe (Netherlands, UK, Spain, France, Poland, Germany).




Continue the conversation

Interested? We would love to hear from you!




Apply now with your CV and if you are selected our Talent Acquisition colleague will contact you to schedule the 1st call and start our hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data (Marketing) Analyst-Betting Company- SaaS- Hybrid- Amsterdam- 60k




My client is the premier destination for sports betting and the ultimate online (live) casino experience in the Netherlands. As pioneers in the industry, they are committed to reshaping entertainment while maintaining responsible gambling. Their goal is to create an environment where players can enjoy themselves responsibly without losing control.




Keywords: SQL, Python, GCP, Marketing Mix Models, B2C, Stakeholder Management, Analytical Skills.




An exciting opportunity awaits a Data Analyst to have a significant impact on attracting more consumers through online marketing campaigns in an Amsterdam-based online betting company. Collaborate closely with the Head of Data Analytics, who is enthusiastic about sharing knowledge with you.




In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing dashboards and data to understand where the customers are coming from and how to retain them. You will work on marketing mix models and marketing touch attribution to optimize our marketing strategies and improve player engagement.




The IT infrastructure is state-of-the-art, utilizing all that Google has to offer, including Google Analytics, cloud resources, and data warehousing. Your responsibilities include analyzing, building, and automating new solutions.




Requirements:

3+ years of experience in data analysis (SQL & Python)
Strong analytical mindset
Good communication skills and stakeholder management
Preferably experience working in a B2C environment




Benefits

Salary up to ‚Ç¨60k
Travel allowance
27 vacation days
Hybrid work environment
Flat organizational structure
Social drinks and lunch events




Interested? Contact me via glenn@doghouse-recruitment.nl




Unfortunately, No Visa Sponsorship / Client is not IND registered yet

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Are you ready to embark on a journey to make measurable impact for customers? In this role you will delve deeper into understanding the organization and the stimulating work environment, ready for personal development. This organisation optimises processes through data, focusing on simplicity and value creation. They fix this through process mining.




You:

Possess a Master degree in Economics, Computer Science, Business Administration, Economics, Mathematics or related.
Demonstrate 2-5 years of professional experience in a comparable role within data consulting and process mining.
Show enthusiasm for the realms of big data, predictive analysis, process mining, and ongoing enhancement.
Exhibit fluency in both English and Dutch (preferred).
Have intermediate proficiency in Business Analytics or Data tooling.
Enjoy both socializing over drinks and delving into statistical analysis with equal fervor.




Offer:

Salary to ‚Ç¨65K
Unlimited budget for personal development;
Hybrid working;
Unlimited holidays;
Home office budget.

Title: Data Visualization Analyst
Description:
Company Overview

Join WorldACD, a thriving and dynamic company on the forefront of the air cargo industry. We are expanding and seeking highly motivated individuals to be part of our growing team. As a Data Visualization Analyst, you will play a crucial role in our data team. Based in the vibrant center of Amsterdam, WorldACD operates in a fascinating international environment, collecting, analyzing, and publishing market data about air cargo worldwide. As the world's largest air cargo market database manager, we are ambitious to further grow our benchmark information services and product portfolio, serving customers on all continents and engaging with diverse cultures.¬†




Position Overview

We are looking for a skilled Data Visualization Analyst who is passionate about transforming complex data into actionable insights through compelling visualizations. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, visualization tools, and storytelling, with the ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders across all levels of the organization.




Responsibilities

Clean, prepare, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights.
Design and develop interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations using tools such as Tableau and Power BI including using DAX and/or VizQL.
Translate business requirements into intuitive and visually appealing visualizations that convey key insights.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data visualization and analytics.

Qualifications¬†

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field, is preferred.
Enthusiastic and intrinsically motivated, Creative thinker.
Eye for detail, and passionate about design.
Excellent visual skills, including demonstrable design knowledge, such as layout, colour and design.
Structured, analytical approach to problem-solving and a high attention to detail.
Proven experience as a Data Visualization Analyst or similar role.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau/Power BI including sheet swapping and other advanced techniques.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Excellent communication and storytelling abilities, with a keen eye for design and aesthetics.
Experience of programming in languages such as C#/Javascript and/or experience with database queries and SQL is a bonus.

¬†

Benefits‚ÄØ¬†

Active in a fascinating & dynamic international environment.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Serving customers on all continents, dealing with a wide variety of cultures.
Ambitious to further grow its benchmark information services and products portfolio.
Office in the city center of Amsterdam.




How to Apply

If you are passionate about data visualization and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment, we encourage you to apply for the Data Visualization Analyst position at WorldACD. Please submit your resume and a (short) cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are a good fit for the role. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
ü™ê Discover our galaxy

Malt is Europe's leading freelancing platform with one clear mission: to give people the freedom to choose who they work with. Co-founded in 2013 by Vincent Huguet, with Alexandre Fretti as co-CEO since 2022, Malt is a tech company with a human approach that helps companies and freelancers make the perfect match.

Malt is a marketplace that embraces a community of over 700,000 freelancers and over 70,000 clients, ranging from small and medium-sized enterprises to large corporations. More than just a connector, our marketplace streamlines freelancer-client communications, simplifies administrative and legal tasks, expedites invoicing and payments, and so much more.

We are all about giving both freelancers and companies choice and added peace of mind, so that every experience on Malt is nothing less than (inter)stellar. The launch of Malt Strategy in 2023 enabled Malt to broaden its scope by offering the expertise of a network of top independent consultants and transition managers, to better support companies from the strategy to the implementation of ambitious projects.

‚ú® Malt is also‚Ä¶


a tech company with a human approach
a company with a strong culture fueled by 700 Malters from 40+ nationalities, working from 9 countries all around Europe - Germany, Belgium, United Arab Emirates, Spain, France, Netherlands, Nordic countries, United Kingdom, and Switzerland
committed to creating a safe and inclusive space where every employee can thrive both personally and professionally
committed to equality and diversity (50% of People managers are women)
a company with strong career path policies allowing all Malters to develop and grow equally
backed by renowned investors including ISAI, Serena, Eurazeo Growth, Goldman Sachs and BPI France




Join us on Planet Malt, we need you to help us write this next chapter! ü™ê

Explore your future career üî≠

You would be part of Malt‚Äôs data team, an international team of about 30 people, with various profiles, including 7 data analysts, analytics engineers, data engineers, data scientists, and economists... The team is led by Claire Lebarz, Chief Data & AI Officer @ Malt, and former Head of Data @ Airbnb.

Join us and become part of the #FutureOfwork!

Key Responsibilities ‚ú®


Develop a deep understanding of our freelancers and clients and how they interact with each other and with our product
Be a partner to product and business teams across the marketplace, helping them to better understand their performance through strategic analytics and structured thinking
Support our most strategic topics with deep-dive analytics, insights, recommendations
Empower the teams across Malt to answer data questions quickly and easily by building high-quality ground truth data sets, metrics and dashboards.
Contribute to the modelization of our databases and semantic layer along with analytics engineers
Be a key member of the data team, helping spread the data and AI culture within Malt




About You üßë‚ÄçüöÄ


You have a Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, Operations Research) or in Business
You have +5 years of experience as a data analyst in a fast-paced and quantitative environment (start-up, scale-up, consulting‚Ä¶)
You consider yourself a full-stack data analyst: You write SQL perfectly, you know how to work with ETLs, you‚Äôve been using data modelization tools such as dbt, you can write simple Python scripts‚Ä¶ You are also very comfortable in using data visualization tools (e.g. Looker, Metabase, Tableau‚Ä¶)
You have strong communication (written and oral), presentation-building and storytelling skills
You are fluent in English
You are curious and eager to learn new things and grow




What makes you different from others? ü´µ


You have good business acumen, but you also have a ‚Äúhacker‚Äù mindset, you enjoy leveraging technology to find solutions to problems
You have a growth mindset: you are comfortable in navigating and excelling in fast-paced environments with no playbook for success
You have an ability to influence people, but you are also a strong team player




How to join the mission? üöÄ


Screening with Alex, our Tech Talent Acquisition Manager, to better understand your background, aspirations and answer your questions (45 minutes)
Take home technical assessment with the Data Director (Gautier Chenard), one Data Analyst and another member of the data team (60mn)
Past Presentation project and restitution to the Data Director, one member of Ops team and one Product Manager (1h)
Interview with Claire, our Chief Data Officer (30mn)




Malt is the perfect space to thrive personally and professionally üí´


Onboarding: Before easing into your new role, you‚Äôll spend your first week learning about our culture, products, and services with other onboardees at our office in Paris
Equity: Every Malter is entitled to stock options
Lunch vouchers (legal benefit): ‚Ç¨9/day on your Swile card
Transportation (legal benefit): 50% reimbursement (any type of transport)
Healthcare insurance (legal benefit)
RTT: From 8 to 12 days off

Ready? Get your ticket to Malt ü™ê

HTML:
ü™ê Discover our galaxy

Malt is Europe's leading freelancing platform with one clear mission: to give people the freedom to choose who they work with. Co-founded in 2013 by Vincent Huguet, with Alexandre Fretti as co-CEO since 2022, Malt is a tech company with a human approach that helps companies and freelancers make the perfect match.

Malt is a marketplace that embraces a community of over 700,000 freelancers and over 70,000 clients, ranging from small and medium-sized enterprises to large corporations. More than just a connector, our marketplace streamlines freelancer-client communications, simplifies administrative and legal tasks, expedites invoicing and payments, and so much more.

We are all about giving both freelancers and companies choice and added peace of mind, so that every experience on Malt is nothing less than (inter)stellar. The launch of Malt Strategy in 2023 enabled Malt to broaden its scope by offering the expertise of a network of top independent consultants and transition managers, to better support companies from the strategy to the implementation of ambitious projects.

‚ú® Malt is also‚Ä¶

  • a tech company with a human approach
  • a company with a strong culture fueled by 700 Malters from 40+ nationalities, working from 9 countries all around Europe - Germany, Belgium, United Arab Emirates, Spain, France, Netherlands, Nordic countries, United Kingdom, and Switzerland
  • committed to creating a safe and inclusive space where every employee can thrive both personally and professionally
  • committed to equality and diversity (50% of People managers are women)
  • a company with strong career path policies allowing all Malters to develop and grow equally
  • backed by renowned investors including ISAI, Serena, Eurazeo Growth, Goldman Sachs and BPI France



Join us on Planet Malt, we need you to help us write this next chapter! ü™ê

Explore your future career üî≠

You would be part of Malt‚Äôs data team, an international team of about 30 people, with various profiles, including 7 data analysts, analytics engineers, data engineers, data scientists, and economists... The team is led by Claire Lebarz, Chief Data & AI Officer @ Malt, and former Head of Data @ Airbnb.

Join us and become part of the #FutureOfwork!

Key Responsibilities ‚ú®

  • Develop a deep understanding of our freelancers and clients and how they interact with each other and with our product
  • Be a partner to product and business teams across the marketplace, helping them to better understand their performance through strategic analytics and structured thinking
  • Support our most strategic topics with deep-dive analytics, insights, recommendations
  • Empower the teams across Malt to answer data questions quickly and easily by building high-quality ground truth data sets, metrics and dashboards.
  • Contribute to the modelization of our databases and semantic layer along with analytics engineers
  • Be a key member of the data team, helping spread the data and AI culture within Malt



About You üßë‚ÄçüöÄ

  • You have a Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, Operations Research) or in Business
  • You have +5 years of experience as a data analyst in a fast-paced and quantitative environment (start-up, scale-up, consulting‚Ä¶)
  • You consider yourself a full-stack data analyst: You write SQL perfectly, you know how to work with ETLs, you‚Äôve been using data modelization tools such as dbt, you can write simple Python scripts‚Ä¶ You are also very comfortable in using data visualization tools (e.g. Looker, Metabase, Tableau‚Ä¶)
  • You have strong communication (written and oral), presentation-building and storytelling skills
  • You are fluent in English
  • You are curious and eager to learn new things and grow



What makes you different from others? ü´µ

  • You have good business acumen, but you also have a ‚Äúhacker‚Äù mindset, you enjoy leveraging technology to find solutions to problems
  • You have a growth mindset: you are comfortable in navigating and excelling in fast-paced environments with no playbook for success
  • You have an ability to influence people, but you are also a strong team player



How to join the mission? üöÄ

  • Screening with Alex, our Tech Talent Acquisition Manager, to better understand your background, aspirations and answer your questions (45 minutes)
  • Take home technical assessment with the Data Director (Gautier Chenard), one Data Analyst and another member of the data team (60mn)
  • Past Presentation project and restitution to the Data Director, one member of Ops team and one Product Manager (1h)
  • Interview with Claire, our Chief Data Officer (30mn)



Malt is the perfect space to thrive personally and professionally üí´

  • Onboarding: Before easing into your new role, you‚Äôll spend your first week learning about our culture, products, and services with other onboardees at our office in Paris
  • Equity: Every Malter is entitled to stock options
  • Lunch vouchers (legal benefit): ‚Ç¨9/day on your Swile card
  • Transportation (legal benefit): 50% reimbursement (any type of transport)
  • Healthcare insurance (legal benefit)
  • RTT: From 8 to 12 days off
  • Sports: Company participation to a Gymlib membership
  • Malt sabbatical: Every three years, Malters is entitled to a one month paid sabbatical leave
  • Free books: If you‚Äôre interested in learning more about any topic relevant to Malt‚Äôs business, just tell us the books you‚Äôd like to read, and we‚Äôll order them for you‚Äîwithout any questions asked or approval processes to follow
  • Remote work: Hybrid remote policy
  • Annual team building events



Ready? Get your ticket to Malt ü™ê

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Tiqets is one of the fastest-growing tech scale-ups in the Netherlands. To keep it moving fast and making culture more accessible, we‚Äôre hiring a Data Analyst to join us!




Who are we?

We are revolutionizing the way people buy tickets to unforgettable experiences at the best destinations all over the world. Our technology makes planning easy for thousands of travelers to find all the experiences they don't want to miss during their trip (museums, zoos, theme parks, and more), so they can book all their tickets in one place.




We are an international company committed to making culture accessible to our customers and our employees. We embed diversity, equity, and inclusion into our company fiber organically.

These values are promoted from the inside out and we strive to represent and honor differences in gender, race, religion, and sexual orientation in our company culture, our content, and our product.




Our values

We are remarkable: Have fun, be creative and celebrate great moments!
We are accessible: Communicate honestly and support each other
We are adaptable: Learn, adapt, and pivot. That's who we are!




What you will do




The Data Team is responsible for supporting the data needs of many teams at Tiqets by helping them become more data-driven in how they operate. As a Data Analyst on the Data team, you will have the opportunity to work on various interesting problems related to Supply Acquisition, Supplier Portal User Analysis, A/B Testing, Reporting, Marketing Campaign Optimization, and much more.




You will work closely with Product Owners, Developers, Marketeers, and Merchandising Specialists to uncover insights about the business, build new hypotheses, and help Tiqets improve through an iterative process of testing and learning.

If you are passionate about Data, enjoy working on challenging business problems in a fast-moving environment, and believe in the importance of teamwork, this is the right opening for you.




Responsibilities




Deep dive into large business datasets to uncover valuable insights that can be turned into actionable hypotheses
Design and implement data models with SQL in DBT
Build explores and dashboards in Looker to allow others at the company to be able to ask the right data questions
Work with Product Owners, Developers, Marketeers, and Merchandising Specialists to determine and measure the right metrics in their respective domains
Keep a close eye on the ever-changing data challenges at Tiqets, and collaborate closely with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and other Data Analysts on the team to solve them
Educate and empower others at the company to be more self-reliant for their data needs
Mentor others in the team with technical guidance
Collaborate on the architectural evolution of the Tiqets data model and reporting framework




Qualifications




Technical or mathematical education at a Bachelor's or Master's level
3+ years of experience in Data Analyst roles
Experience with DBT.
Strong SQL skills; Experience working with a modern Data Warehouse like Redshift, Snowflake, or Databricks
Experience building reports on BI tools like Looker or Tableau.
Excellent oral and written communication skills; Ability to clearly explain concepts and actionable insights
Capacity to thrive in a startup/scale-up environment, adapt quickly, work independently, and take ownership of your work
Nice to have: prior experience in e-commerce with a background in hypothesis-driven A/B Testing




Perks & Benefits at Tiqets




Vibrant, dynamic, international working environment
Bright, welcoming office located in Amsterdam, 5 minutes by foot from Amstel station
Opportunity to make an impact in an award-winning tech scale-up company
20% personal Tiqets discount code for all of our products
Biweekly pizza & beer sessions to expand our knowledge with useful presentations from various team members
Friday drinks and parties to celebrate our accomplishments, our well-known annual ski trip
Pension scheme and travel compensation
Daily fresh lunch buffet provided by Join Program
Hybrid working model
Sport activities: free gym, running sessions, boot-camp, football, climbing, yoga, paddle and more
Reimbursement home workspace necessities




Get in touch!

Please send your application via the form on this vacancy. We can‚Äôt wait to hear from you!

Are you representing an agency? Thank you for your interest in our job offer. However, we are handling the recruitment process internally and do not require external assistance at this time.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Description

Ring Europe is looking for a talented marketing analyst, capable of discovering new data insights, designing key KPIs, creating impactful data visualization and bringing our marketing analytics to the next level.

As our Marketing analyst, you will be responsible for key analytical projects and business intelligence in the marketing domain. You will have hands-on experience in digital marketing platforms such as Google, Meta and Bing and are knowledgeable about the latest developments in SEO and digital ads in the industry. You are a marketer at heart but you are also a data expert, writing complex database queries to explore internal / external data sources in order to validate business hypotheses.

This role resides in the BI and Analytics team. You will closely co-work with the Marketing and Business Development teams, along with other business stakeholders, ensuring that Ring optimises its marketing investment to achieve the best return.

Key job responsibilities

Working closely with the marketing, web analytics and business development teams, you will solve unique analytical problems and find answers to questions that require tenacious problem-solving skills and creativity.

What You'll Do


Enhance existing marketing measurement and design KPIs to best measure marketing effectiveness and budget efficiency
Collaborate closely with the marketing team to dive deep into areas such as SEO, funnel analysis and attribution models that will enhance marketing performance using data analytics; then make actionable recommendations
Research industry best practices, the latest tracking trends (such as cookies) and analytical measurement tools
Create and maintain marketing-related Tableau dashboards
Work with the data engineering team to maintain and enhance the internal marketing data platform and data models
Explore and review internal and external marketing data sources to ensure data quality; devise mechanisms and tools to monitor data integrity on a large scale
Conduct ad hoc research and root cause analyses in fields such as user behaviour and web traffic
Assist with preparing quarterly business review documents
Coordinate & facilitate data supply to CMO


Basic Qualifications


Experience in tax, finance or a related analytical field
Experience in Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau
Experience in business or financial analysis
Bachelor's degree or equivalent
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Experience with Excel
Experience with SQL
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in financial/business analysis


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.


Company - Ring of Security B.V.

Job ID: A2687951

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
THIS IS YOUR JOB

As Data Analyst at Effectory you will be improving the working lives of millions of people by leveraging employee data to help companies make better decisions, optimize operations, gain insights, and achieve strategic objectives. In this role you can apply your knowledge of analyzing and interpreting HR- and employee-data in a variety of ways.

This role divides its time between the Product Development and Consulting with separate but overlapping responsibilities. Formally you will be part of the Data Team, that is part of Product Development.

The role of Data Analyst has 3 areas of responsibility:

Product Development (50%)

Collaborating with our data scientist, you will develop data-driven enhancements for our products and services, leveraging our data in innovative ways. Your contributions can include constructing predictive and descriptive models that empower our customers to better understand, interpret, and act on their survey results.

This role involves tasks such as data collection, pre-processing, and conducting various types of exploratory analysis using survey data, metadata, and web analytics. You will have the creative freedom to incorporate additional external data as needed. Making data visible through dashboards and reports is crucial for our product's success, and you will design innovative dashboards based on the data you collect and analyze, providing valuable insights to our customers.

Data Analysis for Thought Leadership (25-40%)

For 2024 and beyond, our team of consultants aims to strengthen our thought leadership capability. Building on our historical data, benchmarks, and numerous studies, we have a wealth of relevant and interesting data to share more (pro-)actively, something our customers expect from us and frequently inquire about.As a Data Analyst you will collaborate closely with our Consultant - Thought Leader to investigate hypotheses and create relevant insights. We share these insights with our marketing and sales teams, use them to present during events as well as for our customer facing teams, helping them in both their commercial and advisory tasks.

Custom Data Analysis for Customers (10-25%)

Although we do not actively offer custom data analyses to customers, around 30 enterprise customers per year request custom analyses based on our research, sometimes in combination with their own data. This sometime involves doing an intake with the customer and possibly also an explanation of the findings.

THIS IS YOU

You Are An Experienced Data Analyst With At Least 3 Years Relevant Work Experience. You Have a Master‚Äôs Degree, With a Quantitative Character, Like For Instance Econometrics, Mathematics, Or Data Science. Next To That


You have experience with modern data analysis tooling such as Python, R, Jupyter Notebooks, SQL, Databricks.
Experience in the different phases of the analysis life cycle: data collection, extraction, cleaning and preparation, statistical methods for analysis, visualization and reporting and data modeling predicting
Strong analytical skills and a proactive, results-oriented mindset.
Good communication skills in English.
If you have experience in the field of HR/Employee data that is a plus


THIS IS US

Effectory is Europe‚Äôs leading employee feedback solution. With our platform, HR and management we collect employee feedback throughout the employee journey. This feedback is transformed into people analytics that informs strategies to boost productivity, engagement and retention. Built on 25 years‚Äô experience, our 200 specialists in Amsterdam and Munich support more than 1,200 organizations in 110 countries. Now more than ever, HR is an integral part of business strategy, which is why our feedback solution is tailor-made for strategic HR.

Effectory‚Äôs mission

We are dedicated to improving the working world by giving employees a voice and making sure their feedback has an impact. Our experts work with HR teams and managers around the world, using employee feedback to overcome some of their biggest people-oriented challenges. From software engineers to HR specialists, every day Effectory‚Äôs people work to improve the working world, and we are looking for talented individuals who also want to be part of this mission.

This Is What We Offer


A monthly salary (the range for this position is around‚ÄØ‚Ç¨ 45.000 - ‚Ç¨ 65.000 gross a year based on full-time employment depending on your experience).
An annual bonus scheme.
25 holidays for FTEs, and flexible public holiday options.
A fun and interactive onboarding program to get to know our company and some of your new colleagues.
A learning budget to spend on your own personal development. We also provide extensive professional and personal development opportunities and organize yearly summer and winter schools.
Flexible working: you will be able to work max 60% of your contract hours from home (or any other location in the Netherlands).
Budget to set up your home office.
Yearly Body & Mind budget to spend on anything that energizes (or relaxes) you.
Annual events, such as our Winter Party, Summer Party & the legendary Big Day.
Additional monthly compensation for working from home.
The option to work abroad for up to 4 months, and to take an unpaid sabbatical.
You get your birthday off work and can also take a day to volunteer for a cause of your choice.


This is a part-time position for 32 hours (4 days) and with a start date as soon as possible.

Please note that we cannot provide visa sponsorship or relocation for this position.

This Is How It Works


‚ÄØYou want this job: submit your application via the link below
‚ÄØWe are intrigued: join a phone or video call to get to know each other a bit better and to ask questions
‚ÄØWe all think it went well: we now meet live (or in a video call) to get to know each other a bit better
‚ÄØWe want to see you in action:‚ÄØyou complete a case/assessment (if applicable)
‚ÄØThe final hurdle: we agree on terms & conditions, we sign and you start!

Description:

Submit


You will become part of the frontrunner in the energy transition, where you contribute to a more sustainable future by building on the growth and development of Eneco's integration platforms
You know how to transform ideas into realization
You will implement the desired Data & Analytics solution(s) that will be realized on our state of the art data platform



Why choose for Eneco?

Why choose Eneco? We want to accelerate the energy transition. With our ambitious ‚ÄòOne Planet plan‚Äô, we have made it clear that by 2035, we aim to be the first energy company to become CO2-neutral. No more reliance on natural gas! The entire Netherlands is making the switch. Towards smarter, cleaner, and more sustainable energy. Everyone has their own reasons for doing so. Some want to contribute to a better climate, others switch because their neighbors are doing it, or because they find joy in saving energy, and we're doing it now!

At Eneco, we want to help everyone to take the next sustainable step. And we are looking for the best people who can make that possible. People who are enthusiastic about our mission of 'sustainable energy for everyone' and who want to further develop their talents at Eneco. We want everyone to be able to participate effortlessly in the energy transition. This can only happen if we better assist our customers, remove barriers for them to become more sustainable by listening and understanding their true needs.

Digital innovations help the market align supply and demand and make it as easy as possible for users. Data plays a crucial role in this. From the Data & Technology Services department, we are working to make Eneco a data-driven organization that bases its decisions and actions on customer, product, asset, and market data.


What You‚Äôll Do

Our Data Services department is responsible for executing data projects for the Business and fueling the growth of data capabilities by acting as an incubator for the development of data products. You have a pivotal role in multiple projects.


You translate the requirements from the Business into data driven solutions where you'll be designing data models (e.g., Canonical, Data Vault, Data Mart) that supports these requirements.
Activities of the Data Analyst are primarily scoped on translating data, reporting and dashboard requirements to suitable data & analytics solutions for business usage.
The Data Analyst is a critical thinker who keeps on asking 'why' questions until it is completely clear what the Business wants to achieve.



Is this about you?


At least 5 years of relevant experience as a data or information analyst
Strong experience with SQL.
Deep understanding of business concepts, processes and data entities
Solid experience with data analysis, information analysis and business/process analysis
Extensive knowledge and experience with the application of data concepts, data models and data warehouse concepts
Excellent communication skills and good command of the English language, spoken and written



You‚Äôll be responsible for


Drafting and proposing business requirements and (non) functional requirements regarding required data products.
Translates requirements into appropriate functional specifications and functional designs into Data & Analytics solutions and, where necessary, applies prototyping as a basis for business acceptance and technical implementation of the data solutions.
Designing (logical) data models in line with Eneco's Canonical Data Model to support the realization or adjustment of the (technical) data models (Data Vault, Data Marts) in our data platform.
Providing stakeholders with proactive advice on new or existing data solutions and, together with architecture, ensures the application of the correct solution direction.



This is where you‚Äôll work

Data & Technology Services has multiple departments Data Services has 3 teams ‚Äì an enterprise datamanagement team, a data analytics team and a data engineer team. You will be part of the data analytics team that assist the business in using the various parts of the Enterprise Data Platform effectively to create customer and business value.


What We Have To Offer

Gross annual salary between ‚Ç¨70.000 and ‚Ç¨95.000

Including 8% holiday allowance, a good pension and parental leave.

FlexBudget on top of your gross salary

Have it paid out, use it to buy extra holiday days or save it up for something nice - it's up to you.

Personal and professional growth

Eneco is fully committed to help you in your personal and professional development.

Hybrid working, at home or in the office

You work 40% at the office and 40% at home. The other day you decide what works best for you.


Work that works for you and the climate

If you decide on a career at Eneco, you are choosing ambition, growth and opportunities. You will have all the space you want to improve yourself and do your job the way that suits you best, which includes having a good work-life balance. You can work to a flexible schedule and work partly from home if your role allows it.

That is how you can work on your own future and on the future of the world. After all, you and your 4,000 colleagues are committed to our mission: climate neutrality by 2035. We assist customers to accelerate their sustainability efforts, devise innovative solutions and seize opportunities with both hands. Are you ready?


The stages of our application procedure:


Want to know more about this job function?

We understand that you may want to learn more before taking the next step in your career. Therefore, we encourage you to reach out to our recruiter, Mark van Dommelen. Whether you have questions about the interview process, the specific duties and responsibilities of the role, or are simply curious about the company culture, we are here to answer all your inquiries.

For the recruitment of this position, we prefer to handle the process internally and do not wish to collaborate with external parties.


Questions About The Application Procedure

Feel free to contact our recruiter:

Mark van Dommelen

Title: Business Data Analist
Description:
Business Analist Controlling

Een baan waarbij je direct in de kern van het bedrijf zit, kunt werken met Big Data en mooie dashboards. Wij hebben een vacature voor een Business Analist Controlling op de afdeling Commercial Control, Margin Control & Pricing waarbij al deze aspecten aan bod komen. En nog veel meer!







Dit ga je doen

De focus van je job ligt op business en data analyse betreffende de omzet van DHL eCommerce Benelux op totaal en op detail niveau. Het mooiste aan je werk? Je werkt mee om het bedrijf financieel nog sterker te maken. Dat doe je door:

‚Ä¢ Beoordelen van de kwaliteit van beschikbare data en informatie vanuit de bronsystemen en platformen en het signaleren van afwijkingen.

‚Ä¢ Ontwikkelen en verbeteren van dashboards en rapportages met betrekking tot de volledigheid en kwaliteit van de omzet en ter ondersteuning van het management.

‚Ä¢ Vertalen van de aanwezige data en informatie naar (voor Finance relevante) intelligence.

‚Ä¢ Beoordelen van de kwaliteit van de tarifering van onze producten.

‚Ä¢ Doen van voorstellen om de geconstateerde issues op te lossen en te voorkomen. Hiertoe zet je acties uit bij sales en facturatie.

‚Ä¢ Medeverantwoordelijk voor informatievoorziening van de afdeling CMCP, en daarmee indirect voor de belangrijke stakeholders zoals Sales, Finance en General management.







Jouw nieuwe werkplek

Je rapporteert rechtstreeks aan de Director Commercial Control. Het team bestaat met jou erbij uit 15 personen. Een divers team van business controlling, analyse en pricing specialisten, dat nauw samenwerkt met diverse stakeholders, onder andere met de afdelingen sales en product development. Je begeeft je in een data-intensieve wereld waarbij jij het verschil kan maken!




Jij bepaalt zelf waar je jouw laptop openklapt. Er is altijd plek voor je op een van de locaties of op het hoofdkantoor. In ieder geval, waar je ook werkt: we luisteren √°ltijd naar wat je te zeggen hebt. Hoe meer perspectieven en meningen we horen, hoe beter we daar allemaal van worden. Zo hebben we als organisatie dit jaar het certificaat Great Place to Work gekregen. Deze certificering is 100% gebaseerd op feedback van medewerkers.




Dit ben jij

Het omgaan met complexe vraagstukken/ analyses is voor jou een uitdaging en data analyse is jouw ding! Jij bent initiatief nemend en streeft ernaar om continu verbeteringen door te voeren. Daarnaast heb jij alle vrijheid om nieuwe idee√´n en initiatieven in te brengen en te ontwikkelen. Dit wordt dan ook volop gestimuleerd. Je beschikt over organisatiesensitiviteit en kan goed inschatten wat de perspectieven van andere belanghebbenden zijn. Je bent klantgericht en het onderhouden van management relaties is een kracht van je. Je hebt affiniteit met het transformeren van data tot informatie (data warehouse) en als je ervaring hebt met Dashboarding en Business Intelligence is dat zeker een pre.




Verder heb jij:

‚Ä¢ Een afgeronde hbo of wo opleiding (bij voorkeur richting bedrijfseconomie / Finance);

‚Ä¢ 1 a 2 jaar relevante werkervaring, bij voorkeur in een Finance omgeving;

‚Ä¢ Uitstekende taalvaardigheid in het Nederlands en Engels;

‚Ä¢ Gedegen ervaring met MS Office met nadruk op Excel en ervaring met SQL en MS Power BI is een pre.










Dit krijg jij

Een uitdagende rol, binnen een sterk groeiende organisatie. Bouw jij de komende jaren mee aan de verdere ontwikkeling van DHL eCommerce? Dan bieden wij jou:

‚Ä¢ Een startsalaris tussen ‚Ç¨ 3200,- en ‚Ç¨ 3600,- bruto per maand, afhankelijk van jouw kennis en ervaring;

‚Ä¢ Standaard 23 vakantiedagen en een cao a la carte, waarbij je een je extra budget kunt inzetten voor vrije dagen, salaris of opleiding;

‚Ä¢ En andere aantrekkelijke voorwaarden, zoals een bonusregeling, pensioen- en ziektekostenregeling, een fietsplan en korting bij onze klanten;

‚Ä¢ De mogelijkheid om flexibel en thuis te werken te werken, waarbij de standplaats ons hoofdkantoor in Utrecht zal zijn;

‚Ä¢ Kansen en mogelijkheden voor ontwikkeling en doorgroei, zowel nationaal- als internationaal!







Solliciteren?

Bij interesse ontvangen we graag je CV en motivatiebrief. We zullen daarna zo snel mogelijk contact met je opnemen.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Samskip is a truly international company that innovates the most advanced sustainable and multimodal international transport solutions. With a turnover of more than 800 million euros, 1450 employees and offices in 24 countries (in Europe, North America, Asia and Australia) we are one of the largest transport companies in Europe. Within this structure, Samskip has shaped a comprehensive European network for short-sea, road, rail and inland waterway transport. This network provides pioneering sustainable, reliable and cost-effective options for the growing number of customers who demand more environmentally conscious logistics solutions.

As an experienced Data Analyst, you'll play a crucial role in driving data excellence. Your responsibilities will span a diverse range of tasks, all contributing to the success of our data initiatives.

Responsibilities:

Lead data modeling efforts to ensure accuracy and reliability in reporting.

Provide key support in data transformation projects.

Mentor and guide other Data Analysts within the team.

Act as the primary liaison between Business Analysts and Data Engineers, collaborating closely with the Data Architect.

Translate complex business requirements into practical data-driven solutions.

Effectively communicate insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Requirements:

Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.

Demonstrated experience in data modeling and visualization, particularly within a logistics or supply chain context.

Proficiency in data visualization tools (preferably Power BI) and statistical analysis tools.

Previous experience mentoring or leading a team of Data Analysts.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for effective collaboration across cross-functional teams.

Join us in shaping the future of data-driven decision-making!

Are you passionate about uncovering the hidden stories within data? Do you thrive on leading by example to bridge the gap between business objectives and data-driven solutions? If so, then this is your call to action! Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Data (Marketing) Analyst-Betting Company- SaaS- Hybrid- Amsterdam- 60k




My client is the premier destination for sports betting and the ultimate online (live) casino experience in the Netherlands. As pioneers in the industry, they are committed to reshaping entertainment while maintaining responsible gambling. Their goal is to create an environment where players can enjoy themselves responsibly without losing control.




Keywords: SQL, Python, GCP, Marketing Mix Models, B2C, Stakeholder Management, Analytical Skills.




An exciting opportunity awaits a Data Analyst to have a significant impact on attracting more consumers through online marketing campaigns in an Amsterdam-based online betting company. Collaborate closely with the Head of Data Analytics, who is enthusiastic about sharing knowledge with you.




In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing dashboards and data to understand where the customers are coming from and how to retain them. You will work on marketing mix models and marketing touch attribution to optimize our marketing strategies and improve player engagement.




The IT infrastructure is state-of-the-art, utilizing all that Google has to offer, including Google Analytics, cloud resources, and data warehousing. Your responsibilities include analyzing, building, and automating new solutions.




Requirements:

3+ years of experience in data analysis (SQL & Python)
Strong analytical mindset
Good communication skills and stakeholder management
Preferably experience working in a B2C environment




Benefits

Salary up to ‚Ç¨60k
Travel allowance
27 vacation days
Hybrid work environment
Flat organizational structure
Social drinks and lunch events




Interested? Contact me via glenn@doghouse-recruitment.nl




Unfortunately, No Visa Sponsorship / Client is not IND registered yet

Title: Global BI & Analytics Internship
Description:
GLOBAL BI & ANALYTICS INTERNSHIP

AMSTERDAM, COTY HQ

At Coty, we are seeking a motivated Global BI & Analytics Intern to join our team. This internship is designed for students who are eager to dive into the world of data and analytics on a global scale. The ideal candidate has a strong passion for data, an analytical mindset, and a desire to contribute to the global adoption of analytics tools such as Power BI within the organization. As an intern, you will work with our Business Facing BI team at our Headquarters in Amsterdam-Zuid, the Netherlands. The internship will begin in September 2024.

About Coty

We‚Äôre Coty, one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, and skin and body care. Coty is the global leader in fragrance and number three in color cosmetics. Coty‚Äôs products are sold in over 150 countries around the world. Coty and its brands are committed to a range of social causes as well as seeking to minimize its impact on the environment.

About

About the Business Facing BI Team in Amsterdam

The Business Facing BI team plays a pivotal role in implementing a variety of business intelligence and data analytics solutions to enable data-driven decision-making globally. Despite our small size, we are a diverse team with bases in both Amsterdam and New York City. We are committed to continuous learning and the adoption of cutting-edge technologies in the data space, cultivating a dynamic work environment where innovation propels Coty‚Äôs success through insightful data analysis.

What We Offer

At Coty, we offer an exceptional opportunity for our Global BI & Analytics intern to gain hands-on experience specifically with Power BI in a vibrant and dynamic environment. This internship provides exposure to complex BI projects utilizing Power BI, enabling significant business transformations. The intern will receive direct mentorship from the Business Facing Power BI Manager, fostering both personal and professional growth. Additionally, you'll benefit from an inclusive, supportive work environment that encourages collaboration and innovation with Power BI at its core. This is a unique chance to deepen your expertise in a key BI tool and to network with global professionals, potentially opening doors for future opportunities within the industry.

Requirements


Student (Bachelor/Master), it is important that you remain enrolled with your university.
Demonstrated passion for data and an interest in specializing in Power BI.
Strong analytical skills and proficiency with numbers.
Familiarity with data analysis tools such as Excel, Python, and R is highly advantageous.
Keen eye for detail to ensure high-quality, aesthetically pleasing outputs.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English


Period

This internship is full-time (40 hours per week), for a duration of 5-6 months and starts from August/September 2024. Remote working is possible up to 50% of your time, in alignment with your line manager. You will receive an internship allowance and NS Business Card if you do not have a student public transport card. The internship can be combined with a thesis but be aware that this will largely have to be done in your own time.

Interested?

At Coty, we believe in equality and inclusion for all, and stand together with those fighting for freedom, justice, and equal rights regardless of who you are or who you love.

Our people make us who we are. They are the brightest minds bringing the boldest ideas to life every day. If you‚Äôre the kind of person who refuses to settle, if you want to think bigger, learn faster and go further than you ever thought possible ‚Äì we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Please send us your motivation letter together with your CV, stating your availability and for how long.

Title: Transportation Data Analyst (Citymapper)
Description:
At Citymapper (powered by Via), we‚Äôre on a mission to help make complex cities more accessible to everyday users. Our application transports millions of people in hundreds of cities around the world by giving them access to the most current and sophisticated transportation options available. We make getting around your favorite city easy, so that you can enjoy the ride.

As a Transportation Data Analyst at Citymapper, you will be managing the data that is the backbone of our application‚Äôs success. Y our work directly impacts our user experience, and is the difference between a user seeing a bus drive away, or reaching it just in time. Millions of users around the world trust our application to be on time for work, a job interview, or a date - and we take great responsibility in fulfilling that need.

This job can be done remotely if you're based in England, the Netherlands, Germany or Bulgaria. If you prefer hybrid, we have offices in London, Berlin, Paris, Amsterdam, and Sofia.

What You'll Do:


You will help to manage the timetable data that powers the Citymapper application. Using proprietary tools and methods, you will transform often messy transit schedules into shiny and reliable user information.
You will build, validate and ship data to production on a daily basis.
You will manage data in a range of cities and across different formats.
You will work with our engineers to build for scale by improving tools and automating tasks.
You will ensure data quality in our web and mobile products so that users continue to love and trust Citymapper.


Who You Are:


You have a passion for public transportation and cities, and an interest in how public transportation networks operate.
You are comfortable dealing with large data sets, and have an eagerness to learn new data skills.
You take a hands-on, practical, pragmatic attitude to your work.
You have exceptional attention to detail, and an ability to communicate those details to other collaborators.
You have up to 3 years of experience working with data, Python and/or common transit data formats (GTFS, TransXChange, Siri, Hafas, etc).


Compensation and Benefits:


Becoming part of Via, a company that was awarded for its commitment to social good
Joining the team working on the industry-leading mobile app that is loved and trusted by millions of users
State of the art hardware for you to perform your work worry free
Ongoing support and training to ensure you have the resources you need to thrive and progress in your career
A hybrid or remote work model. Remote work is possible if you're based in one of these countries: England, Germany or Netherlands
Competitive compensation
Monthly health stipend
25 vacation days


We‚Äôre Via, and we build technology that changes the way the world moves. We pioneered the TransitTech category to ensure that the future of transportation is shared, dynamic public mobility ‚Äî the kind that reduces carbon emissions across congested cities, minimizes reliance on private cars, and provides everyone with accessible, efficient, and affordable ways of getting around.

We created the first end-to-end TransitTech solution for cities and transit agencies, offering world-class software, service design, and operational expertise to fundamentally improve the way the world moves.

Via was founded with the guiding principle that we go further when we go together. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. If you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. All backgrounds, identities, and voices are welcomed and celebrated at Via.

Ready to join the ride?

Via is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a data analyst, you will have a central role contributing to many decisions that we make every day. You develop actionable, data-driven insight for optimisation of our creative campaigns, discovering hidden opportunities, or digging into the root cause of a discrepancy. You make sound arguments, supported by data for taking or discarding an opportunity.We are looking for a motivational candidate who can support our multidisciplinary teams finding actionable insights from our data and also work on developing new tools that help our company improve business performance from our Amsterdam office.ResponsibilitiesSupporting our cross-functional teams. This includes developing and maintaining dashboards, generating reports, preparing data visualizations, and using data to forecast or guide business activity. Our main tools for this are Redshift (SQL) and Quicksight.Find actionable insights on our data and communicate them to improve and optimize our business.Design, build/improve and maintain internal projects built in Python, such as our early alerting system or our IP targeting optimization project. Both projects are currently being used within the company for error monitoring and process optimization respectively. And if you feel brave enough you can help to deploy them with Docker and Airflow!Qualifications

You should have a passion for coding, optimizing for business value and enjoy solving problems and building correct, extensible and simple solutions that match our scale and load.You should be proficient with Python and SQL. Having 3+ years of relevant experience as an analyst and/or software developer.Several of our projects are being built using Django, would be a plus if you have previously worked using this framework as we are continuous developing these projects.We use AWS suite (Redshift as our main analytical database along a swarm of EC2 to keep our services alive), Docker, Git, Airflow so a basic understanding of these technologies would be a nice to have.You are able to work in a fast-paced and multicultural environment where the main working language is English so fluency in verbal and written English is a must.A competitive salary in line with market conditions and your skills and experience.Although this position isn't remote, we offer flexible working schedules.Established in 2006, we are a market-proven, well-established, international company with an informal culture. We trust our team members to get the job done, how they do it is up to them.We invest in the personal development of each Sam Median by taking courses, attending conferences, and other learning opportunities;We have regular team(building) events, including lunches, monthly office birthday celebration, and a yearly company trip.We have a creative office in the heart of Amsterdam with tasty coffee, tea, fresh fruit, daily fresh lunch, and beers on Friday afternoons.We offer visa sponsorship and a comprehensive relocation package when applicable.Hiring organization

Employment TypeFull-timeJob LocationStay tuned!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our employees talk trash all day, every day.

That‚Äôs why we love them!

Orbisk employees do talk trash a lot. To be more precise, they discuss reducing food waste in the hospitality industry. How does the Orbi work in practice? Waiters scan cleared plates at Orbisk hardware stations, and our algorithms throw themselves on the leftovers to determine when ingredients were thrown away and in what quantity. Food for (actionable) thought because if we ‚Äì for example ‚Äì discover that guests aren‚Äôt into tomatoes but devour every last spec of avocado, restaurateurs can source smarter, reducing food waste and costs. We‚Äôve already helped eliminate a whopping 737.520 kg of food waste, and we‚Äôre just getting started!



As our Data Analyst, you'll step into the role of our groundbreaking 'data detective' - the nickname we made up for the analyst who transforms complex data into clear, actionable insights for our product. Partnering with our Data & AI team, you will be responsible for transforming complex data sets into user-friendly insights that drive strategic decision-making and operational efficiency.

Additionally, we invite you to use your expertise to improve our data usability and enhance overall data quality. We want Orbisk to become a well-known name in the global hospitality business, and we believe you can help us achieve that goal.

Our Product: The Orbisk Dashboard

Our product is a data-rich dashboard that shows all the waste registered by one or multiple of our Orbi‚Äôs. We can slice and dice this data in many different ways. As you can imagine, one Orbi registering waste is quite straightforward, but as we grow we now face the challenge of customers with increasingly complex environments, like waste from more than 200 different Orbis in different locations, time-zones, currencies and other (cultural) differences.

In this role, you'll become an expert in the data collected by the Orbi food waste monitor. You will frequently participate in food waste coaching sessions with our customers, assisting the Orbisk coaches in understanding customer data to maximize the value we can extract for them. Besides addressing hands-on data requests, you will also be responsible for systematically identifying common patterns in how customers successfully utilize the provided data. You will then translate these insights into new features that enhance our product's effectiveness. Do you feel like you are ready to bite down into this great international data challenge?

The role in 6 bullets


Analyze data from multiple Orbi's to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for waste reduction.
Develop and maintain intuitive, data-rich dashboards that provide clear insights into food waste metrics.
Work closely with our product owner, developers, and other stakeholders to implement data-driven solutions.
Continuously seek ways to improve data collection, analysis processes, and reporting accuracy.
Conduct user research to understand the needs and behaviors of our clients, ensuring our data solutions are aligned with their goals.
Propose and implement innovative data analysis methodologies and tools to enhance our service offerings.


Your track record mentions


You've been in the data game for 3+ years.
Masters or bachelors degree in a technical field, such as data science or computer science.
The magic, or ability to convert questions or requirements into comprehensive data reports, dashboards, or other data solutions.
Thorough and meticulous approach to understanding data nuances, complexities, and the necessity for accurate reporting.
You're a "masterchef" when it comes to data analysis frameworks and tools such as SQL, Python, dashboarding solutions, and data visualization.
Big plus: experience with data-heavy products, where extracting value from data requires innovation beyond standard reporting and dashboarding.


Why join Orbisk?

For a whole menu of reasons. Some lofty (reducing food waste also reduces our collective CO2 and H2O footprints), others more down-to-earth. After all, joining a scale-up that disrupts an entire industry is also just plain fun. And a great conversation starter. Especially if that team is as driven and adventurous as ours. We also offer you:


‚Ç¨4.500 - ‚Ç¨6.000 gross p/m (depending on knowledge and experience)
Pension scheme and 30 paid vacation days (based on 40 hours per week)
Company laptop and ‚Ç¨250 netto home office budget per year
Education & Alleo budget, and a travel allowance
Free office lunch and an office dog to keep you company
An office based in Utrecht and option to work partly remote
A young and creative startup work environment that invests in your development
A close-knit team with smart, enthusiastic colleagues who are happy to share their expertise with you. And on Fridays, a (non-alcoholic?) beer or two.


Get to know us

We can‚Äôt wait to tell you more about our plans. Reach out by clicking on that apply button or contact Doƒüu Colak via Whatsapp +31 6 38711496.

Title: Junior BI Analyst
Description:
HousingAnywhere is Europe‚Äôs largest mid-term rental platform. With Kamernet and Studapart under its umbrella, it represents three fast-growing brands with over 30 million yearly unique visitors combined, 160,000+ properties available for rent and 100,000+ tenants securing their new homes, based on the 2022 performance. HousingAnywhere serves young professionals and students, primarily aged between 18 and 35, connecting them with accommodation providers. Through its advanced technology platform, tenants rent accommodation for 3 to 12 months outside of their country of origin. Headquartered in Rotterdam, HousingAnywhere operates in most European cities and recently expanded to key cities in the US, establishing a presence in over 125 cities. Driven by the mission to enable people to live wherever and however they choose, thanks to a flexible renting experience, the technology scale-up employs 340 professionals globally.

Our missionRent Easy, Live Free.

We are empowering people to live wherever and however they choose. To find comfort and peace of mind on the other side of the world or the other side of town. All while feeling confident and totally at ease, whatever their adventure might involve. We are doing it by creating a new standard of renting. Safe. Harmonious. More options. Less hassle. With the help of our trusted networks of landlords and partners.

Our Values

Ownership

We are Enablers

We are Changemakers

We are Connectors

Your role & ImpactWe are looking for an enthusiastic BI analyst that is ready to take his technical skills to the next level by delivering analytics solutions to stakeholders across multiple business domains. With the support and guidance from senior data analyst, you will carry out end-to-end data solutions to solve dynamic business problems.Our Data Analytics and Business Intelligence team is formed by six analysts from diverse backgrounds and experience levels. We collaborate closely with data engineers, analytics engineers, and data scientists to extract insights and drive informed decision-making.

Assist in designing and developing BI solutions using tools like SQL, Power BI, Tableau, or similar.

Gather and analyse business requirements from stakeholders.

Create and maintain BI reports, dashboards, and data visualisations.

Perform data cleansing, transformation, and modeling to ensure data accuracy and consistency.

Assist in data warehouse design, development, and maintenance.

Support data integration processes between different systems and sources.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver actionable insights.

Conduct data quality assessments and implement data governance best practices.

Assist in troubleshooting and resolving technical issues related to BI solutions.

Document processes, procedures, and technical specifications for BI solutions.

Your Profile

At least 2 years of experience in BI, data analytics or similar roles.

Strong understanding of database concepts and SQL querying.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or related field is preferred.

Familiarity with BI and data visualisation tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar.

Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.

Ability to analyse complex datasets and derive actionable insights.

Excellent communication skills to collaborate with stakeholders and translate business requirements into technical solutions.

Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and quality.

Eagerness to learn new technologies and stay updated on industry trends in BI and analytics.

Previous internship or academic projects related to BI, data analytics, or database management is desirable.

What‚Äôs in it for you

Diverse international community (46+ nationalities).

Hybrid working policy.

Unlimited paid holidays, minimum-based not maximum.

1,000 EUR personal development budget.

Complete coverage for commuting.

Personal equipment, including laptop and ergonomic setup.

Gym membership discount with GoVital or OneFit.

Variable pension scheme.

Dutch/English classes budget.

Fun team-building and after-work drinks every Friday.

Note: Relocation assistance is not available for this position.

If you have further questions, please email

y.kaboorappan@housinganywhere.com

By applying to work at HousingAnywhere, you agree to our

Candidate Privacy Policy

We collaborate closely with data engineers, analytics engineers, and data scientists to extract insights and drive informed decision-making.

Assist in designing and developing BI solutions using tools like SQL, Power BI, Tableau, or similar.

Gather and analyse business requirements from stakeholders.

Create and maintain BI reports, dashboards, and data visualisations.

Perform data cleansing, transformation, and modeling to ensure data accuracy and consistency.

Assist in data warehouse design, development, and maintenance.

Support data integration processes between different systems and sources.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver actionable insights.

Conduct data quality assessments and implement data governance best practices.

Assist in troubleshooting and resolving technical issues related to BI solutions.

Document processes, procedures, and technical specifications for BI solutions.

Your Profile

At least 2 years of experience in BI, data analytics or similar roles.

Strong understanding of database concepts and SQL querying.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or related field is preferred.

Familiarity with BI and data visualisation tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar.

Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.

Ability to analyse complex datasets and derive actionable insights.

Excellent communication skills to collaborate with stakeholders and translate business requirements into technical solutions.

Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and quality.

Eagerness to learn new technologies and stay updated on industry trends in BI and analytics.

Previous internship or academic projects related to BI, data analytics, or database management is desirable.

What‚Äôs in it for you

Diverse international community (46+ nationalities).

Hybrid working policy.

Unlimited paid holidays, minimum-based not maximum.

1,000 EUR personal development budget.

Complete coverage for commuting.

Personal equipment, including laptop and ergonomic setup.

Gym membership discount with GoVital or OneFit.

Variable pension scheme.

Dutch/English classes budget.

Fun team-building and after-work drinks every Friday.

Note: Relocation assistance is not available for this position.

If you have further questions, please email

y.kaboorappan@housinganywhere.com

By applying to work at HousingAnywhere, you agree to our

Candidate Privacy Policy

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Our client is a dominant organization on the global trading market, performing both high-frequency- and traditional trading on the different financial markets. Data is of essence for the trading teams as their strategy and their trades are based on historical and live data. The organization is currently forming a new data quality team, that is going to focus on the quality of the data that is delivered to the trading teams (the quant researchers and the traders).




We are looking for ambitious data analyst that like to join a fast-paced and high performing organization. In the team you will work on complex (big) data sets where you mainly leverage SQL and Python to prepare/optimize the data for business insights.




We are looking for people with:




-Strong analytical thinking, preferably backed up with a degree within the STEM field.

-1-3 years of experience in Data analysis

-Strong experience both SQL and Python

-Excellent communicator and capable to communicate with both stakeholders from both the business and technical perspective.




Are you looking for complexity? Big data sets? Make a real impact, daily, with the analysis you create? Want to strive for excellence together with your colleagues? Please apply!




Location:

The team is mainly working on site in the Amsterdam office.

Salary is up to 80k +package (including bonus and indefinite contract).

Relocation is possible and funded
