Title: Data-analist
HTML:
Bij Roompot Landal GreenParks geloven we dat data de sleutel is tot nieuwe kansen en een katalysator voor innovatie. Door deel te nemen aan ons vooruitstrevende team, zullen jouw inzichten een cruciale rol spelen in het vormgeven van onze strategische initiatieven en het stimuleren van zakelijke groei. Als je enthousiast bent om jouw analytische expertise toe te passen in een dynamische omgeving, is deze rol op maat voor jou gemaakt.


De Data Analist bevordert data-gedreven besluitvorming door het analyseren, construeren en publiceren van inzichten met behulp van geavanceerde Business Intelligence-tools voor analyse, dashboards en rapportage. Deze rol fungeert als een brug tussen business en IT, vertaalt zakelijke vereisten naar IT (BI) oplossingen met behulp van diverse analyse- en rapportagetools. De Data Analist begrijpt en benut Landal-datasets, stelt standaarden en sjablonen vast en promoot de oplossingen bij de business en key users. De Data Analist rapporteert aan de Team Lead IT Application Development.


Daarnaast ontdekt en verkent de Data Analist kansen voor nieuwe inzichten door projectmatige samenwerking met de business, en zorgt zo voor verbeterde data-ge√Ønformeerde besluitvorming. Deze positie omvat zowel ontwikkelings- als adviesrollen.

Verder ben je verantwoordelijk voor:


  • Het verfijnen van user stories met betrekking tot de inzichten en rapporten die nodig zijn voor Landal Business Users, met focus op zowel strategische als tactische niveaus. De Business Users omvatten de Raad van Bestuur en afdelingsmanagement;
  • Het opstellen van rapporten en dashboards met behulp van geavanceerde tools om de nodige inzichten te bieden, volgens de agile werkwijze van het team;
  • Het adviseren van de Business Users over het gebruik en de interpretatie van analytische tools en resultaten;
  • Het promoten en uitleggen van dashboards en BI-oplossingen aan Business Users en Key Users;
  • Het introduceren en gebruiken van sjablonen en standaarden voor de Landal rapportage- en analyseomgeving;
  • Het identificeren en verkennen van kansen voor nieuwe inzichten;
  • Het mede verantwoordelijk zijn voor de optimale inrichting, effici√´nt gebruik en continue ontwikkeling van onze data- en analyseomgeving;
  • Het fungeren als schakel tussen IT en de business om nieuwe kansen te ontwikkelen en te implementeren.


Wat vragen wij:

  • Bachelor- of masterdiploma in een kwantitatief geori√´nteerd vakgebied zoals Informatica, Business Information Management, Computer Science, Engineering of een verwant vakgebied van een gerenommeerde instelling in Nederland of daarbuiten;
  • Aantoonbare expertise als Data Analist, met een sterke achtergrond in het opvragen en analyseren van uitgebreide datasets;
  • In staat om effectief te communiceren met zowel business als IT, de behoeften en prioriteiten van beide te begrijpen en de communicatiekloof tussen hen te overbruggen. In staat om zakelijke behoeften te vertalen naar BI-oplossingen;
  • Bekwaam in het begrijpen en analyseren van kritische (complexe) data en vraagstukken door logisch redeneren, het identificeren van oorzaken, het leggen van verbindingen, het overwegen van verschillende perspectieven en het onderscheiden van hoofd- en bijzaken;
  • Sterke expertise in het bieden van analyse en rapportage met behulp van tools zoals Power BI, DBT, Databricks, Power Apps of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het verbinden en benutten van data voor dashboarding, met begrip van dataverhoudingen;
  • Kennis van SQL, Data Modeling en Semantic Models is een pre;
  • Ervaring met het cre√´ren van uitgebreide bedrijfsrapporten en dashboards.


Wat wij bieden

  • Een jaarcontract met een proeftijd van een maand, met mogelijkheid tot vast dienstverband;
  • Bonusregeling;
  • 27 vakantiedagen, met de optie om 10 extra dagen bij te kopen;
  • Flexibele werktijden en mogelijkheden voor remote werken;
  • Thuiswerkvergoeding van ‚Ç¨2,35 per thuiswerkdag;
  • Reiskostenvergoeding van ‚Ç¨0,23 per kilometer, of volledige dekking voor openbaar vervoer;
  • Uitgebreide trainingsmogelijkheden, zowel online (150+ e-learnings) als offline;
  • Deelname aan het Recreatie Pensioenfonds, pensioenleeftijd 67 jaar, met premies gelijk verdeeld;
  • Betaald aanvullend ouderschapsverlof en zwangerschapsverlof;
  • Diverse collectieve verzekeringen, waaronder een doorlopende reisverzekering voor jou en je gezin;
  • Gunstige werknemerskorting op boekingen.


Roompot Landal GreenParks

Wij zijn Roompot Landal GreenParks, de marktleider in de vakantieparken- en recreatiebranche. Met meer dan 300 prachtige vakantieparken in 11 landen, bieden we een breed scala aan accommodaties, van vakantiehuizen en bungalows tot campings. Onze gezinsvriendelijke parken beschikken over uitgebreide recreatieve voorzieningen, sportactiviteiten, entertainment en eetgelegenheden. Ons doel is om gasten een onvergetelijke vakantie-ervaring te bieden in een prachtige, natuurlijke omgeving.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (100% Remote - EU)

Remote Working (within EU)

12-Month Fixed-Term Contract

Up to ‚Ç¨65,000 per annum

I am partnering with a leading Bioscience client in the Netherlands who is committed to revolutionizing healthcare through cutting-edge research and innovation. They are seeking a talented Data Analyst to join their dynamic team and contribute to impactful projects that drive their mission forward.

Key Skills And Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in transforming data into actionable insights. You will work remotely within the EU, collaborating with cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making processes. Your expertise in Power BI, BigQuery, Looker, and SQL will be essential in developing and maintaining dashboards, performing complex data analyses, and providing strategic recommendations.


Develop, design, and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI, BigQuery, and Looker.
Conduct in-depth data analyses to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical solutions.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through rigorous validation and quality checks.
Optimise and streamline data processes for efficiency and effectiveness.
Communicate findings and recommendations to non-technical stakeholders clearly and concisely.


Must-Have


Minimum 2-3 years of experience in Data Analytics within a highly driven environment.
Proficiency in Power BI, BigQuery, Looker, and SQL.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Fluent English (written/spoken)
Ability to work independently and remotely while managing multiple tasks and deadlines.
Experience in the Bioscience or healthcare sector is a plus.


If you are passionate about data analytics and eager to make a difference in the Bioscience sector, I would love to hear from you! Please submit your CV detailing your experience and fit for this role as soon as possible. Only EU candidates need apply-100% Remote for EU Candidates only.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Een baan als Data Analist bij Digital Power

Als Data Analist bij Digital Power help je verschillende organisaties om beslissingen te maken op basis van data. Het is jouw taak om complexe informatie vanuit verschillende domeinen te vertalen in heldere en concrete actiepunten. Jouw doel is om ervoor te zorgen dat beslissingen niet meer worden genomen ‚Äòop onderbuikgevoel‚Äô maar op basis van feitelijke data.




Je werkt in multi-disciplinaire teams met collega‚Äôs van Digital Power en/of klantteams. Wij vinden het belangrijk om kennis met elkaar te delen. Hierdoor ontwikkel jij je razendsnel. Maar we verwachten ook een actieve bijdrage van jou! Dit doe je op je eigen manier, bijvoorbeeld door training te geven of junior collega‚Äôs te coachen.




Naast je opdracht(en) maak je deel uit van onze interne community. Leer van, en m√©t je collega‚Äôs en help elkaar n√≥g beter te worden! Kom je ergens niet uit? Dan staat ons hele team voor je klaar.




Wie we zoeken

Passie voor data

Je duikt graag in de off- √©n online data van organisaties
Je krijgt energie van het omzetten van data naar bruikbare inzichten
Je kunt data helder analyseren, visualiseren en uitleggen




De nodige ervaring

Je hebt minimaal 1 jaar werkervaring als Data Analist
Je hebt ervaring met visualisatietools zoals PowerBI of Tableau en/of (web)analyse tools zoals Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics
Je bent communicatief vaardig en in staat om organisaties te helpen meer datagedreven te werken




What else?

Je vindt het leuk om bij verschillende opdrachtgevers aan de slag te gaan: van NGO's tot aan marketingbureaus en van banken tot aan overheidsinstanties
Ervaring met SQL is een pr√©
Je bent leergierig en altijd bezig met je eigen ontwikkeling
Je denkt na over wat de vraag √°chter de vraag is
Je vindt een goede sfeer op je werk n√©t zo belangrijk als je vak
Je krijgt goede energie van onze ‚Äòwerken bij‚Äô pagina
Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal goed in woord en geschrift
Een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding




Wat we bieden

We bieden een startsalaris van ‚Ç¨ 3200 ‚Äì ‚Ç¨ 6500 bruto per maand, afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring.

Onbeperkt opleidingsbudget en je eigen werktijden indelen: kijk hier wat we je nog meer allemaal bieden.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Data Analist bij Tremoot

Bij Tremoot zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren Data Analist met uitgebreide ervaring in Power BI. Als je gepassioneerd bent over data visualisatie en graag werkt in een dynamische omgeving waar kwaliteit en privacy/security hoog in het vaandel staan, dan is deze rol perfect voor jou.




Waarom Tremoot?

Platte Organisatie: Geniet van directe en duidelijke communicatie.
Cultuur: Maak deel uit van een nieuwsgierig, betrokken en persoonlijk team. Voel je thuis!
Ontwikkeling: We benadrukken groei en ondersteunen voortdurende certificering en kennisdeling.
Plezier: Doe mee aan leuke teamuitjes en regelmatige bijeenkomsten die de teamgeest versterken!
Diversiteit en Inclusie: Ervaar een levendige mix van culturen met ons team van expats en externe medewerkers.
Gemeenschap: Bij Tremoot ben je meer dan alleen een medewerker - je bent een essentieel onderdeel van onze levendige gemeenschap.




Wat bieden wij?

Contract: Een vaste rol binnen een vooruitstrevend team.
Salaris: Competitief salaris dat past bij je ervaring en vaardigheden.
Reiskostenvergoeding: NS-businesskaart voor je reisbehoeften.
Vakantiedagen: 25 vakantiedagen om te ontspannen en op te laden.
Technologie: Je ontvangt een bedrijfslaptop voor professioneel gebruik.
Leren: Profiteer van een jaarlijks budget van ‚Ç¨1000 voor professionele ontwikkeling.




Jouw Rol als Data Analist:

Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van datavisualisaties en rapportages met Power BI en Power BI Report Builder.
Samenwerken in Agile/Scrum teams om projecten te realiseren die voldoen aan de hoogste normen van kwaliteit en privacy/security.
Analyseren van data om inzichten te verschaffen die strategische besluitvorming ondersteunen.




Wat heb je nodig?

Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring.
Ervaring met data analyse en visualistie met PowerBI en PowerBI Report Builder.
Bekend met Agile en Scrum en kunt dit in de praktijk toepassen.
Nauwkeurig werkend, met oog voor kwaliteit en privacy/security aspecten.
Beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift.
HBO werk- en denkniveau.




Ge√Ønteresseerd?

Ben je klaar voor een nieuwe uitdaging en wil je deel uitmaken van een vooruitstrevend team? Solliciteer nu bij Tremoot! We kijken ernaar uit om je aan boord te verwelkomen en zien uit naar jouw bijdrage aan onze gemeenschap!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your data management skills have an impact on our 9.5 million customers.

You and your job

As a Data Analyst working on SPOT you are the primary contact with our stakeholders, which are mostly consumers of the data in your data warehouse. You guide consumers in the usage of the data, validate new requirements of the business stakeholders and guide the (IT-) implementation of new initiatives. The Data Analyst represents customer and end-user concerns by gathering input from stakeholders to understand the problem to be solved. You may also help to identify potential areas of automation and support or advise the business in re-engineering the underlying business process.

Practical examples


You will take responsibility for data elements for their end-to-end usage across the enterprise
You do not involve just a single role but include a network of people with accountabilities for ensuring that all aspects of an effective data environment are being accomplished
You will tackle various data related issues and you will work on global and cross functional change projects to improve our processes and systems


Facts & figures


36 per week as standard (other options can be discussed)
43,822 Rabobank colleagues around the world


Example Responsibilities


You monitor, validate and where needed correct the data provided by your data warehouse.
You focus on ensuring BCBS239 compliancy.
You define data requirements and give input to project scope/objectives through research, fact finding and elicitation with a solid understanding of business, systems, and requirements.
You provide high impact (strategic and tactical) advice for the Product Owner.
You participate in testing of changes against requirements.
You represent the department and your team and act as a liaison between regulator and/or business needs, and the actual data.
You develop and maintain knowledge of business analysis and business requirements.
You continuously work to increase knowledge of and to be familiar with best practices.
You work with business users to ensure they can understand the data model and can use it to meet their needs


Together we achieve more than alone

Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. Our team brings talented people together from various nationalities and backgrounds. As our colleague you will tackle various data related issues and play a role in global and cross domain efforts to improve our processes and systems.

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our team within Chapter Data.

Joris, Data Analyst: ‚ÄúWorking as a Data Analyst for our teams in on our new data warehousing means working with data in an international environment during a large strategic transition. This involves the implementation of regulatory requirements, adherence to compliance and data management standards. Next to that accurately and timely processing of the data is key for meeting the reporting deadlines of our stakeholders.‚Äù

Our chapter brings a diverse, talented group of people to manage and develop the financial data platform of Rabobank. Working together is the way we work; as 1 data-minded team at Rabobank.

Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.

You and your talent


You have at least a Masters degree in Economics, Finance, Business Administration or a related (quantitative) field
You have knowledge of a range of banking products, preferably demonstrated by an industry qualification such as CFA or FRM
You have 3+ years of relevant banking experience within the financial industries sector
You have strong analytical and conceptual skills (databases, data warehouses and SQL)
You have knowledge of databases, data warehouses and SQL
You have knowledge of data management principles and how to implement them
You have strong communication skills in English, both spoken and written


This Is What We Offer You


a gross salary between ‚Ç¨ 3.711 and ‚Ç¨ 7,307.58 (scale 8, 9 or 10 depending on experience)
thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
an extra budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out
a pension scheme to which you contribute 5.5%


This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Data Analyst based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.

You and the job application process

We look forward to your response to the vacancy of Data Analyst at Rabobank.


Any questions about the job content? Contact: Ryan Bartlett, Chapter Lead via Ryan.Bartlett@rabobank.com. Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact: Lex Verwayen, Recruiter via Lex.Verwayen@rabobank.nl
You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/nl/veelgestelde-vragen.
A security check is part of the process.
We respect your privacy


#rabobank #data


Show more
HTML:
Your data management skills have an impact on our 9.5 million customers.

You and your job

As a Data Analyst working on SPOT you are the primary contact with our stakeholders, which are mostly consumers of the data in your data warehouse. You guide consumers in the usage of the data, validate new requirements of the business stakeholders and guide the (IT-) implementation of new initiatives. The Data Analyst represents customer and end-user concerns by gathering input from stakeholders to understand the problem to be solved. You may also help to identify potential areas of automation and support or advise the business in re-engineering the underlying business process.

Practical examples

  • You will take responsibility for data elements for their end-to-end usage across the enterprise
  • You do not involve just a single role but include a network of people with accountabilities for ensuring that all aspects of an effective data environment are being accomplished
  • You will tackle various data related issues and you will work on global and cross functional change projects to improve our processes and systems

Facts & figures

  • 36 per week as standard (other options can be discussed)
  • 43,822 Rabobank colleagues around the world

Example Responsibilities

  • You monitor, validate and where needed correct the data provided by your data warehouse.
  • You focus on ensuring BCBS239 compliancy.
  • You define data requirements and give input to project scope/objectives through research, fact finding and elicitation with a solid understanding of business, systems, and requirements.
  • You provide high impact (strategic and tactical) advice for the Product Owner.
  • You participate in testing of changes against requirements.
  • You represent the department and your team and act as a liaison between regulator and/or business needs, and the actual data.
  • You develop and maintain knowledge of business analysis and business requirements.
  • You continuously work to increase knowledge of and to be familiar with best practices.
  • You work with business users to ensure they can understand the data model and can use it to meet their needs

Together we achieve more than alone

Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. Our team brings talented people together from various nationalities and backgrounds. As our colleague you will tackle various data related issues and play a role in global and cross domain efforts to improve our processes and systems.

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our team within Chapter Data.

Joris, Data Analyst: ‚ÄúWorking as a Data Analyst for our teams in on our new data warehousing means working with data in an international environment during a large strategic transition. This involves the implementation of regulatory requirements, adherence to compliance and data management standards. Next to that accurately and timely processing of the data is key for meeting the reporting deadlines of our stakeholders.‚Äù

Our chapter brings a diverse, talented group of people to manage and develop the financial data platform of Rabobank. Working together is the way we work; as 1 data-minded team at Rabobank.

Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.

You and your talent

  • You have at least a Masters degree in Economics, Finance, Business Administration or a related (quantitative) field
  • You have knowledge of a range of banking products, preferably demonstrated by an industry qualification such as CFA or FRM
  • You have 3+ years of relevant banking experience within the financial industries sector
  • You have strong analytical and conceptual skills (databases, data warehouses and SQL)
  • You have knowledge of databases, data warehouses and SQL
  • You have knowledge of data management principles and how to implement them
  • You have strong communication skills in English, both spoken and written

This Is What We Offer You

  • a gross salary between ‚Ç¨ 3.711 and ‚Ç¨ 7,307.58 (scale 8, 9 or 10 depending on experience)
  • thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
  • an extra budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out
  • a pension scheme to which you contribute 5.5%

This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Data Analyst based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.

You and the job application process

We look forward to your response to the vacancy of Data Analyst at Rabobank.

  • Any questions about the job content? Contact: Ryan Bartlett, Chapter Lead via Ryan.Bartlett@rabobank.com. Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact: Lex Verwayen, Recruiter via Lex.Verwayen@rabobank.nl
  • You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/nl/veelgestelde-vragen.
  • A security check is part of the process.
  • We respect your privacy

Title: Data Analist
Place: Rotterdam‚ÄìThe Hague metropolitan area, South Holland, Netherlands
Description:
Data Analist




Ben jij een analytisch denker met een passie voor data? Heb je oog voor detail en wil je bijdragen aan datagedreven beslissingen binnen een dynamisch team? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!




Functieomschrijving:




Als Data-analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen, analyseren en interpreteren van grote hoeveelheden data. Je vertaalt complexe datasets naar begrijpelijke rapportages en biedt inzichten die de organisatie helpen strategische beslissingen te nemen.




Taken en verantwoordelijkheden:




Verzamelen en verwerken van data uit verschillende bronnen.
Uitvoeren van data-analyses om trends en patronen te identificeren.
Ontwikkelen van dashboards en rapportages om data-inzichten te visualiseren.
Samenwerken met diverse afdelingen om datagedreven oplossingen te implementeren.
Ondersteunen van het management bij het nemen van ge√Ønformeerde beslissingen.
Zorgen voor de integriteit en kwaliteit van de data.




Vereisten:




Afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding in een relevante richting (bijv. Data Science, Statistiek, Bedrijfskunde).
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring in een vergelijkbare functie.
Uitstekende kennis van data-analysetools en -technieken (bijv. SQL, Python, R).
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met Power BI en andere visualisatietools.
Sterke analytische vaardigheden en oog voor detail.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om complexe informatie duidelijk over te brengen.
Proactieve houding en probleemoplossend vermogen.




Wat wij bieden:




Een uitdagende en afwisselende functie binnen een groeiend bedrijf.
Mogelijkheden voor professionele en persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
Een competitief salaris en goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden.
Een inspirerende werkomgeving met gemotiveerde collega's.




Solliciteren:




Ben jij de data-analist die wij zoeken? Stuur dan je cv naar rhoving@visservanbaars.nl

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Role:



As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analyzing data that influences strategic decisions across our global operations. You will be at the forefront of extracting insights from complex data sets, utilizing advanced analytics tools like Excel and Power BI for dashboarding and reporting. This position involves close collaboration with our teams in China and other countries, requiring effective communication in English.



Key Responsibilities:


Develop, maintain, and manage advanced reporting, analytics, dashboards, and other BI solutions using Excel and Power BI.
Perform data mining and analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and insights, driving business decisions.
Collaborate with stakeholders across the globe, including China, to gather requirements and deliver data-driven solutions that address complex business challenges.
Enhance and streamline processes for data extraction, analysis, and visualization to improve efficiency and accuracy.
Optional: Leverage ServiceNow for integrating and automating workflow processes to enhance data management and reporting capabilities.


Requirements:


A relevant Master's degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field.
2-4 years of hands-on experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, preferably within a large international organization.
Proficiency in Excel and Power BI for data analysis, visualization, and dashboarding.
Experience with ServiceNow is highly desirable.
Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken, are essential for coordinating with our international teams.
Ability to work effectively in a hybrid work environment, demonstrating flexibility and adaptability to collaborate with global teams across different time zones.
A proactive approach to problem-solving, with a keen eye for detail and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.


We Offer:


A competitive compensation and benefits package.
A hybrid work model, providing the flexibility to work both remotely and in-office, tailored to support work-life balance.
Opportunities for professional development and career growth within a large international corporation.
A diverse and inclusive workplace culture, with a focus on employee engagement and satisfaction.


How to Apply:



In case you are interested in the role please apply with your most recent CV and contact details so we can get in touch about the positino.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
De vraag naar onze consultants blijft stijgen, en daarom zijn we op zoek naar nieuwe collega‚Äôs die samen met ons de uitdaging willen aangaan. Ben jij klaar om de volgende stap in je carri√®re te zetten? Dit is jouw moment!




Wij zoeken gedreven professionals voor een vast dienstverband als Data Analist, vari√´rend van junior tot senior.




Als data analist bij Seventrees ben jij de sleutelspeler die proactief aan de slag gaat met het achterhalen van requirements, het verzamelen en valideren van data, allemaal op locatie bij onze klanten in een commerci√´le of bestuurlijke omgeving. Bij Seventrees hebben we het gevoel dat AI niet alleen een trend is, maar de toekomst. Daarom bieden we niet alleen uitdagende projecten, maar ook de mogelijkheid om bij te dragen aan de AI-revolutie door middel van advies en implementatie.




Wie zijn wij?

Seventrees is niet zomaar een consultancybedrijf; wij zijn gespecialiseerd in het leveren van hoogwaardige consultants op het gebied van business analyse, data-analyse & engineering, project-, programma- en interim-management. Onze opdrachten vari√´ren van grootbanken en pensioenfondsen tot nutsbedrijven, ICT-bedrijven, E-commerce en overheid. Wij zijn een organisatie met een heldere visie: oog voor onze medewerkers, de klant √©n de sociale aspecten van het werk. Bij Seventrees hebben we ervaren medewerkers met technische, business- en commerci√´le expertise, en we bieden een platte organisatie waarbij coachende partners de dagelijkse leiding hebben. Iedere medewerker krijgt een persoonlijke coach, en we koesteren regelmatige contactmomenten waarbij het nuttige en het aangename samenkomen. Wij bieden jou de kans om nieuwe ervaringen op te doen en stappen te maken in je carri√®re.




Wie ben jij?

Jij bent een enthousiaste professional met tussen de 2-5 jaar werkervaring, die graag out-of-the-box denkt en pragmatisch is ingesteld. Je bent gewend om actief feedback te geven en te ontvangen, en je hebt de ambitie om jezelf continu te ontwikkelen.

Als data-analist ben jij de spil in financi√´le processen, lever je informatie en inzichten via rapportages en dashboards en voorzie je de business van antwoorden op data-gerelateerde vragen. Jouw vaardigheden stellen je in staat om (complexe) data op een heldere manier te presenteren ter ondersteuning van besluitvorming. Daarnaast denk je actief mee over business rules en weet je waar je de benodigde data kunt vinden. Je gedijt in een constructieve samenwerking binnen een multidisciplinair team en begrijpt als geen ander de klantbeleving en -behoefte.




Herken je jezelf in dit profiel? Solliciteer dan direct! Voor meer informatie kun je contact opnemen met Hendrik Jan van Dijk, COO.




Kwalificaties

Minimaal HBO werk- en denkniveau.
Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Data Analist.
Ervaring met SQL-server en advanced Excel.
Ervaring met SAS Enterprise Guide, Cognos Analytics of vergelijkbare reporting tools zoals Power BI of Business Objects.
Kennis van Python of andere talen is een pr√©.
Uitmuntende communicatieve vaardigheden in het Nederlands en Engels, zowel in woord als geschrift.
Analytisch sterk en flexibel.
Zelfstandig, ondernemend en goed in staat vooruit te plannen.
Kennis van datawarehouse concepten en data modelleringstechnieken.
Ervaring met verzamelen, ophalen, ordenen en inlezen van relevante data en controleren op correctheid.
Ontwikkelen van datamodellen.
Opstellen van rapportages, conclusies en aanbevelingen.
Initi√´ren en vormgeven van onderzoeken.
Verrichten van kwantitatieve en kwalitatieve onderzoeken.
Het proactief opzoeken van en afstemmen met de stakeholders.
Uitbrengen van advies aan het management

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're Creative Fabrica, a fast-scaling tech start-up from Amsterdam.




Our mission




Enable creativity by giving access to everything related to the creative process: inspiration, learning, creating, and sharing. The ‚ÄòCreative Inspiration Flywheel‚Äô




This creates a self-sustaining community that lives within the Creative Fabrica ecosystem.




About the platform




We launched in 2016 as a marketplace for fonts with a subscription service. In the last 8 years, we have been through tremendous growth, and we're just getting started!




We have scaled to 40 million+ monthly page views, over 20 million listed products, and 20000+ active designers.




Our focus is to create a platform for designers to offer exceptional high-quality content. We make their products searchable in unique ways. This allows our customers to speed up their workflow, allowing them to focus on what they love most: Creating.




Creative Fabrica is on the lookout for a dynamic, inquisitive, and driven Data Analyst who is eager to dive into the depths of data, uncover hidden insights, and contribute to our ambitious growth plans. Suppose you are passionate about turning data into compelling stories and making a tangible impact on business decisions. In that case, this is your opportunity to join an international team and shape the future of data analytics at Creative Fabrica.




In this role, you will be a key player in deciphering complex data, acting as a 'data detective' to uncover critical insights from vast data sets. You will be instrumental in enhancing our understanding of customers, improving our predictive capabilities, and driving growth.




What you will do:




Collect, manage, and maintain data sources, including internal databases and external datasets, to ensure data accuracy and currency.
Perform complex data analyses using statistical methods, machine learning algorithms, and data visualization tools to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Identify business challenges and develop analytical solutions to address these challenges and support decision-making.
Clearly and concisely communicate the results of analyses to stakeholders through reports, dashboards, and presentations.
Translate data findings into actionable recommendations for improving processes, products, or strategies.
Collaborate with teams within the organization, including IT, marketing, and operational departments, to understand data analysis needs and provide appropriate solutions.
Stay up-to-date with new technologies and methodologies in the field of data analysis and apply them to enhance analysis processes.




What you will bring:




Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field, such as statistics, computer science, mathematics, or a related field.
At least 2 years of industry experience.
Strong programming skills in SQL.
Experience with data visualization and data analysis tools.
Knowledge of statistical and machine learning techniques.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.




Nice to have:




Experience in complex modeling.
Strong programming skills, preferably in languages like Python, R, and/or other relevant tools.
Experience and/or understanding of DBT (Data Build Tool).




Let us take care of you.




Competitive Compensation: We believe that hard work, skills, and ambition should be fairly compensated.
Top-Notch Tools and Gear: You'll be equipped with everything you need: a top-of-the-line laptop, the latest collaboration tools, and stylish accessories to match.
Awesome Office: Based in a beautiful office in the center, working here means delicious lunches cooked by our very own chefs, plus access to our own CF library to keep the learning going.
And a great team: We work hard and have fun together. On Fridays, we kick off the weekend together at the local bar, but there's more; we regularly organize events and company trips, creating opportunities to bond and build meaningful connections.




Is this you?




Get in touch! We'd love to speak to you.




You can apply by clicking the "Apply now" button.




Creative Fabrica is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Data & Analytics Consultant
Description:
Sia Partners is a specialist Management Consulting firm created in 1999 and has grown into a global firm with approximately 2800 employees and annual revenue exceeding $400m. Our culture is strongly orientated towards high-quality expertise and delivering excellent results and outcomes for our clients, which include a wide range of multinational companies. Our global presence and our expertise in more than 40 sectors and services allows us to accompany clients worldwide. Using innovative technologies such as our own in-house apps, social networks, and digital tools, we provide a truly integrated global service.

Through Consulting for Good, we put our expertise at the service of our clients' climate objectives and make sustainable development a performance lever for our clients. Our portfolio of offerings is cross-sectors and 17 % of our revenue is generated from engagements with a CSR focus.






Job Description



Who will you be working with?
The Amsterdam Data Science team is young, diverse and growing. You will work in a team that challenges you and invests in your professional development. We have a flat structure and rely on the entrepreneurial spirit of our colleagues. Taking the initiative is strongly encouraged. We strive for well-being, diversity and knowledge sharing within the team, so that we can grow together.

What you are going to do
As a Data & Analytics Consultant, you will work with our Data Scientists, Data Engineers and other consultants at Sia Partners, on various client projects in multidisciplinary teams. You will use your analytical mindset and data skills to solve complex business problems and deliver actionable insights.

Responsibilities include:

Work closely with Siaconsultants on assignments with an analytical challenge
Identify business problems by extracting, interpreting and explaining insights from data
Develop statistical and analytical methods to solve specific operational problems
Ensure that the deep insights generated from advanced analytics translate into business impact
Present results and conduct workshops at customer sites

Who you are

You want to make business impact, not only by doing data analysis, but also by making recommendations through inspiring presentations
You have the ability to adapt quickly and work across different business areas within a challenging environment
You have exceptional analytical and quantitative problem solving skills
You have the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
You have excellent communication skills and can present complex concepts in a synthetic way
You have a good track record of leadership in an academic, professional or extracurricular setting.


Qualifications



What you need

Completed WO Master's degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Business Analytics or a related field of study.
You are a young graduate or already have several years of experience in a similar position.
Good skills in Python and at least one other analytical language (e.g. R, SQL)
Experience with data visualization and reporting (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)
Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques or optimization is a strong plus
Fluent in English and Dutch, both written and oral. Additional languages are a strong plus.

What we offer

Training opportunities to develop yourself further
Opportunities to work on international assignments
Flexible working hours
A meritocratic approach to promotion
Performance related bonus
An attractive package (e.g. lease car, health insurance, pension scheme)


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position

Non-Dutch speaker will unfortunately not be accepted

Sia Partners is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: Senior Claims Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a strategic thinker to join our team as a Senior Claims Data Analyst to support our Customer Operations department. This role supports our EU and US claims and customer service operations and can be based in either the Netherlands or the UK.




As a Senior Claims Data Analyst, you will lead complex projects, extract actionable insights from data, and support financial planning within the claims experience landscape, and more broadly across the Customer Operations organization. This role is perfect for a visionary data strategist who‚Äôs passionate about leveraging next-generation technological solutions, optimizing existing processes, and facilitating collaboration across our Product,Claims, Ops, and Data teams. You will report into the centralized Operations enablement group, and work cross functionally with senior stakeholders to drive key initiatives from ideation to completion. You'll play a pivotal role in delivering a superior claims experience, driving operational excellence, profitability, and innovation within our operations.




What you‚Äôll do

Project Leadership: Lead complex projects, aligning them with business goals and maintaining stakeholder relationships.
Financial Analysis: Support financial strategy through analysis and forecasting, impacting budget and capacity planning.
Data Analysis & Reporting: Analyze claims data, and transform raw data into actionable insights.
Claims Support: Identify trends in claims data and support the operational Claims function.
Business Intelligence: Design reporting systems, improve MI quality, and support strategic decisions.
Compliance & Improvement: Ensure regulatory compliance, participate in market initiatives, and suggest process improvements.
Effective Communication: Effectively communicate complex information to a wide audience using Google Presentations and documentation on a regular basis.




What you‚Äôll need

5+ years in a similar role, within the insurance industry or a comparable regulatory environment.
Strong project management with a track record of leading complex projects
Advanced data analysis skills for informed decision-making.
Exceptional problem-solving, communication, and collaboration skills.
A willingness to take on additional duties as needed, contributing your unique experiences to help achieve our goals.

Title: Data Analyst - ‚Ç¨75 hourly (Tableau, PySpark) - freelance
Description:
Data Analyst - Tableau/Pyspart



A Data Analyst is called to join a global client to become a part of an international team

As a Data Analyst you will be working on Tableau, data preparation, analysis and reporting, being busy with creating and editing dashboards, evaluating data quality, building parts of analytical systems and presenting the insights to the stakeholders.


The initial duration of the assignment is 6+ months with an option to extend.
Rate is up to ‚Ç¨75, hourly based on 40hours/week
Location : NL; Based on a hybrid setup with weekly visits to the office in Amsterdam (Central station)

Core requirements : Tableau, Pyspark / Spark SQL; knowledge of Data automation tools (Oozie, Airflow) and ML (model evaluation methods, model explainability) is a plus.

Title: Data-analist
Place: Nederhorst den Berg, North Holland, Netherlands
Description:
Een rol met impact: die heb je als Data Analist bij 123inkt.nl

Data inzichtelijk maken is helemaal jouw ding. Jij vindt logica in een wirwar van cijfers, je brengt structuur aan en brengt data tot leven in heldere rapportages. En dat allemaal bij een van de toonaangevende webwinkels van Nederland!




Wat ga je doen?

123inkt.nl groeit hard en hiermee groeit ook de vraag naar inzichtelijke data. Je duikt niet alleen in de data van 123inkt.nl, maar ook van onze andere shops wereldwijd. Je haalt de juiste dataset uit de SQL-database, verwerkt deze en vertaalt dit naar een duidelijke rapportage in onze BI-tool (Power BI). Met je scherpe analytische blik cre√´er je overzicht uit chaos en adviseer je verschillende teams binnen het bedrijf. Je speelt een cruciale rol in het automatiseren van processen, waardoor we slimmer en effici√´nter kunnen werken. Jouw inzichten stellen 123inkt.nl nog beter in staat om risico‚Äôs in te schatten en beslissingen te nemen.




We zijn een zelfstandige afdeling, maar werken nauw samen met allerlei andere afdelingen en hebben onderling dan ook veel contact. Samen met de andere Data Analisten zoeken we naar oplossingen, helpen we elkaar bij query‚Äôs en dashboards en bedenken we gave dingen. Heb je zelf goede idee√´n of initiatieven waardoor we nog slimmer naar de data kunnen kijken? Dan is er altijd ruimte om dat te onderzoeken. Dankzij de open, informele sfeer voel je je snel thuis bij ons.

Wat vragen wij?

Je hebt een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding, het liefst in de richting van Business of IT.
Je hebt minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring.
Je hebt ervaring met SQL en BI-tools (zoals Power BI).
Je bent analytisch ijzersterk, herkent snel patronen en je bent commercieel ingesteld.
Je spreekt en schrijft uitstekend Nederlands en Engels.




Wat bieden wij?

Een uitdagende functie in een sterk groeiend bedrijf.
De kans om je verder te ontwikkelen.
Uitstekend salaris en een aantrekkelijke pensioenregeling (wij betalen 75% van de premie).
Mogelijkheid tot reiskostenvergoeding.
25 vakantiedagen o.b.v. fulltime dienstverband.
Flexibele werktijden.
Extra's zoals personeelskorting, massage en gezonde lunches.




Sluit je aan bij ons datateam en help ons de toekomst te vormen!

Wat een leuke functie he? We verwachten deze dan ook zelf te kunnen invullen. Acquisitie vinden we zonde van jouw √©n onze tijd.

Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
You‚Äôre passionate about data, aren‚Äôt you? Here‚Äôs your chance to leverage your passion for data and innovative strategies and campaigns! Lead our growth and make your mark in the world of fintech. Ready to take your Data skills to new heights?




What will you do?

As a Data Analyst with BridgeFund, you play a crucial role in expanding marketing data and transforming insights into targeted strategies. You will analyze customer data and market trends to measure and improve campaign effectiveness. By conducting customer segmentation and profiling, you create detailed profiles for targeted marketing strategies. You optimize marketing processes by advising on and implementing process automation. You will work in the data team alongside Data Engineers and Data Scientists, who ensure the data foundation and support other teams with their data-related issues. Your work, along with your colleagues‚Äô, ensures that we operate in an increasingly data-driven manner as an organization.




What you will do:

Your analyses of marketing data and proposals for optimizations and automations will result in improved campaign conversions.
You identify and define different customer segments based on behavior, demographics, and other relevant factors to gain better insights into customer behavior.
You contribute to creating a culture within the marketing team where data-driven decision-making is central.
Identify and combine customer segments for targeted marketing approaches.
Create clear reports and visualizations to communicate insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to incorporate data-driven insights into business strategies.
Assist the marketing team in conducting A/B testing.




What we offer:

A fun, challenging position at an ambitious FinTech scale-up in a fast-growing environment. No day is the same. You‚Äôll have a lot of freedom and responsibility, allowing you to develop quickly and make a real impact on the organization.

A good salary between ‚Ç¨3.900 and ‚Ç¨5.000 based on a 40-hour workweek.
26 vacation days; plenty of time to recharge.
Your pension is well arranged with ASR, +4% on your gross salary.
You receive ‚Ç¨0.21 per kilometer for travel expenses, even if you come by bike.
Uber(Eats), ClassPass, or Felyx credit? Customize your secondary benefits with ‚Ç¨40 YourCampus credit per month.
We consider your development super important. That‚Äôs why we offer individual training as well as team training.
A super funky office in Amsterdam, near Amstel station. No cubicles or drop ceilings here.
Parties and boat trips. Friends coming along? Great!
We throw the coolest parties and drinks every quarter. We celebrate our successes together.
Skiing trips or partying in Berlin. You won‚Äôt want to miss our fully paid trips abroad.
A catered lunch every day.
A good fixed workspace. You‚Äôll get a MacBook and two monitors from us. We also have standing desks if you prefer.
A place where you feel at home and everyone can be themselves.




Our Culture:

What makes us unique is our culture. This is also one of the main reasons why we are growing so rapidly. We share the same mindset. We are a close-knit team of driven, ambitious people who want to disrupt the financial world. We are true entrepreneurs. You can feel it in our workplace. We work hard, but we also celebrate our successes in a big way together. Hierarchy is a difficult word for us, and we only do top-down when we go skiing together. We ask critical questions, give honest feedback, and are not afraid to fail occasionally, because failure means learning, and learning means growth.

Title: Customer Intelligence Analyst
Description:
RetailSonar is a fast-growing SAAS company specializing in geomarketing for large retail and service companies. RetailSonar has offices already in 4 countries (Belgium, The Netherlands, France, Germany) and is technologically readiness for further scaling up toward European market leadership. Therefore we are looking for a Customer Intelligence Analyst to join our colleagues in the Dutch office in Utrecht.




Our unique RetailSonar platform is fed by state of the art AI technology and up-to-date marketdata, which is the base of our very accurate performance prediction.

RetailSonar is looking for suitable Dutch candidates to join its existing team of Customer Intelligence Analysts.




Your future colleagues have a great affinity with big data, data processing and predictive modelling. Our employees are true multitaskers: they work simultaneously on multiple projects at major retailers and service providers.




Your responsibilities:

Your daily tasks include validating and analysing customer data, platform configuration and building powerful predictive models.
You maintain frequent contact with the customers you work for.
Customer satisfaction is our number one priority. We achieve this by delivering high-quality end results and going the extra mile. Our analysts rise to any challenge and dare to think out-of-the-box.




Moreover, our employees are real team players: together, they always succeed in communicating the most important conclusions and insights to the client in a structured manner. Constructive feedback is important to us and we help each other to get the best out of ourselves. Every day again!




About you:

Preferably, you hold an master's degree in technical/economical or business area which is complemented by a master's degree in data technology (e.g. Data Science, Data Analytics, Business Informatics)
A first experience in a data driven position is a strong plus
You have a sharp, analytical mind
You have a passion for data processing (SQL, Excel, Access, SAS, ...)
You have enough courage, enthusiasm, persuasiveness and a corresponding language skill (NL-EN) to speak to the highest management at our (international) customers
A strong backbone that enables you to transform stressful situations into positive energy
A real team player who can also work well independently




What we have to offer:




A varied position with a steep and challenging learning curve in a particularly innovative and extremely exciting field within retail: geomarketing & customer intelligence.
A competitive salary package that is topped off every semester by a team bonus and individual bonus that encourage you to get the most out of yourself and your team.
The opportunity to be part of a young, close-knit and highly driven international team that enthusiastically builds successful, ground-breaking solutions.
A committed and personal organisation that values a good work-life balance.
A very personal coaching program that offers you ample opportunity to further explore your own interests.
The opportunity to work with executives and experts from the largest retail companies and governments. The ideal way to broaden your world.
Regular team events and trips to Belgium and beyond.

Title: Data Analyst/Market Researcher
Description:
Responsibilities:


Conduct in-depth market research to identify industry trends, competitive landscapes, and growth opportunities.
Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights and inform business decisions.
Develop and maintain comprehensive databases and dashboards to track key performance indicators and metrics.
Generate reports, presentations, and visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop strategies and initiatives based on research findings.
Stay current on market developments, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis and market research.


Requirements:


Bachelor's degree in business, economics, statistics, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
Proven experience as a data analyst, market researcher, or similar role, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, such as Excel, SQL, Tableau, or Power BI.
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and draw meaningful conclusions.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy, with a commitment to producing high-quality work.
Effective communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical audiences.
Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a remote environment.


What We Offer:


Competitive salary and benefits package, including health insurance and retirement savings options.
Flexible work schedule and the opportunity to work remotely from anywhere in the United States.
Professional development opportunities, including training and certifications to support your career growth.
A supportive and collaborative team environment where your contributions are valued and recognized.


Join Our Team: If you're ready to take your data analysis and market research skills to the next level in a dynamic and innovative environment, we want to hear from you! Apply now to become a key member of our team and help drive our success.
Show more
HTML:
Responsibilities:

  • Conduct in-depth market research to identify industry trends, competitive landscapes, and growth opportunities.
  • Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights and inform business decisions.
  • Develop and maintain comprehensive databases and dashboards to track key performance indicators and metrics.
  • Generate reports, presentations, and visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop strategies and initiatives based on research findings.
  • Stay current on market developments, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis and market research.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in business, economics, statistics, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
  • Proven experience as a data analyst, market researcher, or similar role, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights.
  • Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, such as Excel, SQL, Tableau, or Power BI.
  • Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and draw meaningful conclusions.
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy, with a commitment to producing high-quality work.
  • Effective communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical audiences.
  • Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a remote environment.

What We Offer:

  • Competitive salary and benefits package, including health insurance and retirement savings options.
  • Flexible work schedule and the opportunity to work remotely from anywhere in the United States.
  • Professional development opportunities, including training and certifications to support your career growth.
  • A supportive and collaborative team environment where your contributions are valued and recognized.

Join Our Team: If you're ready to take your data analysis and market research skills to the next level in a dynamic and innovative environment, we want to hear from you! Apply now to become a key member of our team and help drive our success.

Title: Data Analyst .
HTML:
Your task

As a Data Analyst, you will be part of the Analytics Team. This team works with development teams to provide overviews of the various applications hosted within the Nedap Tech Platform, advises them on specific insights gained from the data analysis and visualisations created, and focuses on the operability of the platform. To do this, we work with the teams and business unit management (e.g. BU leads, tribe leads, developers) to ensure that the platform supports their needs and requirements and removes complexity.

Your passion for complex datasets and ability to transform this into actionable insights play a crucial role in supporting the organisation's data processing and analytics needs.

Responsibilities

  • Use monitoring tools such as Datadog to ensure the performance, reliability and availability of data pipelines;
  • Helping teams identify and address bottlenecks, performance issues and optimise data processing workflows;
  • Visualising dashboards to quickly understand running applications, highlight risk areas and provide detailed information for deployment and support teams during upgrades;
  • Helping teams gain insight into their applications and how to make best use of available data;
  • Collaborate with development teams to understand the application and what can be seen as critical support information;
  • Collaborate with support teams to understand recurring issues and workflows;
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements;
  • Provide technical expertise and guidance to team members on data analytics best practices;
  • Share knowledge by giving demos and workshops to the various teams;
  • Have the opportunity to grow into AI and Machine Learning skills in the future as the team expands in this area.

Your team

The Nedap Tech Platform focuses on supporting development teams within the Nedap business units with all aspects of the software development process such as tooling, frameworks, deployment and insights. We believe that combining the various domains into a cohesive product offers development teams a seamless experience, allowing them to focus on what matters most to them: delivering business value.

You will join our Analytics Team. This is a small and enthusiastic team which is currently still in its start-up phase. As a result, there is plenty of room for your own input and there are plenty of career opportunities in the future towards roles such as, for example, data engineer, data scientist or machine learning specialist. These experienced and enthusiastic data fanatics understand better than anyone that data must first be turned into information, are happy to provide advice and thus enable the Nedap business units and their teams to quickly gain insight into any application and/or proposition.

Our offer

As a Data Analyst at Nedap, you will make a valuable contribution to our goal: making people happier and more successful in their professional lives. In addition to your salary, you are entitled to a thirteenth month, a good pension scheme, and profit sharing with the opportunity to become a shareholder of Nedap. At Nedap, everything revolves around trust and autonomy. You determine your own working hours and vacation days. We also highly value personal and professional growth. You will receive a comprehensive introduction, and we encourage you to continuously develop yourself.

Curious about all our terms of employment? Read more here .

Required

 Required experience and skills

For you as a Data Analyst, it is important to be able to see the big picture. You will be in contact with different development teams, each with their own challenges. This means you must have excellent problem-solving and communication skills and be able to translate business requirements into technical solutions. Furthermore, you recognise yourself in the following:

  • You have 3-5 years' experience as a Data Analyst or in similar roles such as BI Developer, Data Engineer and Data Specialist;
  • You have mastered the Python language and have applied it within the context of data analysis;
  • You have experience in a communicative role, where you have experience with various stakeholders and/or internal customers;
  • You have experience in building reports and dashboards.

Title: Data Analyst - Banking
Description:
Skill Farm Members are invited to apply for the following role:

Responsibilities:

As a data analyst within CDS, you will be responsible for delivering data-driven insights, performing analysis, visualising in Power BI and conveying your key insights to your stakeholders. You contribute by prioritising and giving a positive impulse to a data-driven way of working in collaboration with the business. Within CDS we focus on bringing customer data and processes in control and we help change programs by making impactful analyses.

Projects you can think of:

Doing deep dives on data quality

Provide insights into the operation of customer processes such as Client Onboarding (NCTO)

Impact analyses of new regulations

Monitoring/self-service BI dashboards in Power BI

Vulnerable customers (social impact)

Skills & Qualifications:

You possess excellent analytical skills and you are strong in getting the message across

Up to 2 years of relevant work experience

Experience with one of the following programming languages: SQL, Python/PySpark

Experience with visualising in Power BI or a similar visualization tool

A relevant (university) degree

Full Professional English, Professional Working Dutch

You understand the business and can convey technical subjects in a non-technical language

You have strong communication and interpersonal skills which helps you to collaborate with various departments

You are able to translates data insights into effective and attractive visualisations in Power BI

You have a curious mindset and know what is happening within the organisation with regards to projects you work on

You take responsibility, you are self-organizing and you take initiative

Title: Investment Data Analyst
HTML:
Skill Farm Members are invited to apply for the following role:

Responsibilities:

Collecting, validating and delivering accurate and timely market data throughout the bank to value trading positions such as Interest Rate or FX derivatives, commodity and credit products;

Discussing with traders in hubs such as Hong Kong, London, New York or Sao Paulo what the best setup for their valuation instrument is;

Looking for continuous improvements of processes by automation or simplification.

You drive change in the team by focusing on implementing new technology that can help make our processes more efficient.

Skills & Qualifications:

You hold a master's degree with a focus on Finance, Economics or Econometrics or a degree in another discipline but with a keen interest in the financial sector;

You can demonstrate your knowledge on financial products that are valued at fair value;

You have a tangible interest in IT related systems and processes;

You have a tangible interest in the management of data

You are able to clearly express your ideas in English both orally and in written form;

CFA, FRM, PRM or equivalent is considered an asset or willingness to work towards one;

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Our client is a dominant organization on the global trading market, performing both high-frequency- and traditional trading on the different financial markets. Data is of essence for the trading teams as their strategy and their trades are based on historical and live data. The organization is currently forming a new data quality team, that is going to focus on the quality of the data that is delivered to the trading teams (the quant researchers and the traders).




We are looking for ambitious data analyst that like to join a fast-paced and high performing organization. In the team you will work on complex (big) data sets where you mainly leverage SQL and Python to prepare/optimize the data for business insights.




We are looking for people with:




-Strong analytical thinking, preferably backed up with a degree within the STEM field.

-1-3 years of experience in Data analysis

-Strong experience both SQL and Python

-Excellent communicator and capable to communicate with both stakeholders from both the business and technical perspective.




Are you looking for complexity? Big data sets? Make a real impact, daily, with the analysis you create? Want to strive for excellence together with your colleagues? Please apply!




Location:

The team is mainly working on site in the Amsterdam office.

Salary is up to 80k +package (including bonus and indefinite contract).

Relocation is possible and funded

Title: Data-analist
HTML:
Bij Roompot Landal GreenParks geloven we dat data de sleutel is tot nieuwe kansen en een katalysator voor innovatie. Door deel te nemen aan ons vooruitstrevende team, zullen jouw inzichten een cruciale rol spelen in het vormgeven van onze strategische initiatieven en het stimuleren van zakelijke groei. Als je enthousiast bent om jouw analytische expertise toe te passen in een dynamische omgeving, is deze rol op maat voor jou gemaakt.


De Data Analist bevordert data-gedreven besluitvorming door het analyseren, construeren en publiceren van inzichten met behulp van geavanceerde Business Intelligence-tools voor analyse, dashboards en rapportage. Deze rol fungeert als een brug tussen business en IT, vertaalt zakelijke vereisten naar IT (BI) oplossingen met behulp van diverse analyse- en rapportagetools. De Data Analist begrijpt en benut Landal-datasets, stelt standaarden en sjablonen vast en promoot de oplossingen bij de business en key users. De Data Analist rapporteert aan de Team Lead IT Application Development.


Daarnaast ontdekt en verkent de Data Analist kansen voor nieuwe inzichten door projectmatige samenwerking met de business, en zorgt zo voor verbeterde data-ge√Ønformeerde besluitvorming. Deze positie omvat zowel ontwikkelings- als adviesrollen.

Verder ben je verantwoordelijk voor:


  • Het verfijnen van user stories met betrekking tot de inzichten en rapporten die nodig zijn voor Landal Business Users, met focus op zowel strategische als tactische niveaus. De Business Users omvatten de Raad van Bestuur en afdelingsmanagement;
  • Het opstellen van rapporten en dashboards met behulp van geavanceerde tools om de nodige inzichten te bieden, volgens de agile werkwijze van het team;
  • Het adviseren van de Business Users over het gebruik en de interpretatie van analytische tools en resultaten;
  • Het promoten en uitleggen van dashboards en BI-oplossingen aan Business Users en Key Users;
  • Het introduceren en gebruiken van sjablonen en standaarden voor de Landal rapportage- en analyseomgeving;
  • Het identificeren en verkennen van kansen voor nieuwe inzichten;
  • Het mede verantwoordelijk zijn voor de optimale inrichting, effici√´nt gebruik en continue ontwikkeling van onze data- en analyseomgeving;
  • Het fungeren als schakel tussen IT en de business om nieuwe kansen te ontwikkelen en te implementeren.


Wat vragen wij:

  • Bachelor- of masterdiploma in een kwantitatief geori√´nteerd vakgebied zoals Informatica, Business Information Management, Computer Science, Engineering of een verwant vakgebied van een gerenommeerde instelling in Nederland of daarbuiten;
  • Aantoonbare expertise als Data Analist, met een sterke achtergrond in het opvragen en analyseren van uitgebreide datasets;
  • In staat om effectief te communiceren met zowel business als IT, de behoeften en prioriteiten van beide te begrijpen en de communicatiekloof tussen hen te overbruggen. In staat om zakelijke behoeften te vertalen naar BI-oplossingen;
  • Bekwaam in het begrijpen en analyseren van kritische (complexe) data en vraagstukken door logisch redeneren, het identificeren van oorzaken, het leggen van verbindingen, het overwegen van verschillende perspectieven en het onderscheiden van hoofd- en bijzaken;
  • Sterke expertise in het bieden van analyse en rapportage met behulp van tools zoals Power BI, DBT, Databricks, Power Apps of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het verbinden en benutten van data voor dashboarding, met begrip van dataverhoudingen;
  • Kennis van SQL, Data Modeling en Semantic Models is een pre;
  • Ervaring met het cre√´ren van uitgebreide bedrijfsrapporten en dashboards.


Wat wij bieden

  • Een jaarcontract met een proeftijd van een maand, met mogelijkheid tot vast dienstverband;
  • Bonusregeling;
  • 27 vakantiedagen, met de optie om 10 extra dagen bij te kopen;
  • Flexibele werktijden en mogelijkheden voor remote werken;
  • Thuiswerkvergoeding van ‚Ç¨2,35 per thuiswerkdag;
  • Reiskostenvergoeding van ‚Ç¨0,23 per kilometer, of volledige dekking voor openbaar vervoer;
  • Uitgebreide trainingsmogelijkheden, zowel online (150+ e-learnings) als offline;
  • Deelname aan het Recreatie Pensioenfonds, pensioenleeftijd 67 jaar, met premies gelijk verdeeld;
  • Betaald aanvullend ouderschapsverlof en zwangerschapsverlof;
  • Diverse collectieve verzekeringen, waaronder een doorlopende reisverzekering voor jou en je gezin;
  • Gunstige werknemerskorting op boekingen.


Roompot Landal GreenParks

Wij zijn Roompot Landal GreenParks, de marktleider in de vakantieparken- en recreatiebranche. Met meer dan 300 prachtige vakantieparken in 11 landen, bieden we een breed scala aan accommodaties, van vakantiehuizen en bungalows tot campings. Onze gezinsvriendelijke parken beschikken over uitgebreide recreatieve voorzieningen, sportactiviteiten, entertainment en eetgelegenheden. Ons doel is om gasten een onvergetelijke vakantie-ervaring te bieden in een prachtige, natuurlijke omgeving.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (100% Remote - EU)

Remote Working (within EU)

12-Month Fixed-Term Contract

Up to ‚Ç¨65,000 per annum

I am partnering with a leading Bioscience client in the Netherlands who is committed to revolutionizing healthcare through cutting-edge research and innovation. They are seeking a talented Data Analyst to join their dynamic team and contribute to impactful projects that drive their mission forward.

Key Skills And Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in transforming data into actionable insights. You will work remotely within the EU, collaborating with cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making processes. Your expertise in Power BI, BigQuery, Looker, and SQL will be essential in developing and maintaining dashboards, performing complex data analyses, and providing strategic recommendations.


Develop, design, and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI, BigQuery, and Looker.
Conduct in-depth data analyses to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical solutions.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through rigorous validation and quality checks.
Optimise and streamline data processes for efficiency and effectiveness.
Communicate findings and recommendations to non-technical stakeholders clearly and concisely.


Must-Have


Minimum 2-3 years of experience in Data Analytics within a highly driven environment.
Proficiency in Power BI, BigQuery, Looker, and SQL.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Fluent English (written/spoken)
Ability to work independently and remotely while managing multiple tasks and deadlines.
Experience in the Bioscience or healthcare sector is a plus.


If you are passionate about data analytics and eager to make a difference in the Bioscience sector, I would love to hear from you! Please submit your CV detailing your experience and fit for this role as soon as possible. Only EU candidates need apply-100% Remote for EU Candidates only.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Een baan als Data Analist bij Digital Power

Als Data Analist bij Digital Power help je verschillende organisaties om beslissingen te maken op basis van data. Het is jouw taak om complexe informatie vanuit verschillende domeinen te vertalen in heldere en concrete actiepunten. Jouw doel is om ervoor te zorgen dat beslissingen niet meer worden genomen ‚Äòop onderbuikgevoel‚Äô maar op basis van feitelijke data.




Je werkt in multi-disciplinaire teams met collega‚Äôs van Digital Power en/of klantteams. Wij vinden het belangrijk om kennis met elkaar te delen. Hierdoor ontwikkel jij je razendsnel. Maar we verwachten ook een actieve bijdrage van jou! Dit doe je op je eigen manier, bijvoorbeeld door training te geven of junior collega‚Äôs te coachen.




Naast je opdracht(en) maak je deel uit van onze interne community. Leer van, en m√©t je collega‚Äôs en help elkaar n√≥g beter te worden! Kom je ergens niet uit? Dan staat ons hele team voor je klaar.




Wie we zoeken

Passie voor data

Je duikt graag in de off- √©n online data van organisaties
Je krijgt energie van het omzetten van data naar bruikbare inzichten
Je kunt data helder analyseren, visualiseren en uitleggen

Je hebt minimaal 1 jaar werkervaring als Data Analist
Je hebt ervaring met visualisatietools zoals PowerBI of Tableau en/of (web)analyse tools zoals Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics
Je bent communicatief vaardig en in staat om organisaties te helpen meer datagedreven te werken

Ervaring met SQL is een pr√©

Je denkt na over wat de vraag √°chter de vraag is

Je krijgt goede energie van onze ‚Äòwerken bij‚Äô pagina
Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal goed in woord en geschrift
Een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Data Analist bij Tremoot

Bij Tremoot zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren Data Analist met uitgebreide ervaring in Power BI. Als je gepassioneerd bent over data visualisatie en graag werkt in een dynamische omgeving waar kwaliteit en privacy/security hoog in het vaandel staan, dan is deze rol perfect voor jou.




Waarom Tremoot?

Platte Organisatie: Geniet van directe en duidelijke communicatie.
Cultuur: Maak deel uit van een nieuwsgierig, betrokken en persoonlijk team. Voel je thuis!
Ontwikkeling: We benadrukken groei en ondersteunen voortdurende certificering en kennisdeling.
Plezier: Doe mee aan leuke teamuitjes en regelmatige bijeenkomsten die de teamgeest versterken!
Diversiteit en Inclusie: Ervaar een levendige mix van culturen met ons team van expats en externe medewerkers.
Gemeenschap: Bij Tremoot ben je meer dan alleen een medewerker - je bent een essentieel onderdeel van onze levendige gemeenschap.




Wat bieden wij?

Contract: Een vaste rol binnen een vooruitstrevend team.
Salaris: Competitief salaris dat past bij je ervaring en vaardigheden.
Reiskostenvergoeding: NS-businesskaart voor je reisbehoeften.
Vakantiedagen: 25 vakantiedagen om te ontspannen en op te laden.
Technologie: Je ontvangt een bedrijfslaptop voor professioneel gebruik.
Leren: Profiteer van een jaarlijks budget van ‚Ç¨1000 voor professionele ontwikkeling.




Jouw Rol als Data Analist:

Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van datavisualisaties en rapportages met Power BI en Power BI Report Builder.
Samenwerken in Agile/Scrum teams om projecten te realiseren die voldoen aan de hoogste normen van kwaliteit en privacy/security.
Analyseren van data om inzichten te verschaffen die strategische besluitvorming ondersteunen.




Wat heb je nodig?

Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring.
Ervaring met data analyse en visualistie met PowerBI en PowerBI Report Builder.
Bekend met Agile en Scrum en kunt dit in de praktijk toepassen.
Nauwkeurig werkend, met oog voor kwaliteit en privacy/security aspecten.
Beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift.
HBO werk- en denkniveau.




Ge√Ønteresseerd?

Ben je klaar voor een nieuwe uitdaging en wil je deel uitmaken van een vooruitstrevend team? Solliciteer nu bij Tremoot! We kijken ernaar uit om je aan boord te verwelkomen en zien uit naar jouw bijdrage aan onze gemeenschap!
