Waarom Tremoot?

  • Platte Organisatie: Geniet van directe en duidelijke communicatie.
  • Cultuur: Maak deel uit van een nieuwsgierig, betrokken en persoonlijk team. Voel je thuis!
  • Ontwikkeling: We benadrukken groei en ondersteunen voortdurende certificering en kennisdeling.
  • Plezier: Doe mee aan leuke teamuitjes en regelmatige bijeenkomsten die de teamgeest versterken!
  • Diversiteit en Inclusie: Ervaar een levendige mix van culturen met ons team van expats en externe medewerkers.
  • Gemeenschap: Bij Tremoot ben je meer dan alleen een medewerker - je bent een essentieel onderdeel van onze levendige gemeenschap.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Contract: Een vaste rol binnen een vooruitstrevend team.
  • Salaris: Competitief salaris dat past bij je ervaring en vaardigheden.
  • Reiskostenvergoeding: NS-businesskaart voor je reisbehoeften.
  • Vakantiedagen: 25 vakantiedagen om te ontspannen en op te laden.
  • Technologie: Je ontvangt een bedrijfslaptop voor professioneel gebruik.
  • Leren: Profiteer van een jaarlijks budget van ‚Ç¨1000 voor professionele ontwikkeling.


Jouw Rol als Data Analist:

  • Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van datavisualisaties en rapportages met Power BI en Power BI Report Builder.
  • Samenwerken in Agile/Scrum teams om projecten te realiseren die voldoen aan de hoogste normen van kwaliteit en privacy/security.
  • Analyseren van data om inzichten te verschaffen die strategische besluitvorming ondersteunen.


Wat heb je nodig?

  • Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring.
  • Ervaring met data analyse en visualistie met PowerBI en PowerBI Report Builder.
  • Bekend met Agile en Scrum en kunt dit in de praktijk toepassen.
  • Nauwkeurig werkend, met oog voor kwaliteit en privacy/security aspecten.
  • Beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift.
  • HBO werk- en denkniveau.


Ge√Ønteresseerd?

Ben je klaar voor een nieuwe uitdaging en wil je deel uitmaken van een vooruitstrevend team? Solliciteer nu bij Tremoot! We kijken ernaar uit om je aan boord te verwelkomen en zien uit naar jouw bijdrage aan onze gemeenschap!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your data management skills have an impact on our 9.5 million customers.

You and your job

As a Data Analyst working on SPOT you are the primary contact with our stakeholders, which are mostly consumers of the data in your data warehouse. You guide consumers in the usage of the data, validate new requirements of the business stakeholders and guide the (IT-) implementation of new initiatives. The Data Analyst represents customer and end-user concerns by gathering input from stakeholders to understand the problem to be solved. You may also help to identify potential areas of automation and support or advise the business in re-engineering the underlying business process.

Practical examples


You will take responsibility for data elements for their end-to-end usage across the enterprise
You do not involve just a single role but include a network of people with accountabilities for ensuring that all aspects of an effective data environment are being accomplished
You will tackle various data related issues and you will work on global and cross functional change projects to improve our processes and systems


Facts & figures


36 per week as standard (other options can be discussed)
43,822 Rabobank colleagues around the world


Example Responsibilities


You monitor, validate and where needed correct the data provided by your data warehouse.
You focus on ensuring BCBS239 compliancy.
You define data requirements and give input to project scope/objectives through research, fact finding and elicitation with a solid understanding of business, systems, and requirements.
You provide high impact (strategic and tactical) advice for the Product Owner.
You participate in testing of changes against requirements.
You represent the department and your team and act as a liaison between regulator and/or business needs, and the actual data.
You develop and maintain knowledge of business analysis and business requirements.
You continuously work to increase knowledge of and to be familiar with best practices.
You work with business users to ensure they can understand the data model and can use it to meet their needs


Together we achieve more than alone

Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. Our team brings talented people together from various nationalities and backgrounds. As our colleague you will tackle various data related issues and play a role in global and cross domain efforts to improve our processes and systems.

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our team within Chapter Data.

Joris, Data Analyst: ‚ÄúWorking as a Data Analyst for our teams in on our new data warehousing means working with data in an international environment during a large strategic transition. This involves the implementation of regulatory requirements, adherence to compliance and data management standards. Next to that accurately and timely processing of the data is key for meeting the reporting deadlines of our stakeholders.‚Äù

Our chapter brings a diverse, talented group of people to manage and develop the financial data platform of Rabobank. Working together is the way we work; as 1 data-minded team at Rabobank.

Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.

You and your talent


You have at least a Masters degree in Economics, Finance, Business Administration or a related (quantitative) field
You have knowledge of a range of banking products, preferably demonstrated by an industry qualification such as CFA or FRM
You have 3+ years of relevant banking experience within the financial industries sector
You have strong analytical and conceptual skills (databases, data warehouses and SQL)
You have knowledge of databases, data warehouses and SQL
You have knowledge of data management principles and how to implement them
You have strong communication skills in English, both spoken and written


This Is What We Offer You


a gross salary between ‚Ç¨ 3.711 and ‚Ç¨ 7,307.58 (scale 8, 9 or 10 depending on experience)
thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
an extra budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out
a pension scheme to which you contribute 5.5%


This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Data Analyst based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.

You and the job application process

We look forward to your response to the vacancy of Data Analyst at Rabobank.


Any questions about the job content? Contact: Ryan Bartlett, Chapter Lead via Ryan.Bartlett@rabobank.com. Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact: Lex Verwayen, Recruiter via Lex.Verwayen@rabobank.nl
You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/nl/veelgestelde-vragen.
A security check is part of the process.
We respect your privacy


#rabobank #data

Title: Data Analist
Place: Rotterdam‚ÄìThe Hague metropolitan area, South Holland, Netherlands
Description:
Data Analist




Ben jij een analytisch denker met een passie voor data? Heb je oog voor detail en wil je bijdragen aan datagedreven beslissingen binnen een dynamisch team? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!




Functieomschrijving:




Als Data-analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen, analyseren en interpreteren van grote hoeveelheden data. Je vertaalt complexe datasets naar begrijpelijke rapportages en biedt inzichten die de organisatie helpen strategische beslissingen te nemen.




Taken en verantwoordelijkheden:




Verzamelen en verwerken van data uit verschillende bronnen.
Uitvoeren van data-analyses om trends en patronen te identificeren.
Ontwikkelen van dashboards en rapportages om data-inzichten te visualiseren.
Samenwerken met diverse afdelingen om datagedreven oplossingen te implementeren.
Ondersteunen van het management bij het nemen van ge√Ønformeerde beslissingen.
Zorgen voor de integriteit en kwaliteit van de data.




Vereisten:




Afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding in een relevante richting (bijv. Data Science, Statistiek, Bedrijfskunde).
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring in een vergelijkbare functie.
Uitstekende kennis van data-analysetools en -technieken (bijv. SQL, Python, R).
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met Power BI en andere visualisatietools.
Sterke analytische vaardigheden en oog voor detail.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om complexe informatie duidelijk over te brengen.
Proactieve houding en probleemoplossend vermogen.




Wat wij bieden:




Een uitdagende en afwisselende functie binnen een groeiend bedrijf.
Mogelijkheden voor professionele en persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
Een competitief salaris en goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden.
Een inspirerende werkomgeving met gemotiveerde collega's.




Solliciteren:




Ben jij de data-analist die wij zoeken? Stuur dan je cv naar rhoving@visservanbaars.nl

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
You‚Äôre passionate about data, aren‚Äôt you? Here‚Äôs your chance to leverage your passion for data and innovative strategies and campaigns! Lead our growth and make your mark in the world of fintech. Ready to take your Data skills to new heights?




What will you do?

As a Data Analyst with BridgeFund, you play a crucial role in expanding marketing data and transforming insights into targeted strategies. You will analyze customer data and market trends to measure and improve campaign effectiveness. By conducting customer segmentation and profiling, you create detailed profiles for targeted marketing strategies. You optimize marketing processes by advising on and implementing process automation. You will work in the data team alongside Data Engineers and Data Scientists, who ensure the data foundation and support other teams with their data-related issues. Your work, along with your colleagues‚Äô, ensures that we operate in an increasingly data-driven manner as an organization.




What you will do:

Your analyses of marketing data and proposals for optimizations and automations will result in improved campaign conversions.
You identify and define different customer segments based on behavior, demographics, and other relevant factors to gain better insights into customer behavior.
You contribute to creating a culture within the marketing team where data-driven decision-making is central.
Identify and combine customer segments for targeted marketing approaches.
Create clear reports and visualizations to communicate insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to incorporate data-driven insights into business strategies.
Assist the marketing team in conducting A/B testing.




What we offer:

A fun, challenging position at an ambitious FinTech scale-up in a fast-growing environment. No day is the same. You‚Äôll have a lot of freedom and responsibility, allowing you to develop quickly and make a real impact on the organization.

A good salary between ‚Ç¨3.900 and ‚Ç¨5.000 based on a 40-hour workweek.
26 vacation days; plenty of time to recharge.
Your pension is well arranged with ASR, +4% on your gross salary.
You receive ‚Ç¨0.21 per kilometer for travel expenses, even if you come by bike.
Uber(Eats), ClassPass, or Felyx credit? Customize your secondary benefits with ‚Ç¨40 YourCampus credit per month.
We consider your development super important. That‚Äôs why we offer individual training as well as team training.
A super funky office in Amsterdam, near Amstel station. No cubicles or drop ceilings here.
Parties and boat trips. Friends coming along? Great!
We throw the coolest parties and drinks every quarter. We celebrate our successes together.
Skiing trips or partying in Berlin. You won‚Äôt want to miss our fully paid trips abroad.
A catered lunch every day.
A good fixed workspace. You‚Äôll get a MacBook and two monitors from us. We also have standing desks if you prefer.
A place where you feel at home and everyone can be themselves.




Our Culture:

What makes us unique is our culture. This is also one of the main reasons why we are growing so rapidly. We share the same mindset. We are a close-knit team of driven, ambitious people who want to disrupt the financial world. We are true entrepreneurs. You can feel it in our workplace. We work hard, but we also celebrate our successes in a big way together. Hierarchy is a difficult word for us, and we only do top-down when we go skiing together. We ask critical questions, give honest feedback, and are not afraid to fail occasionally, because failure means learning, and learning means growth.

Title: Customer Intelligence Analyst
Description:
RetailSonar is a fast-growing SAAS company specializing in geomarketing for large retail and service companies. RetailSonar has offices already in 4 countries (Belgium, The Netherlands, France, Germany) and is technologically readiness for further scaling up toward European market leadership. Therefore we are looking for a Customer Intelligence Analyst to join our colleagues in the Dutch office in Utrecht.




Our unique RetailSonar platform is fed by state of the art AI technology and up-to-date marketdata, which is the base of our very accurate performance prediction.

RetailSonar is looking for suitable Dutch candidates to join its existing team of Customer Intelligence Analysts.




Your future colleagues have a great affinity with big data, data processing and predictive modelling. Our employees are true multitaskers: they work simultaneously on multiple projects at major retailers and service providers.




Your responsibilities:

Your daily tasks include validating and analysing customer data, platform configuration and building powerful predictive models.
You maintain frequent contact with the customers you work for.
Customer satisfaction is our number one priority. We achieve this by delivering high-quality end results and going the extra mile. Our analysts rise to any challenge and dare to think out-of-the-box.




Moreover, our employees are real team players: together, they always succeed in communicating the most important conclusions and insights to the client in a structured manner. Constructive feedback is important to us and we help each other to get the best out of ourselves. Every day again!




About you:

Preferably, you hold an master's degree in technical/economical or business area which is complemented by a master's degree in data technology (e.g. Data Science, Data Analytics, Business Informatics)
A first experience in a data driven position is a strong plus
You have a sharp, analytical mind
You have a passion for data processing (SQL, Excel, Access, SAS, ...)
You have enough courage, enthusiasm, persuasiveness and a corresponding language skill (NL-EN) to speak to the highest management at our (international) customers
A strong backbone that enables you to transform stressful situations into positive energy
A real team player who can also work well independently




What we have to offer:




A varied position with a steep and challenging learning curve in a particularly innovative and extremely exciting field within retail: geomarketing & customer intelligence.
A competitive salary package that is topped off every semester by a team bonus and individual bonus that encourage you to get the most out of yourself and your team.
The opportunity to be part of a young, close-knit and highly driven international team that enthusiastically builds successful, ground-breaking solutions.
A committed and personal organisation that values a good work-life balance.
A very personal coaching program that offers you ample opportunity to further explore your own interests.
The opportunity to work with executives and experts from the largest retail companies and governments. The ideal way to broaden your world.
Regular team events and trips to Belgium and beyond.

Title: Data Analyst - Banking
Description:
Skill Farm Members are invited to apply for the following role:

Responsibilities:

As a data analyst within CDS, you will be responsible for delivering data-driven insights, performing analysis, visualising in Power BI and conveying your key insights to your stakeholders. You contribute by prioritising and giving a positive impulse to a data-driven way of working in collaboration with the business. Within CDS we focus on bringing customer data and processes in control and we help change programs by making impactful analyses.

Projects you can think of:

Doing deep dives on data quality

Provide insights into the operation of customer processes such as Client Onboarding (NCTO)

Impact analyses of new regulations

Monitoring/self-service BI dashboards in Power BI

Vulnerable customers (social impact)

Skills & Qualifications:

You possess excellent analytical skills and you are strong in getting the message across

Up to 2 years of relevant work experience

Experience with one of the following programming languages: SQL, Python/PySpark

Experience with visualising in Power BI or a similar visualization tool

A relevant (university) degree

Full Professional English, Professional Working Dutch

You understand the business and can convey technical subjects in a non-technical language

You have strong communication and interpersonal skills which helps you to collaborate with various departments

You are able to translates data insights into effective and attractive visualisations in Power BI

You have a curious mindset and know what is happening within the organisation with regards to projects you work on

You take responsibility, you are self-organizing and you take initiative

Monitoring/self-service BI dashboards in Power BI

Vulnerable customers (social impact)

Skills & Qualifications:

You possess excellent analytical skills and you are strong in getting the message across

Up to 2 years of relevant work experience

Experience with one of the following programming languages: SQL, Python/PySpark

Experience with visualising in Power BI or a similar visualization tool

A relevant (university) degree

Full Professional English, Professional Working Dutch

You understand the business and can convey technical subjects in a non-technical language

You have strong communication and interpersonal skills which helps you to collaborate with various departments

You are able to translates data insights into effective and attractive visualisations in Power BI

You have a curious mindset and know what is happening within the organisation with regards to projects you work on

You take responsibility, you are self-organizing and you take initiative

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Junior Data-analist (32-40u/w)

Vind jij het leuk om data te analyseren en dit om te zetten naar bruikbare rapportages, informatie en adviezen? Als junior data-analist bij Lyceo werk je in een klein team, maar maak je grote impact!




In 't kort

Werken in een leuk team, waar je veel kunt leren van je collega's.
Goede arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals direct een contract voor onbepaalde tijd.
Een functie met impact bij de grootste onderwijsondersteuner van Nederland.
Ongekend goede werksfeer met gezellige lunches, borrels en een informele sfeer.




Lyceo ‚Äì Leren leer je zo!

Ieder kind is anders. En met miljoenen verschillende talenten √©n struikelblokken, gaat leren niet voor iedereen vanzelf. Daarom hebben sommige leerlingen wat extra aandacht nodig. Aandacht voor leren zelf. Want leren kun je leren. Dat vinden we niet alleen, dat hebben we ook wetenschappelijk bewezen.




Bij Lyceo leren we leerlingen leren. Daar hebben ze bij elke toets, elk school- of studiejaar en bij alles wat ze daarna ondernemen, profijt van. Mede dankzij jou gaan leerlingen straks met meer zelfvertrouwen naar school.




Wat ga je doen?

Een greep uit de werkzaamheden:

Het zelfstandig maken van en onderhouden van waardevolle rapportages en dashboards voor de organisatie. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan een dashboard voor vestigingsmanagers waar zij inzicht krijgen in hun wekelijkse omzet, hun operationele cijfers en hun doelstellingen. Deze maak je primair in Power BI.
Je ondersteunt collega‚Äôs met data gerelateerde vragen. Dit kan van alles zijn, denk bijvoorbeeld aan HR die een selectie opvraagt van alle studenten die het afgelopen jaar hebben gewerkt als huiswerkbegeleider.
Het maken van analyses en prognoses om kansen en valkuilen te identificeren. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan het maken van een wervingsprognose om aan de hand van de verwachte vraag te voorspellen waar mogelijke tekorten kunnen ontstaan.




Data-Analist Nick aan het woord:

‚ÄúHet zijn van een data-analist bij Lyceo betekent dat je te maken krijgt met alle afdelingen, mensen en processen van een dynamisch bedrijf, wat de baan ook ontzettend dynamisch en gevarieerde maakt. Stel je voor: de ene dag cre√´er je een emaillijst om klanten te benaderen voor de marketing afdeling, terwijl je de volgende dag een gloednieuw dashboard publiceert voor 150 vestigingsmanagers, zodat zij de prestaties van hun locaties kunnen volgen. Misschien help je finance om een foutieve omzetboeking te corrigeren, of presenteer je een analyse die de verkoop van examentrainingen volgend jaar zal laten groeien. Tussendoor beantwoord je ad-hoc vragen van collega‚Äôs over waar ze bepaalde data kunnen vinden en geef je hen toegang tot deze informatie. Niet alleen de werkzaamheden maken dit zo‚Äôn leuke functie ook de sfeer en regelmatige borrels maken het een ontzettend leuke, uitdagende en gezellige werkplek!‚Äù




Lyceo - en je collega‚Äôs

Met 175 vestigingen door heel Nederland en een hoofdkantoor in Leiden is Lyceo de grootste onderwijsondersteuner in Nederland. Een innovatieve onderneming die altijd in beweging is. Zo ontwikkelen wij continu nieuwe eigen lesmethodes en apps. Je vindt ons door het hele land met examentraining, huiswerkbegeleiding, studie- en beroepskeuze tot leren programmeren. We willen elke dag weer leerlingen motiveren het beste uit zichzelf te halen. Dit doen we door het geven van inhoudelijke begeleiding en het verbeteren van studievaardigheden. Onze kernwaarden zijn vertrouwen, deskundigheid en een flinke dosis positiviteit. Met ons Lyceo Extra programma zetten wij ons in voor gelijke kansen in het onderwijs.




Het Datateam bestaat uit twee andere data-analisten, Nick een Mariska en met plezier voegen we daar binnenkort een 3e data analist aan toe! Kom jij ons team versterken?




Je neemt met je mee...

Een afgeronde hbo/wo opleiding, bij voorkeur in een statistische richting.
Je kent in ieder geval de basisprincipes van SQL, visualisaties en statistiek.
Ervaring met Power BI is een pr√©.
Je bent nauwkeurig, proactief en oplossingsgericht.




Dit krijg je van ons

Natuurlijk mag je iets terugverwachten voor jouw tijd en inzet. Wij bieden jou op basis van een 40-urige werkweek onder meer:

Een salaris tussen de ‚Ç¨ 2.850,- en ‚Ç¨ 3.000,- bruto per maand op basis van 40 uur en afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring.
Direct een contract voor onbepaalde tijd.
23 vakantiedagen en 8% vakantiegeld.
Een pensioenregeling en volledige reiskostenvergoeding als je met het OV reist.
Een leuke werkplek in Leiden, met parkeerplekken en op 5 minuten loopafstand van Leiden Centraal.
Mogelijkheid tot deelname aan onze Lyceo Academie. Dit is ons trainingsprogramma waarin je fysieke en online trainingen kunt volgen die je helpen groeien als professional.
Onze geweldige kok Esther die vier dagen per week een heerlijke lunch bereidt, en als werknemer kun je voor een klein bedrag aan schuiven.
En niet te vergeten, onze enthousiaste medewerkersvereniging zorgt ervoor dat er elke maand wel iets leuks te beleven valt tegen een kleine vergoeding, of het nu gaat om borrels of activiteiten.




Aan het werk!

Samen ontdekken of deze baan past bij jouw kennis, vaardigheden en ambities? Je mag ons altijd bellen, appen of mailen. Recruiters Ellen, Melissa en Tess bereik je per telefoon of app via 071 790 00 56. Mailen kan naar recruitment@lyceo.nl.




Al helemaal overtuigd? Dan stuur je meteen je cv en motivatiebrief toe via het sollicitatieformulier. Die bekijken we binnen 1-3 werkdagen, waarna we hopelijk een gesprek kunnen plannen. Klikt het tijdens het sollicitatiegesprek? Dan voeren we een tweede gesprek waarin we je nog beter leren kennen. Iedereen enthousiast? Dan worden we collega‚Äôs!




Werk je voor een werving- en selectiebureau en wil je ons helpen met het vervullen van deze vacature? Niet nodig! Het Lyceo-gevoel ervaar je alleen als je direct bij ons solliciteert.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Ben jij op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging als Field Data Analyst en wil jij je zowel op professioneel en persoonlijk vlak ontwikkelen? Op onze locatie in Heijen, ga jij de Healthcare divisie verder helpen ontwikkelen en de fascinerende wereld van onze internationale supply chain oplossingen ervaren. Maak deel uit van een innovatief en dynamisch bedrijf dat kwaliteit, procesoptimalisatie en prestaties ziet als sleutelfactoren voor succes.




We‚Äôre on it! Are you on it?




Wij geloven dat onze bedrijfsmentaliteit moet overeenkomen met jouw persoonlijke mentaliteit. Laten we eens kijken of we bij elkaar passen. Durf jij initiative te nemen en ben je altijd op zoek naar kansen? Ben je bereid om te commit & deliver en verantwoordelijkheid te nemen voor je werk? Heb je de voortdurende ambition om net dat stapje extra te zetten voor onze klanten en collega's? En ben je een echte teamspeler, omdat we optreden als one team, one company? Vier keer 'ja'? Dan zijn wij het juiste bedrijf voor jou!




YOUR TASKS

Je bent de schakel tussen de medische technologiebedrijven en ziekenhuizen voor de continue inventarisatie van consignatievoorraden in ziekenhuizen
Het zelfstandig uitvoeren van inventarisaties (tellen van medische producten) van consignatievoorraden in de ziekenhuizen
Het terugtrekken en retourneren van producten met verlopen of bijna verlopen houdbaarheidsdata en het aanvullen van voorraden
Het opstellen van voorraadrapporten voor klanten op basis van de ter plaatse verkregen informatie
Het opbouwen en onderhouden van relaties met klanten en ziekenhuispersoneel om een goede informatiestroom te waarborgen




YOUR PROFILE

Opleiding in de medische, technische of commerci√´le richting
2-3 jaar professionele ervaring in logistiek of interne verkoop is wenselijk
Praktische ervaring in Healthcare en magazijnbeheer is een pre
Sterke analytische, organisatorische en communicatieve vaardigheden met interesse in het opbouwen van langdurige zakelijke relaties
Bereidheid om te reizen en flexibel te werken
Vermogen om toegewezen taken zorgvuldig en zelfstandig uit te voeren
Vertrouwd met MS Excel
In het bezit van rijbewijs B
Vloeiend Nederlands en Engels in woord en geschrift




WE OFFER

Een salaris tussen ‚Ç¨2.404 en ‚Ç¨3.867, aangevuld met 8% vakantiegeld, een volledig betaald pensioenplan en korting op sportschoolabonnementen
Wij bieden een prestatiebonus en een bedrijfsauto (ook voor priv√©gebruik)
25 betaalde vakantiedagen, mogelijkheid om deze uit te breiden tot 28 vakantiedagen
Veelzijdige werkomgeving met creatieve vrijheid, vlakke hi√´rarchie√´n en een open bedrijfscultuur
Een spannende baan in een internationale groep met actieve mogelijkheden om het bedrijf mede vorm te geven
Intensieve training en ondersteuning van een internationaal team dat deze diensten al succesvol in andere landen heeft gevestigd
Samenwerking met top nationale en internationale klanten uit de gezondheidszorg in een professionele en creatieve omgeving.




ABOUT US ‚Äì WE‚ÄôRE ON IT!

Arvato biedt jou een van de meest dynamische werkomgevingen die jij je kunt voorstellen. We groeien, we innoveren, we lossen elke dag de uitdagingen van onze klanten over de hele wereld op. Hoe doen we dat? Met onze speciale spirit: We're on it!

Onze gedeelde visie als wereldwijd team: het internationale supply chain-bedrijf worden met de sterkste klantgerichtheid en focus op mensen en technologie. Als strategische groeipartner voor onze klanten in Fashion, Beauty & Lifestyle, Healthcare, Tech en Publisher vertrouwen we op cloudgebaseerde e-commerce- en IT-platforms en geavanceerde automatiseringstechnologie om complexe, wereldwijde supply chain-oplossingen te realiseren.

We willen een eerlijke en inclusieve werkgever zijn en waarderen de verschillende perspectieven van onze werknemers, wat bijdraagt aan de diversiteit van ons bedrijf.

We willen het sollicitatieproces voor jou zo eenvoudig mogelijk houden: focus je op een goed cv; we hebben geen uitgebreide sollicitatiebrief nodig. Houd er rekening mee dat we je sollicitatie alleen kunnen accepteren via ons online sollicitatieportaal.




CONTACT

E: recruitment@arvato-scs.com

Show more

CONTACT

E: recruitment@arvato-scs.com

Title: Data Analyst/Market Researcher
Description:
Responsibilities:


Conduct in-depth market research to identify industry trends, competitive landscapes, and growth opportunities.
Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights and inform business decisions.
Develop and maintain comprehensive databases and dashboards to track key performance indicators and metrics.
Generate reports, presentations, and visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop strategies and initiatives based on research findings.
Stay current on market developments, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis and market research.


Requirements:


Bachelor's degree in business, economics, statistics, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
Proven experience as a data analyst, market researcher, or similar role, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, such as Excel, SQL, Tableau, or Power BI.
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and draw meaningful conclusions.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy, with a commitment to producing high-quality work.
Effective communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical audiences.
Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a remote environment.


What We Offer:


Competitive salary and benefits package, including health insurance and retirement savings options.
Flexible work schedule and the opportunity to work remotely from anywhere in the United States.
Professional development opportunities, including training and certifications to support your career growth.
A supportive and collaborative team environment where your contributions are valued and recognized.


Join Our Team: If you're ready to take your data analysis and market research skills to the next level in a dynamic and innovative environment, we want to hear from you! Apply now to become a key member of our team and help drive our success.

Title: Data Analyst .
HTML:
Your task

As a Data Analyst, you will be part of the Analytics Team. This team works with development teams to provide overviews of the various applications hosted within the Nedap Tech Platform, advises them on specific insights gained from the data analysis and visualisations created, and focuses on the operability of the platform. To do this, we work with the teams and business unit management (e.g. BU leads, tribe leads, developers) to ensure that the platform supports their needs and requirements and removes complexity.

Your passion for complex datasets and ability to transform this into actionable insights play a crucial role in supporting the organisation's data processing and analytics needs.

Responsibilities

  • Use monitoring tools such as Datadog to ensure the performance, reliability and availability of data pipelines;
  • Helping teams identify and address bottlenecks, performance issues and optimise data processing workflows;
  • Visualising dashboards to quickly understand running applications, highlight risk areas and provide detailed information for deployment and support teams during upgrades;
  • Helping teams gain insight into their applications and how to make best use of available data;
  • Collaborate with development teams to understand the application and what can be seen as critical support information;
  • Collaborate with support teams to understand recurring issues and workflows;
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements;
  • Provide technical expertise and guidance to team members on data analytics best practices;
  • Share knowledge by giving demos and workshops to the various teams;
  • Have the opportunity to grow into AI and Machine Learning skills in the future as the team expands in this area.

Your team

The Nedap Tech Platform focuses on supporting development teams within the Nedap business units with all aspects of the software development process such as tooling, frameworks, deployment and insights. We believe that combining the various domains into a cohesive product offers development teams a seamless experience, allowing them to focus on what matters most to them: delivering business value.

You will join our Analytics Team. This is a small and enthusiastic team which is currently still in its start-up phase. As a result, there is plenty of room for your own input and there are plenty of career opportunities in the future towards roles such as, for example, data engineer, data scientist or machine learning specialist. These experienced and enthusiastic data fanatics understand better than anyone that data must first be turned into information, are happy to provide advice and thus enable the Nedap business units and their teams to quickly gain insight into any application and/or proposition.

Our offer

As a Data Analyst at Nedap, you will make a valuable contribution to our goal: making people happier and more successful in their professional lives. In addition to your salary, you are entitled to a thirteenth month, a good pension scheme, and profit sharing with the opportunity to become a shareholder of Nedap. At Nedap, everything revolves around trust and autonomy. You determine your own working hours and vacation days. We also highly value personal and professional growth. You will receive a comprehensive introduction, and we encourage you to continuously develop yourself.

Curious about all our terms of employment? Read more here .

Required

 Required experience and skills

For you as a Data Analyst, it is important to be able to see the big picture. You will be in contact with different development teams, each with their own challenges. This means you must have excellent problem-solving and communication skills and be able to translate business requirements into technical solutions. Furthermore, you recognise yourself in the following:

  • You have 3-5 years' experience as a Data Analyst or in similar roles such as BI Developer, Data Engineer and Data Specialist;
  • You have mastered the Python language and have applied it within the context of data analysis;
  • You have experience in a communicative role, where you have experience with various stakeholders and/or internal customers;
  • You have experience in building reports and dashboards.

Title: Data Analyst - Banking
Description:
Skill Farm Members are invited to apply for the following role:

Responsibilities:

As a data analyst within CDS, you will be responsible for delivering data-driven insights, performing analysis, visualising in Power BI and conveying your key insights to your stakeholders. You contribute by prioritising and giving a positive impulse to a data-driven way of working in collaboration with the business. Within CDS we focus on bringing customer data and processes in control and we help change programs by making impactful analyses.

Projects you can think of:

Doing deep dives on data quality

Provide insights into the operation of customer processes such as Client Onboarding (NCTO)

Impact analyses of new regulations

Monitoring/self-service BI dashboards in Power BI

Vulnerable customers (social impact)

Skills & Qualifications:

You possess excellent analytical skills and you are strong in getting the message across

Up to 2 years of relevant work experience

Experience with one of the following programming languages: SQL, Python/PySpark

Experience with visualising in Power BI or a similar visualization tool

A relevant (university) degree

Full Professional English, Professional Working Dutch

You understand the business and can convey technical subjects in a non-technical language

You have strong communication and interpersonal skills which helps you to collaborate with various departments

You are able to translates data insights into effective and attractive visualisations in Power BI

You have a curious mindset and know what is happening within the organisation with regards to projects you work on

You take responsibility, you are self-organizing and you take initiative

Title: Investment Data Analyst
HTML:
Skill Farm Members are invited to apply for the following role:

Responsibilities:

Collecting, validating and delivering accurate and timely market data throughout the bank to value trading positions such as Interest Rate or FX derivatives, commodity and credit products;

Discussing with traders in hubs such as Hong Kong, London, New York or Sao Paulo what the best setup for their valuation instrument is;

Looking for continuous improvements of processes by automation or simplification.

You drive change in the team by focusing on implementing new technology that can help make our processes more efficient.

Skills & Qualifications:

You hold a master's degree with a focus on Finance, Economics or Econometrics or a degree in another discipline but with a keen interest in the financial sector;

You can demonstrate your knowledge on financial products that are valued at fair value;

You have a tangible interest in IT related systems and processes;

You have a tangible interest in the management of data

You are able to clearly express your ideas in English both orally and in written form;

CFA, FRM, PRM or equivalent is considered an asset or willingness to work towards one;

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
regel jij dat 300 miljoen artikelen in 500 winkels aankomen?

Ben jij een data-liefhebber die graag orde schept in de chaos en inzichten weet om te zetten in concrete acties? Zoek je een dynamische omgeving waar je impact kunt maken? Dan is dit jouw kans om deel uit te maken van het Supply Chain team bij HEMA!




maak onalledaags veel impact!

Als Data Analist in ons Supply Chain team speel je een cruciale rol in het optimaliseren van onze processen. Jouw analyses zorgen ervoor dat onze producten altijd op de juiste plek en op het juiste moment beschikbaar zijn.

Ons Supply Chain team bestaat uit 74 collega's. Samen streven we ernaar om net zo tech-savvy en data-gedreven te worden als de besten in de industrie. Dit betekent dat we continu verbeteren en innoveren om voorop te blijven lopen.




De uitdaging die voor je ligt? Momenteel hebben we een data fundament voor HEMA in de cloud met Athena en PowerBI. Dit fundament moet de komende jaren worden uitgebouwd zodat alle stakeholders state-of-the-art inzichten en rapportages hebben om hun werk meer data-driven te doen. Dit doe je niet alleen: je zal nauw samenwerken met ons centrale data & analytics team.




dit ga je doen bij HEMA

Verzamelen, analyseren en interpreteren van grote hoeveelheden data om trends en patronen te ontdekken.
Helpen inrichten van ons data domein en ownership pakken binnen het team.
Actief samenwerken met data counterparts, data scientists en data engineers om prioriteiten te bepalen en technische vragen te vertalen.
Opstellen van dashboards en rapportages die onze teams helpen om snel en gefundeerde beslissingen te nemen.
Proactief signaleren van verbetermogelijkheden en hierover adviseren, waarbij je ook weerstand kunt bieden en overtuigend kunt zijn.




dit haal je bij HEMA

Een salaris van ‚Ç¨ 3.500 tot ‚Ç¨ 5.500 bruto op basis van 40 uur werken per week.
Natuurlijk vakantiegeld van 8%, maar mogelijk ook een jaarlijkse variabele beloning van maximaal 14% afhankelijk van de bedrijfsdoelstellingen en - resultaten
Een vaste eindejaarsuitkering van 4% en een netto maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding van ‚Ç¨65
15% korting op al je HEMA-favorieten
Een goede pensioenregeling
Reiskostenvergoeding van 0,21 ct per km vanaf 10km met een maximum van 30km.
30 vakantiedagen op basis van 40 uur per week
Kortingen via het platform Benefits at work




dit neem je mee naar HEMA

Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring in een soortgelijke omgeving en rol. Hierdoor weet jij als geen ander hoe je complexe data omzet naar bruikbare inzichten.
Technische skills: je bent specialist in SQL, Excel en Power BI. Kennis van Python of R is mooi meegenomen.
Initiatief en verantwoordelijkheid: je hebt ook PO-skills om prioriteiten te bepalen en de samenwerking met andere teams te co√∂rdineren. Je bent proactief en neemt graag initiatief.
Analytisch en praktisch: je hebt een scherpe analytische blik en een pragmatische instelling. Je ziet het grote geheel, maar hebt ook oog voor detail.
Flexibiliteit en overtuigingskracht: je kunt effectief samenwerken met verschillende stakeholders en weet hoe je weerstand kunt bieden en anderen kunt overtuigen van jouw idee√´n.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst AI Team
Description:
What is your role?

Would you like to be part of the AI service team at Lely?

Are you naturally inclined towards research and incremental innovation?

Join our team and let‚Äôs create together Lely's 2030 AI vision. We're looking for a versatile individual with expertise in building prototypes. As a member of our AI team, you'll engage with state-of-the-art technologies, analyze extensive datasets, collaborate on the future AI advancements at Lely, and transform data into actionable insights that fuel innovation.

The role


Utilizing your expertise in statistical analysis and programming languages such as Python, you will identify trends, patterns, and correlations within the data. Your role will also involve creating visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you will play a vital role in designing experiments, testing hypotheses, to enhance our products and services.
We look for a hands-on Data analyst that enjoys quick experimentation and creating prototypes to validate ideas.
You will work mainly on data exploration, descriptive analytics, and creating POC models.
Your focus will be on understanding historical data trends, patterns, providing actionable insights and develop experiments based on that.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business challenges and develop solutions and fulfill business needs.
Comfortable using storytelling to convey data insights.


What is your experience?


Your responsibilities include data cleaning, exploratory data analysis (EDA), visualization, and creating dashboards/reports.
Proficiency in data manipulation tools (SQL, databricks) and visualization tools.
Knowledge of statistics and research methods is important.
Experienced with Azure cloud is a plus.
Knowledge of ML / modelling / LLM would be an asset.
Acquainted with Agile framework.
You bring an entrepreneurial attitude complemented by a proactive mindset. You see challenges as opportunities, always focused on achieving results.
You have great communication skills


What do we offer you?

To address the food demand and challenge for 2050, it is crucial to handle people, animals, and the environment responsibly. For us, this means being a reliable long-term partner for our customers and passing on the world to the next generation through sustainable product development. You can contribute to realizing this dream.

What can you expect in your role as a Data Analyst?


Working in an international work environment within one of the most innovative organizations in the Netherlands and also the largest robot producer in Europe.
Excellent employment conditions, including up to 8 weeks of vacation and a salary of up to ‚Ç¨5600,- with room for growth within the scale.
Opportunities for growth where you are in charge of your own development.
Space and freedom to innovate, bring in new ideas, and undertake initiatives. We not only offer this, but we also genuinely expect it. It's up to you to come up with ideas and implement them.
A team with enthusiastic, helpful colleagues, collaborating with product development, procurement, and other stakeholders.
Our Lely Academy offers various training programs, such as personality training or more job-relevant training. If you want to develop yourself but it's not in the curriculum, you discuss it with your manager.
The #FitatLely program with our own Lely Gym. A volleyball court, basketball court, football table, and ping pong table where you can challenge your colleagues or take a break from work.
Lease-a-Bike scheme to lease a new bike affordably.
Additionally, enjoy the services and wide range of coffee and tea from our personal barista at the Lely Campus, who makes the tastiest cappuccinos from fresh milk, directly from our own farmer from the Lely Orbiter, for example.
A healthy work-life balance with a hybrid policy where you are 60% on Campus. This is flexible and can be arranged in consultation with your manager. Prefer more time on our modern Campus? You are always welcome (between 06:00 a.m. and 08:00 p.m.).
Moreover, we love to celebrate. Whether it's an anniversary or our Christmas party, at Lely, we know how to celebrate! For a feel of the atmosphere, check out this video:


If you want to know more about working at Lely or about the vacancy, please contact me or respond via the button.

Recruitment & selection agency, consultancy, and/or staffing agency?

We appreciate the interest, but we recruit all our candidates directly. We understand that as intermediaries, you want to present candidates for our great positions and contribute to our ambitions, but this is not how we have set up our recruitment process. This means that all unsolicited profiles offered on Lely vacancies will be treated as direct applications.

About Lely

Lely, founded in 1948, directs all its efforts towards creating a sustainable, profitable and enjoyable future in farming. Circling the cow, the company develops premium robotics and data systems that increase animal welfare, flexibility and the production on the dairy farm. For more than 75 years, Lely has been leading in the sale and service of automated milking systems to successive generations of dairy farmers across the globe. Every day, Lely inspires her employees to offer customers innovative solutions and be a reliable partner for long-term advice and support. With her Head office in The Netherlands and a worldwide network of dedicated Lely Center locations for tailor-made sales and support, the Lely Group is active in more than 50 countries and employs around 2400 people.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us

Would you like to make a positive impact on the world? Do you want to be part of an exciting fast-growing international scale-up? Do you love data, interpreting and analyzing it? If the answer is yes, you have come to the right place because we are looking for a Data Analyst to join the Talk360 team!

We are rebuilding our Data team, and as the data analyst you will play a pivotal role in shaping our data-driven company culture and driving transformative growth. You will have the unique opportunity to define and elevate data analytics within the organization. By applying your expertise proactively, you will uncover invaluable insights that directly impact our product development, user retention & growth, operations excellence and overall business strategies.




What will you do?

Proactively identify areas for improvement in user experience and business performance through data analysis, driving road maps based on insights and recommendations.
Offer comprehensive data support to teams across Growth Marketing, Product, Finance, Sales, Operations, and People & Culture - with strong focus on growth and product. Sample tasks:
measure new product feature impact
analyze pricing impact
measure effectiveness of marketing campaigns
Develop compelling data visualizations and dashboards to provide actionable insights on business performance and areas for improvement.
Conduct weekly business performance reporting and proactively investigate any issues and anomalies that arise.
Construct optimized data models to facilitate analysis and dashboard creation.
Actively contribute to fostering a data-driven culture by providing training sessions and developing documentation and self-service tools for enhanced data access and analysis across all teams.




Who are you?

You have advanced SQL, Python and R skills with proficiency in Tableau;
You have experience with building data models, preferably with DBT;
You have at least 3 years of hands-on analytics experience working with product, marketing & operations, ideally at a software / tech scale up;
You can connect data analysis findings to the business goals and provide actionable recommendations that have a positive impact on business outcomes;
You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
You are a self-starter and have proactive ownership of your work, driving projects, having a hands-on approach, combining strategic and technical thinking with concrete actions.
You have excellent communication skills, being able to share ideas in a concrete, critical, and positive manner, and collaborate with an international and multicultural team.
You have strong Project Managing experience (planning, execution and delivery) and are ready to take the lead and drive cross-functional projects;
You have a growth mindset, are eager to learn, you‚Äôre not scared to fail fast and learn fast.
Purpose driven: we are a calling app focused at bridging distances for migrants.
You have demonstrated ability to effectively communicate and set priorities with a variety of key stakeholders at all levels of the organization;




Did we mention these other great things?

Growth and learning opportunities in a high-growth environment.
Personal development budget, also for non-job-related opportunities.
Company laptop
Monthly phone allowance
25 vacation days annually
Commute allowance
Weekly Thursday lunches, with more gatherings in between.
Loads of autonomy
Work with a diverse & multicultural team - we have Talketeers all over the world, such as Suriname, Turkey, Estonia, Egypt, Kenya, Nigeria, South Africa, and the Netherlands.




Does this sound like what you are looking for and would you like to be part of our journey? Then make sure to get in touch today because we can‚Äôt wait to meet you!

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About HousingAnywhereHousingAnywhere is Europe‚Äôs largest mid-term rental platform. With Kamernet and Studapart under its umbrella, it represents three fast-growing brands with over 30 million yearly unique visitors combined, 160,000+ properties available for rent and 100,000+ tenants securing their new homes, based on the 2022 performance. HousingAnywhere serves young professionals and students, primarily aged between 18 and 35, connecting them with accommodation providers. Through its advanced technology platform, tenants rent accommodation for 3 to 12 months outside of their country of origin. Headquartered in Rotterdam, HousingAnywhere operates in most European cities and recently expanded to key cities in the US, establishing a presence in over 125 cities. Title: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Title

Junior Business Intelligence Analyst

Job Description Summary

As a Business Intelligence Analyst for our Netherlands business, you will be a pivotal member of the Netherlands dedicated BI team, focused on local delivery and transforming Netherlands analytics offerings. Collaborating closely with local teams and leadership, you will leverage data to drive insights, enhance client value, and propel our business operations forward. Working in tandem with a locally focused data operations team, your role is nested within the larger EMEA Analytics team, ensuring synergy with a wide array of talent including data scientists and automation specialists. You will specialize in analyzing and interpreting data, providing actionable insights to inform strategic decisions for both our clients & internal operations. Your exceptional analytical skills, combined with a deep understanding of BI tools, will enable you to visualize and communicate complex data effectively. This high-visibility role is not just about analyzing numbers, it's about being at the heart of innovation and playing a key role in driving significant, positive change across our organization.

Please send your CV in English.

Job Description

Responsibilities:


Collaborate with clients and internal stakeholders to deliver market, client, and operational intelligence.
Serve as the client's advocate, translating their needs and feedback into actionable insights.
Simplify and present complex data clearly to diverse audiences, ensuring understanding across all client types and levels of leadership.
Convert strategic business inquiries into actionable insights by actively seeking out and defining necessary analytics resources and requirements.
Create prototype solutions such as reports and dashboards to visually represent complex data sets and support insight generation.
Partner closely with wider EMEA Analytics Team to ensure the maximum value and best outcome is achieved.
Deliver on the KPIs assigned to you that align with business goals, supported by a solid analytical framework.
Facilitate communication between business units and Analytics teams to clearly define project objectives, business needs, and timelines, enhancing data organization, innovation, and optimization.


Requirements:


Fluency in both English and Dutch is required.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Economics, Real Estate or Technology.
Common MS Office applications to excellent levels including SharePoint and OneDrive.
Min. 1 years of experience in Power BI (or any other data visualization tool e.g. Tableau)
Great attention to detail, diligent and focused.
Committed, able to work to deadlines, prioritise and juggle between tasks.
Business writing and reporting skills
Thoughtful, collaborative, and proactive ready to engage with stakeholders across the globe.
Ability to build & maintain effective working relationships with internal and external personnel.
Demonstrate flexibility and ability to deliver.
Good team player, also able to work independently.
Curiosity and drive to solve problems.
Experience with SQL is preferred
Experience with Databricks and/ or Azure is preferred
Eager to learn


What Do We Offer:


An informal working atmosphere in which you work together with enthusiastic and inspiring colleagues with years of experience in commercial real estate;
Plenty of room for own initiatives, a lot of independence and responsibility plus various growth opportunities;
A pleasant workplace in a modern office in the Amsterdam Zuidas area;
Hybrid working model;
Good secondary benefits including 31 days of leave, laptop and iPhone, holiday pay, bonus scheme, pension scheme, employer's contribution to group health insurance and company fitness;
Cozy company and team outings!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What is your role?

Would you like to be a part of the discussion about the best way to run the dairy business of the future? Would you find it interesting to figure out which performance indicators are key to ensuring that dairy farmers too can run their businesses optimally? Does clearly identifying the mutual correlations within all our data on animal health, automated feeding, reproduction and rations sound like a stimulating challenge to you? Do you also have ample experience of data analysis (agricultural industry, robotics, machines or IoT devices) and are you looking for a meaningful job in which you can make an essential contribution to an innovative and sustainable mission?

If so, please read on!

Thanks to the more than 30,000 (real-time) users of our management system, we already have plenty of big data on hand. As a data specialist, you will know better than anyone how to identify the correlations that will form the starting point for new plans and ideas. Quite cool, isn't it? As well as deploying your in-depth expertise on data analysis, you will be helping your team to monitor the progress of their project and the quality of their solutions.

Good communication skills are essential, as is an ability to tell a story in an inspiring fashion.

Since you will be collaborating closely with the Data Engineering and Data Science departments, some knowledge of these areas is also desirable. If you would really like to make a difference and feel this challenge is right up your street, we would love to hear from you!

What is your experience?


Education to higher vocational or university level.
Capability to think conceptually and advise stakeholders accordingly.
Experience as a Data Analyst (knowledge of dairy farming data would be an asset).
Experience in visualisation (acquired by working with e.g. Tableau, QlickView or PowerBI).
Experience with processing data (SQL, Python).
Experience with PySpark would be a great asset!
Knowledge of statistics and research methods.
Familiarity with operating on large data sets (terabytes).
(Azure) Cloud experience would be an asset.
Knowledge of machine learning/modelling would be an asset.
Some understanding of modern software engineering practices would be an asset.
Scrum experience would be an asset.


What do we offer you?

To address the food demand and challenge for 2050, it is crucial to handle people, animals, and the environment responsibly. For us, this means being a reliable long-term partner for our customers and passing on the world to the next generation through sustainable product development. You can contribute to realizing this dream.

What can you expect in your role as a Data Analyst?


Working in an international work environment within one of the most innovative organizations in the Netherlands and also the largest robot producer in Europe.
Excellent employment conditions, including up to 8 weeks of vacation and a salary of up to ‚Ç¨5600,- with room for growth within the scale.
Opportunities for growth where you are in charge of your own development.
Space and freedom to innovate, bring in new ideas, and undertake initiatives. We not only offer this, but we also genuinely expect it. It's up to you to come up with ideas and implement them.
A team with enthusiastic, helpful colleagues, collaborating with product development, procurement, and other stakeholders.
Our Lely Academy offers various training programs, such as personality training or more job-relevant training. If you want to develop yourself but it's not in the curriculum, you discuss it with your manager.
The #FitatLely program with our own Lely Gym. A volleyball court, basketball court, football table, and ping pong table where you can challenge your colleagues or take a break from work.
Lease-a-Bike scheme to lease a new bike affordably.
Additionally, enjoy the services and wide range of coffee and tea from our personal barista at the Lely Campus, who makes the tastiest cappuccinos from fresh milk, directly from our own farmer from the Lely Orbiter, for example.
A healthy work-life balance with a hybrid policy where you are 60% on Campus. This is flexible and can be arranged in consultation with your manager. Prefer more time on our modern Campus? You are always welcome (between 06:00 a.m. and 08:00 p.m.).
Moreover, we love to celebrate. Whether it's an anniversary or our Christmas party, at Lely, we know how to celebrate! For a feel of the atmosphere, check out this video:


If you want to know more about working at Lely or about the vacancy, please contact me or respond via the button.

Recruitment & selection agency, consultancy, and/or staffing agency?

We appreciate the interest, but we recruit all our candidates directly. We understand that as intermediaries, you want to present candidates for our great positions and contribute to our ambitions, but this is not how we have set up our recruitment process. This means that all unsolicited profiles offered on Lely vacancies will be treated as direct applications.

About Lely

Lely, founded in 1948, directs all its efforts towards creating a sustainable, profitable and enjoyable future in farming. Circling the cow, the company develops premium robotics and data systems that increase animal welfare, flexibility and the production on the dairy farm. For more than 75 years, Lely has been leading in the sale and service of automated milking systems to successive generations of dairy farmers across the globe. Every day, Lely inspires her employees to offer customers innovative solutions and be a reliable partner for long-term advice and support. With her Head office in The Netherlands and a worldwide network of dedicated Lely Center locations for tailor-made sales and support, the Lely Group is active in more than 40 countries and employs around 2300 people.

Dabei arbeitest du eng mit den Kunden aus Supportbereichen und der Fertigung zusammen. Technische Konzepte setzt du in der Realit√§t um.
Strukturiert beobachten: Du verstehst das √ñkosystem von Spritzgussanwendungen und Montagetechnik inkl. der zugrundeliegenden Parameter, Daten√ºbertragungmethoden und Datenquellen ganzheitlich.
Kooperation leben: Du kollaborierst mit Zentralabteilungen f√ºr Digitalisierung, Artificial Intelligence sowie Research & Development, um neueste Erkenntnisse in die technischen L√∂sungskonzepte einflie√üen zu lassen.

Erfahrungen und Know-How: Sehr gute MS Office-Kenntnisse, Kenntnisse von Datenbanken, Grundkenntnisse im Daten-Streaming und AI/ML-Modellen, Programmierkenntnisse sind von Vorteil
Sprachen: Gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Deutsch von Vorteil


Zus√§tzliche Informationen

Das Bosch PreMaster Programm ist ein zweistufiges Qualifizierungsprogramm f√ºr engagierte Bachelor-Absolvent*innen, die das Ziel haben, ein Masterstudium zu absolvieren. Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
Senior Data Engineer

Data Engineer opportunity in a fast growing, global provider of fiber optic-based sensor technology. This position will sit within an enthusiastic and dynamic team, gaining you international business, working with high tech sensing solutions.




Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ You will work on the development of our hybrid (Cloud and Edge) IoT data infrastructure (Data Lake and MLOps).

‚Ä¢ You will work on building a robust and scalable data catalogue to effectively manage metadata. This includes understanding and implementing best practices for data governance, management, and accessibility.

‚Ä¢ You will work on a highly efficient storage layer to handle large amounts of sensor data (petabytes). The focus is on ensuring data integrity, speed, and scalability.

‚Ä¢ In close collaboration with other Data Engineers, ML Engineers, and Software Engineers, you will translate our business challenges into scalable data architectures.




Key Skills

‚Ä¢ You have a technical degree, ideally in computer science.

‚Ä¢ You have at least 2 years of professional experience in data engineering, ideally in the field of big data and the management of sensor data for data analysis.

‚Ä¢ You have excellent knowledge of state-of-the-art storage technologies and their productive use (no SQL, time series databases, document stores, graph databases, etc.).

‚Ä¢ You have sound programming skills in development with Python or other programming languages.

‚Ä¢ Ideally, you have good knowledge of at least one major cloud platform (AWS, GCP or Azure) and understand how to use the services optimally.

Title: Imagery Analyst
Description:
Job Number: R0200243

Imagery Analyst

The Opportunity:

Critical decisions are made every single day to support our National Security. What if you could use your analytical skills to help your client make informed decisions? With all the information available today, it takes a skilled analyst to know how to find and interpret the best data to give their clients the right answers. As an Imagery Analyst, you use your specialized technical, regional, and functional experience and your attention to detail to develop imagery-based intelligence that gives your clients the actionable intelligence and context they need. If you have strong analytical skills and a problem-solving mindset, we have an opportunity to use those skills to support our warfighters, protect our national security, and inform our clients and national leadership.

As an Imagery Analyst on our team, you‚Äôll help your client understand and implement the most efficient analytic strategies to acquire and understand the data they require. Using your understanding of various collection platform capabilities and applications, you will help your client develop effective information fusion strategies combining GEOINT with other sources, including SIGINT, ELINT, MASINT, and open-source, to develop comprehensive reporting that informs your client and provides them with actionable intelligence. You‚Äôll validate the information and apply imagery analysis tradecraft as you work to further refine collection strategies and analytic approaches to existing and emerging problem sets for warfighters, senior policymakers, internal clients, and U.S. IC-wide stakeholders. As the authority in your tradecraft, your client will look to you for time-critical recommendations, often under pressure. This is a chance to grow your expertise, develop new skills in Automated Tipping and Queueing software modeling tools, and share your methodologies with other analysts. We focus on growing as a team to deliver the best support to our customers, so you‚Äôll have resources for mentoring and learning new skills and tools. Join us as we provide the right information at the right time to support the critical needs of our clients, warfighters, national leaders, and policymakers.

Join us. The world can‚Äôt wait.

You Have:


6+ years of experience as an Imagery Analyst
6+ years of experience with geospatial intelligence and reading intelligence issues, military affairs, and the use of GIS to develop geospatial intelligence reports and products to solve problems
Experience with NTM sensors and capabilities, including EO, SAR, IR, and MSI and Motion Imagery, Civil or Commercial Sensors, and tasking and collection processes and protocols
Experience with using a variety of DoD specified digital data formats, including commercial imagery, panchromatic data, spectral data, and SAR and OPIR data
Experience with RemoteView, Orchestration Services or Cedalion, IEC, ArcGIS, and Interlink
Experience with common office software, including spreadsheets, word processing, and emails
Knowledge of standard and non-standard client reports, including Orchestration Services remarks and formal foundational military intelligence GEOINT products, including facility baselines and GNs
Ability to create, update, and manage geospatial information system databases and products
TS/SCI clearance
Bachelor's degree



Nice If You Have:


Experience as a Geospatial Analyst
Experience with Structured Observation Management (SOM)
Experience with the extraction of feature data using NTM, Mapping, Charting, and Geodesy (MC&G) Stereo Imagery, Digital Point Positioning Database (DPPDB), or Orthrectified Mono Equivalent, including Precise Terrain and Ortho Product (PTOP), Mr. Sid Orth Rectified Geotiffs (MSOG), Precise Orth Rectified Image Datasets (POl D), and Controlled Image Base (CIB)
Knowledge of multi-disciplinary intelligence (MDI)
Ability to facilitate interagency collaboration
Master's degree
Completion of a Military Service MOS, AFSC, or NOS Granting Imagery Analysis Course

HTML:
Job Number: R0200243

Imagery Analyst

The Opportunity:

Critical decisions are made every single day to support our National Security. What if you could use your analytical skills to help your client make informed decisions? With all the information available today, it takes a skilled analyst to know how to find and interpret the best data to give their clients the right answers. As an Imagery Analyst, you use your specialized technical, regional, and functional experience and your attention to detail to develop imagery-based intelligence that gives your clients the actionable intelligence and context they need. If you have strong analytical skills and a problem-solving mindset, we have an opportunity to use those skills to support our warfighters, protect our national security, and inform our clients and national leadership.

As an Imagery Analyst on our team, you‚Äôll help your client understand and implement the most efficient analytic strategies to acquire and understand the data they require. Using your understanding of various collection platform capabilities and applications, you will help your client develop effective information fusion strategies combining GEOINT with other sources, including SIGINT, ELINT, MASINT, and open-source, to develop comprehensive reporting that informs your client and provides them with actionable intelligence. You‚Äôll validate the information and apply imagery analysis tradecraft as you work to further refine collection strategies and analytic approaches to existing and emerging problem sets for warfighters, senior policymakers, internal clients, and U.S. IC-wide stakeholders. As the authority in your tradecraft, your client will look to you for time-critical recommendations, often under pressure. This is a chance to grow your expertise, develop new skills in Automated Tipping and Queueing software modeling tools, and share your methodologies with other analysts. We focus on growing as a team to deliver the best support to our customers, so you‚Äôll have resources for mentoring and learning new skills and tools. Join us as we provide the right information at the right time to support the critical needs of our clients, warfighters, national leaders, and policymakers.

Join us. The world can‚Äôt wait.

You Have:

  • 6+ years of experience as an Imagery Analyst
  • 6+ years of experience with geospatial intelligence and reading intelligence issues, military affairs, and the use of GIS to develop geospatial intelligence reports and products to solve problems
  • Experience with NTM sensors and capabilities, including EO, SAR, IR, and MSI and Motion Imagery, Civil or Commercial Sensors, and tasking and collection processes and protocols
  • Experience with using a variety of DoD specified digital data formats, including commercial imagery, panchromatic data, spectral data, and SAR and OPIR data
  • Experience with RemoteView, Orchestration Services or Cedalion, IEC, ArcGIS, and Interlink
  • Experience with common office software, including spreadsheets, word processing, and emails
  • Knowledge of standard and non-standard client reports, including Orchestration Services remarks and formal foundational military intelligence GEOINT products, including facility baselines and GNs
  • Ability to create, update, and manage geospatial information system databases and products
  • TS/SCI clearance
  • Bachelor's degree


Nice If You Have:

  • Experience as a Geospatial Analyst
  • Experience with Structured Observation Management (SOM)
  • Experience with the extraction of feature data using NTM, Mapping, Charting, and Geodesy (MC&G) Stereo Imagery, Digital Point Positioning Database (DPPDB), or Orthrectified Mono Equivalent, including Precise Terrain and Ortho Product (PTOP), Mr. Sid Orth Rectified Geotiffs (MSOG), Precise Orth Rectified Image Datasets (POl D), and Controlled Image Base (CIB)
  • Knowledge of multi-disciplinary intelligence (MDI)
  • Ability to facilitate interagency collaboration
  • Master's degree
  • Completion of a Military Service MOS, AFSC, or NOS Granting Imagery Analysis Course
  • GPC-II Imagery Certification


Clearance:

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.

Title: Masterprogramm Data Science & Business Analytics (all genders)
Description:
Allgemein

Du liebst Daten und hast erkannt, dass sie das Gold der Zukunft sind? Du m√∂chtest lernen, Zusammenh√§nge und Muster darin zu erkennen? Sehr gut, dann suchen wir Dich ab Oktober 2024 am Standort Stuttgart f√ºr unser berufsbegleitendes Masterprogramm!

Das Masterstudium zeichnet sich durch eine hohe Anwendungsorientierung aus und erm√∂glicht ein gewinnbringendes Studieren in Verbindung mit dem Beruf. Dabei wird dir im theoretischen Teil des Studiums modernes Wissen, Vorgehensweisen und Tools in den Bereichen Datenanalyse, maschinelles Lernen, k√ºnstliche Intelligenz und Big Data vermittelt. Du lernst, wie Du Daten effektiv erfasst, verarbeitest, analysierst und modellierst, um gro√üe Datenmengen gewinnbringend zu nutzen, komplexe Probleme zu l√∂sen und eine datenbasierte Entscheidungsfindung zu unterst√ºtzen.

Studiendauer: voraussichtlich 5 Semester

Deine Aufgaben

Das Masterstudium Data Science & Business Analytics bei DYMATRIX beinhaltet 3 Schwerpunkte: Data Management, Marketing Automation & Costumer Analytics/ Data Science. Nach dem Studium bist Du also in der Lage, die Kundenansprache von Unternehmen in Form von Marketingkampagnen mit Hilfe von Daten zu optimieren.

Data Management

Du wirst bei uns im Bereich Solutions & Consulting eingesetzt ‚Äì und lernst so die technische und fachliche Grundlage f√ºr unser Business kennen:


Du erlebst, wie theoretische Vorlesungsinhalte zu ‚ÄûBusiness Intelligence‚Äú und ‚ÄûData Warehousing‚Äú in der Praxis angewendet werden und arbeitest Dich mit unserer Unterst√ºtzung in die Themen ein. So bleiben ETL-Prozesse, OLAP-Cubes und Reportings f√ºr Dich nicht nur graue Theorie, sondern werden Bestandteil spannender Projektarbeit.
Du hebst das Datengold, indem Du lernst, komplexe Datenarchitekturen zur Massendaten- (BIG DATA) oder Echtzeitdatenverarbeitung zu konzipieren und zu realisieren.
Du sorgst f√ºr die Umsetzung auf Basis neuester Technologien unserer f√ºhrenden Technikpartner, l√§sst das Gold in Social-Media-Plattformen flie√üen und optimierst den Fluss durch z.B. InMemory-Datenbanken.
‚Ä¶ und dabei bleibst Du nicht stehen, sondern erschlie√üt neue Goldminen und arbeitest Dich mit unserer Unterst√ºtzung in neue Technologien ein.


Marketing Automation:


Du erh√§ltst Einblick in herausfordernde Prozesse im Bereich Marketing Automation und Customer Monitoring und unterst√ºtzt uns bei der Umsetzung.
Du sorgst f√ºr die Umsetzung Deines erworbenen Wissens rund um Data Management/ Business Analytics und Data Science, um die Marketingkampagnen unserer Kundenunternehmen zu automatisieren und zu optimieren.


Im letzten Semester arbeitest Du in Analytics-Projekten mit und hilfst gemeinsam mit uns dabei, das Datengold unserer Kunden weiter zu veredeln.

Customer Analytics/ Data Science


Anhand von Algorithmen und Modellen sagst Du vorher, was ein Kunde / eine Kundin wollen wird ‚Äì vielleicht ohne, dass er / sie es selbst schon wei√ü!
Du optimierst den Gutscheinversand, prognostizierst K√ºndigungswahrscheinlichkeiten oder hilfst, die Zweitkaufrate zu steigern.
Dazu arbeitest du mit Daten in verschiedenen Speichersystemen (z.B. Hadoop, relationale Datenbanken, NoSQL) und bereitest die Inhalte f√ºr die konkrete Analysefragestellung auf.
Au√üerdem nutzt du statistische Software (KNIME, Apache Spark, R, Python ‚Ä¶) um Analysen durchzuf√ºhren und verschiedene Data Mining-Modelle zu entwickeln.


Die dazugeh√∂rigen Vorlesungen und theoretischen Lehrinhalte werden Dir an einer unserer Kooperationshochschulen (z.B. HdM), ggf. in Form eines mehrstufigen Kontaktstudiums vermittelt.

Das Bringst Du Idealerweise Mit


abgeschlossenes Bachelor- oder Diplomstudium (mindestens 210 ECTS) in Wirtschaftsinformatik, -mathematik, -wissenschaften, √ñkonometrie, Statistik, Psychologie, Physik, Informatik oder vergleichbare Studieng√§nge
mindestens eine einj√§hrige einschl√§gige Berufserfahrung nach dem ersten Hochschulstudium
ausgepr√§gte analytische und konzeptionelle Denkweise
Programmieraffinit√§t
Interesse an CRM/Marketing
sehr gute Pr√§sentations- und Kommunikationsf√§higkeiten
gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse


√úber uns

DYMATRIX ist einer der f√ºhrenden deutschen L√∂sungsanbieter f√ºr die Themen Customer Analytics, Marketing Automation und Kampagnenmanagement. Der Fokus liegt dabei auf dem Auf- und Ausbau von Kundenwissen als Basis f√ºr eine erfolgreiche Unternehmenssteuerung und effizientes Marketing. Neben Beratungsleistungen und der Durchf√ºhrung von Kundenprojekten bieten wir mit DynaCampaign eine eigene Softwarel√∂sung an, die es Unternehmen erm√∂glicht, ihre Kunden und Interessenten mit individualisierten Angeboten kanal√ºbergreifend anzusprechen. Seit August 2014 sind wir Teil der Performance Interactive Alliance, einer der f√ºhrenden Unternehmensgruppen f√ºr Digital Strategy, Marketing und Analytics Automation sowie Services.

Lass Dich von unserer besonderen Art √ºberraschen! Freue Dich auf ein unb√ºrokratisches und spannendes Arbeitsumfeld in einem innovativen Unternehmen. Als Partner der gro√üen IT-Plattformen (z.B. Microsoft, Databricks) erm√∂glichen wir Dir stetige Weiterentwicklung mit innovativen Technologien.
