Title: Graduate - Data Analyst
Description:
Are you eager to get into the emerging world of Data and work with the latest technologies? Do you have great attention to detail and strong analytical skills? How would you like to work for Leasing Company of the Year?

If your answer is 'yes' to all of these, keep reading.

Key Dates


Application open date - 5th June 2024
Application close date - 21st July 2024
Assessment centre date - 8th October 2024
Interviews - 17th and 18th October 2024
Start date - 18th November 2024
Length of programme - 2 years


Want to know a little about us?

At Novuna Vehicle Solutions, we're passionate about building a better tomorrow. Which is why we're lighting the way in the electric vehicle revolution. From family cars to HGVs, we're helping customers of all kinds on their journey to carbon-free mobility.

We're proud to be a Top 50 Inclusive employer. We're a signatory of the Women in Finance and the Race at Work Charter and we're DisabilityConfidentCommitted.

What does the role involve?

As a Data Analyst Graduate, you will be joining the Risk team within our Vehicle Solutions business unit. During the two-year programme, you will play an active part in working on cutting-edge projects, analysing data to uncover insights and trends, supporting with data-driven decision making across Vehicle Solutions. You'll get the chance to spend time in several key business areas, including Data Modelling, Data Quality, Data Visualisation and Data Stewards, so you'll certainly have plenty of opportunities to develop yourself as a professional, and potential leader.

Our office is based in Newbury but we're passionate about hybrid working,attendance at the Newbury office is a minimum of 2 days per week. On occasions, you may be required to travel to our Trowbridge office based on business requirements.

Some Of Your Key Duties Will Include


Design and implement analytics and build Power BI dashboards and visualisations for business functions
Model, reshape and prepare data using SQL and Power BI to optimise dashboard performance
Create reports to communicate your findings to stakeholders, providing insights that support business strategies and decision-making
Working with the wider VS Data Team, contributing to data modelling and report & visualisation requirements, testing and analysis activities


In addition to your role above, as part of the Novuna Graduate Programme you will have the opportunity to:


Graduate from our industry accredited Aspiring Leaders programme
Play an active role within our Corporate Communities, helping to drive engagement, inclusion and belonging
Access trained mentors who can help develop your technical skills
Meet regularly as a cohort with our CEO, and have contact with other Executive Committee and Senior Leaders in the business


Beyond this, you'll continue to grow your career at Novuna through development conversations with your people leader.

What are we looking for?

You'll have recently graduated and achieved a 2:2 or above in your chosen degree.

In an ever-evolving environment you will flourish by using your talent for spotting opportunities to make things better. You'll have the ability to navigate relationships using your interpersonal skills, think creatively, be adaptable and last but certainly not least, have a passion for learning.

We're Also Looking For a Graduate Who Can


Work with and collaborate with others
Plan their own day and prioritise work
Adapt to change quickly and positively
Think differently and outside the box


What can we offer you?

At Novuna we take our people promise seriously. If you join us, you'll have a chance to make a difference, opportunities to learn, and time to shine.

Our Offer To You Includes


Starting salary of ¬£30,000, increasing to ¬£32,000 in Year 2
Up to 15% bonus, linked to company and individual performance
Flexible hybrid working
25 days' holiday, plus bank holidays and the option to buy/sell 5 days
Full wellbeing package including BUPA, digital GP service, 24/7 employee assistance, plus wellbeing events throughout the year
Up to 10% contributory pension
Flexible benefits options such as cycle to work, discounted personal finance and insurance


Want to know what it's like to be on a Novuna Graduate Programme? See what some of our graduates have to say - Graduate | Launch Your Career with Novuna's Graduate Opportunities

What's the next step?

Interested? Start your application today and see what Novuna can offer you.

Novuna has been named one of the top 50 most inclusive employers for the fourth year running and this is also reflected in our recruitment process. We are committed to ensuring our application process is inclusive and accessible to all candidates.

We're DisabilityConfidentCommitted, so if you're a person with a disability, if you're neurodivergent, or if you have a condition that you believe may affect your performance during our selection process, we'll be happy to make reasonable adjustments to our processes for you.

Title: Customer Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a new challenge that gives you the chance to use your knowledge and passion for Data Analysis to take Customer Insights at Selfridges to the next level? Looking for a company that wants to help further your career as well as provide you with an exciting, inspiring, and fun place to work?

If the answer to all of these questions is ‚Äòyes‚Äô then you‚Äôre just the kind of person we‚Äôre looking for!

Selfridges has a brilliant opportunity within the Customer Analytics Team, reporting to the Senior Customer Analytics Manager. As a Customer Data Analyst, you will have the exciting and rare chance to work in a fast-paced environment, to help us take our business to the next level

THE ROLE

As a Customer Analyst, some of your main responsibilities will be:

Provide weekly and monthly reports on key customer KPIs understand the drivers of their performance
Providing actionable insights of the back of analysis completed on customer and transactional data, using SQL.
Work with fellow analysts to create accessible, relevant, and actionable reports and Power BI dashboards, using multiple sources of data.
Own projects end-to-end and manage the process.
Champion a culture of self service by ensuring your stakeholders are suitably skilled in how to use our analytics tools.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

SQL knowledges and experience building Power BI or Salesforce Einstein Analytics dashboards ‚Äì Already experience using Power BI is a bonus
Proven experience dealing with large, complex datasets of different varieties (e.g. digital data, transactional data, marketing data) and evidence of being able to transform data into actionable insights
Strong Excel skills, including pivot tables and aggregation of data
Time management skills: Ability to meet deadlines while dealing with multiple priorities.
Passionate about the customer - you are passionate about improving the customer experience through delivering actionable insight
Impeccable attention to detail
A passion for solving new problems, learning new skills and furthering your understanding along the way.

Title: Data Analyst, Product Analytics
Description:
Bumble Inc. is seeking a skilled Product Analyst to collaborate with senior business stakeholders and product managers in providing data-driven insights across all stages of the product development lifecycle. This role will focus on experimentation, statistical analysis, data modelling and visualisation, as well as in-depth product analyses. This is a unique opportunity for an experienced analyst who enjoys a fast-paced environment and has a passion for contributing to helping the Bumble Inc. mission to foster kind connections.

Key Accountabilities


Be an analytical thought partner to a cross-functional team of engineers, designers and product managers. This will include providing analytical support across all areas of the product development lifecycle, from ideation and broad product strategy to analytics deep dives and experimentation.
You will lead experimentation across an area of the product. You will design and execute multi-step experiments to understand the impact of a feature or product change on user behaviour and business KPIs. You will interpret experiment results and translate them into actionable recommendations for a non-technical audience.
You will own event tracking for one area of the app, understanding which events are critical to track user behaviour.
You will create self-serve dashboards to ensure stakeholders have access to real-time insights.
You will provide actionable insights on product strategy and recommendations to your stakeholders, automating decision-making where applicable and providing tools and solutions that help enable self-service and scalability.
You will develop deep knowledge of the product domain, becoming an authority on its characteristics, drivers, and subsystems.
You will contribute to data quality related to the domain, proactively working with Data and Analytics Eng. and other teams to improve data collection and modelling.
You will create an environment of utilising data for planning and execution, always keeping in mind alternative and creative solutions to performance measurement across a variety of product initiatives.


Required Experience & Skills


Preference for a graduate degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Information Sciences, Economics, Finance, or STEM. PhD and Masters welcome.
You will have experience using SQL and python to solve data science, statistical and analytics problems.
I prefer experience working in similar dating, social, or gaming tech product industries or in financial services or high-data-volume industries.
You have experience working in a highly collaborative cross functional space and translating technical insights for a non-technical audience.
You have experience setting up experimentation, statistical measurement, and data collection in the product domain.
Strong experience creating data visualisations and self serve tools for a product forced audience.
You keep an eye out on the industry, understanding how the wider dating industry influences our product strategy.
You have experience working with complex data infrastructures and have experience partnering and guiding the work of data engineering to help facilitate ingestion, warehousing, and optimisation of databases.
3+ years experience in product analytics analytics, being able to elaborate on the business impact you have driven in your previous experience.


About You


Strong believer in Bumble Inc.‚Äôs brand vision and values
Engaging, inspiring and clear communicator. A proven track record of socialising and embedding analytical findings to drive business outcomes.
Understands and can demonstrate a data science skillset and use advanced analytical tools and visualisations to produce impact in an organisation.
Deep commercial understanding and a proven ability to create impact through the power of customer-led insights.
Comfort in operating in ambiguous and complex problem spaces, and helping cross functional teams to define the questions that help support product development.
A love of collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders to arrive at rounded and balanced perspectives in your work, a strong desire to learn from others
Commercially minded, with a keen sense of where insights can fuel growth.
Strong experience with python/SQL, visualisation tooling such as Looker/Tableau, and machine learning/data science tooling such as Streamlit/Count/Kubeflow.
Strong governance and data quality mindset.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst: ¬£30k-¬£60k ‚Äì London (Hybrid/Remote)




My client a leading financial service organisation are looking to build out their teams capabilities through the acquisition of a new Data Analyst. The ideal candidate will be responsible for gathering, processing, and analysing data to help drive informed business decisions. If you are passionate about data, possess strong analytical skills, and enjoy problem-solving, we want to hear from you!




This role will be operating in a standalone capacity and will see you liaising with C Level business stakeholders whilst relaying and explaining technical information to non-technical business teams. This role will also have a lot of scope for personal development with the successful candidate hopefully working their way up in seniority within the team.




This role will be based remotely, although travel into the London office would be required once per month.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company: A great opportunity to join a highly ambitious, London-based, food & drink consultancy on a mission to support our customers with expert data insight. They are one of the leading consultancies in the food and drinks industry, and provide expert consultancy through data and insight, powered by analytical thinking, outstanding expertise, and insights technology. They work with a broad range of clients emerging brands and operators and some of the most renowned businesses.




About the Role: They are looking for a Data Analyst to join their growing data team, this is more than a standard data role. This is an opportunity to work collaboratively.




Responsibilities:




Restructure and maintain data into a database-friendly multi-table format for all our product trackers and bespoke research.
Implement systems to help the optimization of data efficiency and data quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources to enrich our internal data.
Assist in the identification, design, development, and maintenance of new and existing data tools and applications.
Troubleshooting databases and BI tools to ensure minimal client disruption.
Set up and maintenance of automated data processes.
Track KPIs of our systems and processes.




Qualifications:




Previous experience working with survey data
Working experience in Python
Strong understanding of relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server).
Advanced Excel data handling and modelling.
Analytical and problem-solving skills to spot trends, errors and highlight / rectify.
Understand the process of acquiring, cleansing, and transforming data.
Dashboard building
Web analytics and behavioural tracking (i.e., Google Analytics)




Pay range and compensation package:35k-37k

Hybrid: 2 x days in London a week

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
About Inigo




We enable your ambition. We insure good people ‚Äì knowledgably, fairly, and efficiently. We combine our expertise with the best of science, data, and analytics.




Inigo's aim is to create an underwriting focused insurance and reinsurance business, concentrating on limited classes. We want to combine the best data and analytics that exist and build our own capability to generate insights to drive business decisions. At the top of our agenda is to create a diverse and open culture where we foster talent and provide opportunities to build a rewarding career in a company that is vibrant and at the start of an exciting journey.

We have a culture that is inclusive, fun, and constantly strives for excellence, we describe it as ‚Äòall in‚Äô. Our values are:




Get Smart ‚Äì we ask questions, explore, learn, and continuously strive for excellence
Park the Ego ‚Äì we are welcoming and open, and embrace different thinking
Share the Passion ‚Äì we collaborate and communicate our expertise honestly and thoughtfully
Radical Simplicity ‚Äì we are transparent, focused and actively avoid complexity in how we operate




Aim of the role




The aim of the role is to support the actuarial reserving team as well as the finance team. The candidate will work closely with the actuarial and finance teams to support various analytical tasks, including data collection, cleansing, and analysis. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, proficiency in Alteryx and Power BI, and the ability to communicate findings effectively.




The successful candidate will do this by:




Being the data manager and extracting, treating and cleansing data in order to have accurate and complete data for the reserving and finance process
Identifying and addressing data quality issues, including correcting data errors and capturing missing business information
Automating tasks in Alteryx or Power BI
Maintaining current Alteryx and Power BI models
Identifying opportunities to streamline data processes and enhance data quality though process and model improvements
Validating and reconciling data across multiple systems and providing reports to actuaries and management
Ensuring the data tools provide appropriate, complete and accurate data
Working with IT so they are aware of changes to tools and databases that may impact corporate systems or databases
Providing data to different stakeholders (Reserving, Pricing, Capital, Finance)




In addition to the above key responsibilities, you may be required to undertake other duties from time to time as the Company may reasonably require.




To do this, we‚Äôre going to need you to bring:




Experience in data analysis for Non-Life business
Experience with dealing with large amount of data
High proficiency in Alteryx and Power BI
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively with a variety of individuals in a variety of functions (e.g. finance, claims, underwriting, actuarial, operations)
Ability to deliver results under tight deadlines
Good problem-solving abilities

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role - Junior Data Analyst

Location - London

Salary - ¬£30k-¬£45 (DOE)




Join a revolutionary Financial services company based in the heart of London. Helping over 200,000 business across the UK and Europe overcome challenging events and increase profits.




They are looking for a Junior Data Analyst who is passionate about finance and leveraging data to drive business decisions. You will play a crucial role in analysing financial data sets, generating actionable insights, and supporting business operations through data-driven analysis.




Responsibilities:

Analyse raw financial data: assess quality, cleanse, and structure for downstream processing.
Generate accurate and insightful reports to support financial forecasting and market analysis.
Collaborate closely with the finance team to support analytical projects and business initiatives.
Provide actionable insights for business improvements based on data analysis.
Build interactive dashboards for senior stakeholders and clients to provide actionable insights.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a STEM field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, etc.).
Basic understanding of data analysis techniques, statistical methods, and data visualisation.
Proficiency in a programming language (Python, SQL) for data analysis and reporting tasks.
Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) for handling and visualising financial datasets.




Additional Skills (Preferred):

Experience working with financial data or related domains.
Knowledge of financial market dynamics and trends.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, agile environment.
Passion for learning and staying updated with the latest advancements in data analysis and finance technology.




Benefits:

Competitive salary package.
Annual Bonus
Opportunity to work in a dynamic and innovative finance environment.
Access to cutting-edge technologies and tools for data analysis.
Career development and growth opportunities within the company.




We would love to hear from you if you are a motivated Junior Data Analyst with a passion for finance and data-driven decision-making. Apply now to join our team and help shape the finance industry's future.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're looking for a motivated and ambitious Data Analyst to join our world-class team.

You will work closely with teams across the company (product & engineering, sales, customer success) to drive data-informed decision-making. You will be responsible for analysing user data, identifying trends, and providing actionable insights to improve our product and customer experience.

What The Job Involves


Collaborate with various team members to deeply understand data requirements and gain insights on customer and business needs
Analyse data to extract valuable and actionable insights on user behaviour (leads, clients and lawyers), product performance, and industry trends
Create and maintain visually appealing dashboards and reports to monitor and measure key product and experience metrics and performance indicators effectively
Design and execute A/B tests to assess the impact of product changes and new features
Apply statistical methods and utilise machine learning techniques to uncover patterns and predict user behaviour with precision
Effectively communicate findings and recommendations to the team in order to drive data-informed decision-making
Continuously monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of product changes and initiatives, iterating as necessary
Collaborate with the engineering team to optimise data collection processes, ensuring high-quality and accurate data integrity



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or Economics
At least 2 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in a role focused on product
Proficiency in SQL and hands-on experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, and Power BI
Strong analytical skills with a proven track record in statistical analysis and A/B testing
Excellent communication skills with the ability to clearly and concisely present complex data insights
Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to tackling business challenges
Prior experience in a fast-paced startup environment is a plus
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Knowledge of programming languages is a plus
Basic understanding of legal terminology and processes is a plus



Benefits

‚úàÔ∏è 34 Holidays (25 days annual leave + your birthday off + public holidays)

üè† Enjoy a fully remote working arrangement for a better work-life balance

üí∞ Competitive remuneration package including equity

‚õ≥Ô∏è Regular company socials

üíª Home set up support

Title: Data Analyst Power BI / DAX / SQL
Description:
About you:

This role is a great opportunity for a skilled data analyst who is looking for a role where they can really put their stamp on things and hit the ground running in a fast-paced, growing e-commerce business. Working closely with the Head of Data & FP&A, you will work cross-functionally across the Commercial, Finance & Marketing teams to deliver reports, insights and empower the business to become truly data-driven. We‚Äôre looking for someone who can drive data narrative behind the numbers and interpret trends and patterns to help drive growth across the business.




Your key responsibilities are:

Manage, maintain and develop the Power BI reporting platform
Optimise current Power BI dashboards and reports and create new reports as required by the wider business
Create interactive visualisations and reports that effectively communicate data findings
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by performing regular data validation and quality checks
Act as an internal expert for Power BI, ensuring its effective and efficient use
Work with our third-party who manages our data warehouse, ensuring the database is kept up to date and any required changes are implemented
You will constantly look for opportunities for improvement, including automating processes wherever possible
Strong communication skills and proactivity are required




Skills & Knowledge

Proficiency in Power BI, including Power Query, DAX, SQL, and data modelling
Advanced Excel and Microsoft Office skills
Ability to wrangle data to manage sophisticated datasets and find the best possible way to produce desired outputs
A basic understanding of the ETL process is desired
Previous experience in an e-commerce business required
Experience in data analytics
Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills, at all levels




Benefits

Competitive Salary based on experience
25 days holiday (rising to 28 days with service) + Bank Holidays
Enhanced Maternity/Paternity
EAP
Summer Hours
Birthday Day Off
Volunteering Days
Free onsite parking
Generous staff discount




Location: you will be based in our Northampton office where we are operating hybrid working with 2-3 days in the office and 2-3 days from home. Some flexibility around this will be required.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Central London

Up to ¬£70k + Bonus

Permanent




HL11367




Finatal is exclusively partnered with a Global Legal & Tech Advisory business in its second Private Equity lifecycle and is going through rapid growth, having exited at 4.5X. They are on a strong buy-and-build journey and are at the beginning of their data journey. They are searching for their first data hire to work across the organisation to drive a data culture and lead data-led decision-making through optimising reporting. Reporting to the CFO you will develop critical reports across finance and other areas of the business taking ownership of rolling out Power BI to the wider organisation.




Role:

Joining the business at the beginning of their journey you will use your strong technical ability to pull data from multiple sources including NetSuite to develop detailed analysis and give visibility to the C-suite.
You will have ownership of Power BI visualisation tool, ensuring it is rolled out efficiently and seamlessly across the business.
Developing intuitive Power BI dashboards and reports, presenting back to key stakeholders across the business giving recommendations and key insights that will optimise their decision-making.
This greenfield role will require you to work with the CFO to report back on key business questions and automate key financial reports transitioning from manual reporting for the FP&A team.
In the long term you will have the opportunity to step into a strategic role.




Requirements:

Strong track record (2+ years) in a Data analytics or BI role using Power BI for reporting and creating clear and automated dashboards.
Experience working on finance data or closely with the FP&A team using NetSuite is highly beneficial.
Exceptional stakeholder management experience, having worked closely with executives previously.
Experience in a small to medium business that‚Äôs fast-growing or private equity environment is preferred.
Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field.




If you are interested in this role or know someone who would be a good fit please contact Harriet Lander at harriet.lander@finatal.com

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst - London (hybrid/remote) - ¬£50-75,000 + benefits




numi has partnered with a leading genealogy tech company to hire an exceptional Senior Data Analyst to help customers connect and understand their family history.

You'll be part of a cross-functional team tasked with creating an engaging family history and educational platform. You'll leverage your Digital Product experience and creative work-style to promote an experimental Data culture!




This is a highly cross-functional role and you'll be collaborating with engineering, product, design and marketing to deliver the most innovative solutions!




Key Responsibilities

Work as part of a cross-functional squad to champion data in every decision
Champion an experimental and modern approach to data
Identify ways to maximise insights from existing data
Evangelise self-service data analysis




Key Requirements

SQL-based data modeling (including version control)
Experience taking a lead role in data projects
Background working in Digital Product businesses
Strong communication skills and a love for teamwork
Nurture the data-driven culture and deliver accurate, meaningful data to multiple stakeholders




Excited? Apply now or contact daisy@wearenumi.com to discuss further!




Role only open to UK residents or nationals.

Title: Social Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

We're the leading social media agency in the business of spinning heads and stopping thumbs. We unleash the value of social for brands by combining expertise in data-driven strategy, innovative social campaigns, industry-leading creative, authentic content, and performance marketing to deliver measurable results. Founded by Max Whicher and Alex Bodini in 2016, Spin now boasts a team of over 50 proud social natives who deliver 360 social campaigns for global brands, including Google, Bupa, Ann Summers, Universal Music, Fujifilm, and Napolina.




We are a diverse group of creators, analysts, specialists, enthusiasts, deep-thinkers and boundary-pushers. And, of course, we can't forget about Data Analysts, and that‚Äôs where you come in!




Our blend of passion and fun has garnered us multiple awards for creating a fantastic workplace.

(This is where we brag about being recognised as one of the 'Top 100 Best Places to Work')




You can see more of what we're about at spinbrands.com and take a peek at our smiling faces on our 'About Us' page.




The Role

Less about us, more about you.

Ready to join our dynamic and rapidly expanding Performance team?

Join us as a Data Analyst and be at the forefront of the data-driven revolution in marketing! Reporting directly to the Performance Director, you‚Äôll be contributing to our rapid growth and success. You'll dive deep into data from platforms like Google, Meta, and TikTok to unearth insights that shape campaigns. If you're keen to kickstart your career in a vibrant, fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you!




Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll be doing...

Data Integrations through Funnel: Our analytics platform has hundreds of millions of data points that we use to guide our understanding of campaign performance. You'll work on integrating data from multiple sources through Funnel, ensuring that the data is accurate and accessible for analysis. - We need you to help us understand!
Report Creation and Maintenance: You'll create and maintain Looker Studio reports that provide valuable insights that are crucial for decision-making within the organisation on a daily basis. Your role will include making continual improvements to ensure the reports are as accurate and useful as possible. - Get as creative as you‚Äôd like!
Experimentation: (Not in a science lab we promise) Running structured experiments is a key part of how the Spin team works across paid and organic social. You‚Äôll be responsible for identifying testing opportunities, working with account managers to implement them, managing rewards from advertising partners, and communicating test results.
Data analysis: Our team helps answer the most fundamental questions in marketing: is it working, and why. We use incrementality studies to understand the impact our marketing efforts are having on our clients‚Äô businesses, and deep-dive into trends using spreadsheets and Python notebooks - You love the details, the nitty gritty, you probably wanted to be a detective when you were younger!
Tracking: Our analysis relies on good quality data. You'll be responsible for helping our clients track events across various platforms. This will often involve auditing tracking setup, building tracking maps and helping our clients troubleshoot.




Here‚Äôs what we need from you...

You'll be highly proficient in using spreadsheets, as they will be a fundamental tool in your day-to-day responsibilities - Spreadsheets are what dreams are made of!
The ability analyse data to answer questions and surface insights to a high standard, and present them visually and clearly
You'll be part of a team and may need to present your findings, so the ability to communicate clearly and effectively is crucial - We don‚Äôt bite!
Given that you'll be handling data and generating reports, a keen eye for detail is essential to ensure the accuracy and reliability of your work
Knowledge of how marketing data works is critical to the success of this role - It‚Äôs a complex game and we love it!
Experience with SQL, JavaScript, or Python would be highly desirable and give you a significant advantage in performing more complex data analyses.
Previous experience working with Google Tag Manager, Meta Pixel, and Google Analytics would make you stand out as a candidate. Familiarity with any paid media management tools would also be a plus.
Knowledge and experience running A/B test and reporting your findings to the team
A keen interest in the emerging trends and technologies of AI and using it to measure metrics for organic and paid social
An excellent understanding of how paid social and organic social analysis can be applied to campaigns - The best of both worlds!




The Perks

A chance to play a part and make a difference in a young, rapidly developing agency whilst building your career.
Celebrate the company‚Äôs wins with our bonus scheme - earn up to an impressive 20% additional salary. Cha-ching!
Embrace the freedom of our flexi-working policy. No need to ask permission; grab your laptop, kick back in your favourite spot, and let the productivity flow from the comforts of home.
Explore the world with our remote working policy, allowing you to work from anywhere (yes, even abroad!) for a whole month each year.
Enjoy a well-deserved 25 days of holiday
Look after your mental health with access to Spill Chat, a support app that connects you with real-life therapists.
Look forward to Fridays with 4 PM finishes. Start your weekend early and recharge those batteries.
Put your health as a #1 priority with our excellent healthcare package.
Bond with the team with team outings, monthly social events, and an epic annual trip. We know how to have fun; trust us.




At Spin, we foster a vibrant work environment that thrives on diverse perspectives and creative ideas. As strong advocates for inclusion and representation, we actively encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of race, disability, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, or age.

Beyond compliance, we take pride in building a dynamic work environment that fosters creativity and champions inclusion, diversity, and representation.

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Pelican Procurement Services - An Avendra Group Company
Description:
You will be joining our Operations team and your role is internally referred to as Client Procurement Analyst. You will be based in our Farnborough office (we offer Hybrid Woking). You will provide exceptional levels of support to Account Managers and key stakeholders, in purchasing data analysis, administration, client service and contract management support. You will ensure that reports and projects are understood, delivered accurately and on time and to drive efficiencies within the department. you will engage in new systems related to market price analysis i.e. Libra which will be used in the benchmarking process: to train and support colleagues on the new system.




You will come from an administrative, analytical background. You will enjoy building strong internal and external stakeholders. We are looking for someone with a creative commercial mindset who loves learning everyday and is open to coming up with creative ideas to help our customers.




What's the job

Complete price benchmarking projects for key stakeholders, thereby contributing to business growth, assisting in securing new business and help deliver a professional purchasing management service
Liaise with clients and suppliers where required regarding product information
Complete formatted benchmark reports
Deliver daily and ad hoc purchasing analysis and reports to Account Managers & key stakeholders. We want an expert in Excel - VLOOKUP's and PIVOTS are crucial
Contribute towards cost savings, add value and support with ongoing contract performance
Work closely with the Account Manager and where appropriate support clients.
Create new supplier accounts on the database & set up new client accounts when required.




Skills and qualities:

Organised, methodical and able to manage priorities
Good verbal and written communication skills
Excellent relationship building skills
Very organised and methodical
Analytical thinker and numerate
Microsoft Office - Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Analysing and interpreting complex data using Excel to a high level
Must be able to use VLOOKUPS, Pivot Tables, Conditional Formatting and Formula
Demonstrable experience of meeting targets & delivering client satisfaction




Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer and we are determined to ensure that no applicant or employee receives less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender, age, disability, religion, belief, sexual orientation, marital status, or race, or is disadvantaged by conditions or requirements which cannot be shown. Please inform us of any required adjustments you may need during interviews

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Be part of a dynamic, award-winning team known for its exceptional culture, professional growth opportunities, and commitment to excellence.




You will compile and analyze claims management information reports, ensuring the business remains both retained and developed.




Responsibilities:

Maintain the established claims reporting standards.
Deliver accurate and timely claim reports and analysis for the designated client portfolio and the overall business.
Comprehend clients' risk management and insurance goals, offering and interpreting claim statistics and data to support these objectives.
Participate in internal and external pre-renewal strategy meetings and other required sessions.
Inform Claims and/or Account Executive about any identified trends in claims activity from data analysis, including the effects of deductibles and coverage changes.
Coordinate with the claims unit, insurers, and third-party data providers to ensure precise claims data.
Identify opportunities to increase revenue by enhancing the claims and risk management services offered.
Regularly collaborate with key stakeholders on reports to ensure output is suitable, and undertake design and development to meet client-specific needs, including key performance indicators and benchmarking.
Create new analytics presentations to better illustrate claims trends and provide actionable claims intelligence and risk management responses.




Skills and Expertise:

Proficient in interpreting and integrating multiple data sets from various sources, presenting them in a consistent and user-friendly format
Familiarity with Power BI is advantageous
Knowledgeable in insurance claims and risk management
Eager and able to continue developing knowledge through both formal and informal learning, within and outside the company
Understanding of the general legal principles of insurance
Effective communicator
Aware of regulatory controls and procedures related to retail customers.
Proficient in Microsoft products, such as Word, Outlook, and similar software applications
Advanced skills in Excel are essential

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - ¬£45-55k - London/Hybrid




This digital production house that specialise in gaming are looking for their first in-house Data Analyst to join the business. They work with tech companies to provide data-driven insights and analytics that enhance player experiences and optimise game performance.




What will you be doing?




Collaborate daily with developers to apply and test analytics libraries.
Present metrics and analyses to guide smart game development decisions.
Use SQL, R, and Tableau to answer customer questions and dive deep into data.
Work with partner analytics teams at a top tech company.
Monitor key metrics like user retention and content update impact.
Build dashboards to visualise metrics and analytics.
Report on issues, analytics results and quality status.
Leverage game feature knowledge and player behavior insights for improvements.




Skills needed:




SQL experience & understanding of relational databases
Experience with a data visualisation tools like Tableau, Microstrategy, or Power BI
Games industry experience - supporting game development/release/live ops
Passion for gaming
Ideally some game development experience - typescript proficiency or C++ etc.
Strong communication skills & collaborative mindset




If you are passionate about gaming and have the necessary skills and experience, I'd love to hear from you!




Apply now and I'll be in touch to arrange an initial call to talk through the details.




Please note that all applicants must have the right to work in the UK.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Vacancy




Here at EMIS, we are looking for a talented and customer focused Data Analyst to join our team on a permanent basis.




If you are someone that loves data, technology, and people then this is the perfect role for you. You will be solving data engineering problems to allow healthcare personnel; NHS organisations and research organisations access the analytical power of our EMIS-X Analytics platform.




You will collaborate with internal and external customers to ensure that data challenges are being solved, as well as ensuring analytics is successfully running on the platform. It is a great opportunity to come and impart your knowledge, work with autonomy, as well as further develop your own expertise and carve out your career path with us here at EMIS.




Writing complex SQL queries and using technologies including, Trino and SQL Server to extract and analyse data. Working closely with our Data Engineers to improve our software, creating a better user experience for our customers.




If you want to make a difference and see an impact, then EMIS is where you need to be!




What you‚Äôll do




As a tech for good business, the customer is at the heart of everything we do. As a team, we encourage creative thinking, and we ensure that there is always a focus on continuous improvement.




Delivering the best products in the market, everyone here genuinely makes an impact daily, and your role as Data Analyst will be no different.




Day to day your responsibilities and accountabilities will include;

Collate and analyse large datasets to identify trends and patterns.
Write complex SQL queries to extract and transform data for analysis and reporting.
Work with peers and wider tech team to optimise data pipelines and ETL processes.
Support the team in achieving product delivery goals.




Who you‚Äôll be




A Data Analyst with proven experience of SQL, SQL Server and/or MySQL. As this role is customer facing, you must be able to build trusted and credible relationships to ensure an unrivalled customer journey.




You will be able to work as part of a team, but also independently and be self-motivated especially as we operate in a primarily remote environment.

Technical skills we are looking for you to demonstrate include;

Experience with data modelling and data warehousing concepts.
Degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Data Science or similar, or equivalent experience.
Any exposure to cloud technologies (AWS/Azure) would be useful.
Knowledge of Big Data technologies e.g. Trino or Hadoop is beneficial.
Quality driven and excellent attention to detail
Focused on self-development and improving your tech skills.




If this sounds like just what you have been looking for, then don‚Äôt miss out and apply today!







About Us




We connect patients and healthcare professionals through integrated, ground-breaking technology, helping people live longer, healthier lives.

Show more
HTML:
The Vacancy


Here at EMIS, we are looking for a talented and customer focused Data Analyst to join our team on a permanent basis.


If you are someone that loves data, technology, and people then this is the perfect role for you. You will be solving data engineering problems to allow healthcare personnel; NHS organisations and research organisations access the analytical power of our EMIS-X Analytics platform.


You will collaborate with internal and external customers to ensure that data challenges are being solved, as well as ensuring analytics is successfully running on the platform. It is a great opportunity to come and impart your knowledge, work with autonomy, as well as further develop your own expertise and carve out your career path with us here at EMIS.


Writing complex SQL queries and using technologies including, Trino and SQL Server to extract and analyse data. Working closely with our Data Engineers to improve our software, creating a better user experience for our customers.


If you want to make a difference and see an impact, then EMIS is where you need to be!


What you‚Äôll do


As a tech for good business, the customer is at the heart of everything we do. As a team, we encourage creative thinking, and we ensure that there is always a focus on continuous improvement.


Delivering the best products in the market, everyone here genuinely makes an impact daily, and your role as Data Analyst will be no different.


Day to day your responsibilities and accountabilities will include;

  • Collate and analyse large datasets to identify trends and patterns.
  • Write complex SQL queries to extract and transform data for analysis and reporting.
  • Work with peers and wider tech team to optimise data pipelines and ETL processes.
  • Support the team in achieving product delivery goals.


Who you‚Äôll be


A Data Analyst with proven experience of SQL, SQL Server and/or MySQL. As this role is customer facing, you must be able to build trusted and credible relationships to ensure an unrivalled customer journey.


You will be able to work as part of a team, but also independently and be self-motivated especially as we operate in a primarily remote environment.

Technical skills we are looking for you to demonstrate include;

  • Experience with data modelling and data warehousing concepts.
  • Degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Data Science or similar, or equivalent experience.
  • Any exposure to cloud technologies (AWS/Azure) would be useful.
  • Knowledge of Big Data technologies e.g. Trino or Hadoop is beneficial.
  • Quality driven and excellent attention to detail
  • Focused on self-development and improving your tech skills.


If this sounds like just what you have been looking for, then don‚Äôt miss out and apply today!



About Us


We connect patients and healthcare professionals through integrated, ground-breaking technology, helping people live longer, healthier lives.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: United Kingdom (Remote/Hybrid)

Company: To&From

About Us: To&From is an innovative US-based startup transforming the gifting experience through advanced, AI powered technology. Our gifting copilot is leveraged by B2B customers to drive personalized, efficient and delightful gifting on their own sites. Our mission is to make gifting great wherever the customer is. Our dynamic team thrives on creativity, collaboration, and a data centric approach to building the best experiences across the commerce ecosystem.

Job Description: We are on the lookout for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our team. This role is pivotal in expanding our gifting technology to a wider audience by building and refining models that enhance our services. The ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of the retail landscape, especially in merchandising and product hierarchies, and a good taste level. A start-up mentality is essential, along with experience in training AI models and proficiency in Tableau.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement data models to support the expansion of To&From‚Äôs gifting technology.
Analyse and interpret complex data sets to provide actionable insights that drive business decisions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Leverage understanding of the retail landscape, including merchandising and product hierarchies, to inform model development and refinement.
Maintain high standards in data interpretation and presentation.
Create and maintain dashboards and visualisations in Tableau to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders.
Train and optimise AI models to improve the personalisation and efficiency of our gifting technology.
Stay abreast of industry trends and advancements in data analysis and AI.

Key Skills and Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably within the retail sector.
Strong understanding of merchandising and product hierarchies.
Demonstrated ability to build and train AI models.
Proficiency in Tableau, and Looker for data visualisation.
Experience working with GCP data platforms, including BigQuery
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
High level of accuracy and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, start-up environment.
A passion for technology and a keen eye for trends in the gifting and retail space.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience working in a start-up or fast-growing tech company.
Background in e-commerce or gifting industries.
Familiarity with other data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python or R.
University degree or equivalent experience.

What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunity to work in a cutting-edge, fast-paced environment.
Flexible working arrangements.
A collaborative and supportive team culture.
Opportunities for professional development and growth.

How to Apply: If this opportunity excites you, please submit your CV and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you are enthusiastic about joining To&From to info@toandfrom.com

Application Deadline: July 1, 2024

Title: Business Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
Your Responsibilities




Develop a comprehensive roadmap outlining the implementation of Power BI services, ensuring a strategic approach to data visualization and analysis solutions
Enhance the front-end aesthetics of Power BI dashboards, prioritizing intuitive design, creating wireframe prototypes to optimize user experience and making data insights accessible and engaging
Show strong communication skills, captivating and engaging audiences during presentations, drawing on years of experience in Power BI
Demonstrate strong consulting skills, leveraging expertise to offer valuable insights and recommendations to clients, driving successful project outcomes
Architect and maintain a robust data model, to support extensive agency data and Power BI applications
Design and implement a robust data security plan for Power BI projects, ensuring the protection of sensitive information and compliance with relevant data protection laws and standards
Leverage a deep understanding of Power BI's functionalities, both front-end and back-end, to provide innovative solutions that meet the unique needs of each client
Design and execute compelling Power BI pre-sale demonstrations tailored for potential clients, effectively showcasing the platform's capabilities and benefits
Conduct comprehensive training sessions for customers on utilizing Power BI, ensuring they are fully equipped to leverage the platform's capabilities for their specific needs
Engage in strategic discussions with customers to understand their reporting needs and objectives, demonstrating critical thinking skills to analyze and assess report functionalities and usability
Facilitate internal training sessions and actively contribute to the upskilling of the internal Power BI community, fostering a culture of continuous learning and knowledge sharing







Skills and Experience




Desirable Skills:

5+ years of Power BI experience; familiarity with Azure Data Services
Experience in client-facing consulting roles
Proficient in Power Query and DAX
Strong knowledge of data modelling and process engineering
Experience implementing a data security plan within projects
Potential client pre-sale demonstration presentation experience
Excellent communication skills and remote teamwork proficiency




Complementary Experience:

Knowledge of how to build out a successful Power BI training plan and experience conducting these trainings
Familiarity with design tools such as Figma or equivalent, demonstrating an understanding of visual aesthetics and the ability to translate concepts into visually appealing and user-friendly designs

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
With Intelligence is a global provider of data for the asset management industry and at the start of a data transformation. The ambition of the company is to continue its growth trajectory and use data to drive internal decision making.¬†

With Intelligence is seeking a talented and motivated Data¬†Analyst to join our newly formed internal BI Team. This is a chance to be part of the beginning of a BI journey to provide the business with accessible data and foster a data-driven culture.¬†¬†

As a BI Analyst, you will help the team build an organised data infrastructure using dbt/redshift/tableau to feed the business with insights. You will model raw data in to finalised tables, provide in-depth analysis and build reporting tools to inform With's decision making and business strategy.¬†

We are a new team with plenty of scope to influence the way in which With use data across the business. We are looking for self-motivated and driven individuals who want to work with stakeholders so they can make use of With's data.¬†

This is a great opportunity for someone wanting more exposure in modern data stack tooling e.g. dbt.¬†

Responsibilities

End to end project work - work with stakeholders to design a scope, design and model the data, run analysis, build reporting dashboards, and present back to stakeholders¬†
Become a With data expert - we expect our BI team to be the bridge between our stakeholder's questions and the data. As such we need to be an expert in With data¬†
Support the team and collaborate with other teams to architect, develop and maintain sustainable best-practice data structures¬†¬†
Support ad-hoc data analysis and analysis requests from internal teams¬†
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in BI and data visualization¬†



Requirements


2 years experience as a Data Analyst or similar role¬†
Proficiency in using data viz tools (Tableau preferable) ¬†
Intermediate SQL proficiency - (CTEs, window functions, basic transformational commands) ¬†
Experience in B2B commercial and operational reporting. Platform / subscription experience is preferred¬† ¬†
Experience working with large datasets and performing data analysis¬†
Ability to translate business requirements into meaningful visualizations and reports¬†
Knowledge of data validation, cleansing, and transformation techniques¬†



Benefits



24 days annual leave rising to 29 days
Enhanced parental leave
Medicash (Health Cash Plans)
Wellness Days
Flexible Fridays (Opportunity to finish early)
Birthday day off
Employee assistance program
Travel loan scheme
Charity days
Breakfast provided
Social Events throughout the year
Hybrid Working

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on actual or perceived race, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy), marital status, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, mental or physical disability, religion, creed, colour, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (including transgender status), veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

HTML:
With Intelligence is a global provider of data for the asset management industry and at the start of a data transformation. The ambition of the company is to continue its growth trajectory and use data to drive internal decision making. 

With Intelligence is seeking a talented and motivated Data Analyst to join our newly formed internal BI Team. This is a chance to be part of the beginning of a BI journey to provide the business with accessible data and foster a data-driven culture.  

As a BI Analyst, you will help the team build an organised data infrastructure using dbt/redshift/tableau to feed the business with insights. You will model raw data in to finalised tables, provide in-depth analysis and build reporting tools to inform With's decision making and business strategy. 

We are a new team with plenty of scope to influence the way in which With use data across the business. We are looking for self-motivated and driven individuals who want to work with stakeholders so they can make use of With's data. 

This is a great opportunity for someone wanting more exposure in modern data stack tooling e.g. dbt. 

Responsibilities

  • End to end project work - work with stakeholders to design a scope, design and model the data, run analysis, build reporting dashboards, and present back to stakeholders 
  • Become a With data expert - we expect our BI team to be the bridge between our stakeholder's questions and the data. As such we need to be an expert in With data 
  • Support the team and collaborate with other teams to architect, develop and maintain sustainable best-practice data structures  
  • Support ad-hoc data analysis and analysis requests from internal teams 
  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in BI and data visualization 


Requirements

  • 2 years experience as a Data Analyst or similar role 
  • Proficiency in using data viz tools (Tableau preferable)  
  • Intermediate SQL proficiency - (CTEs, window functions, basic transformational commands)  
  • Experience in B2B commercial and operational reporting. Platform / subscription experience is preferred   
  • Experience working with large datasets and performing data analysis 
  • Ability to translate business requirements into meaningful visualizations and reports 
  • Knowledge of data validation, cleansing, and transformation techniques 


Benefits

  • 24 days annual leave rising to 29 days
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Medicash (Health Cash Plans)
  • Wellness Days
  • Flexible Fridays (Opportunity to finish early)
  • Birthday day off
  • Employee assistance program
  • Travel loan scheme
  • Charity days
  • Breakfast provided
  • Social Events throughout the year
  • Hybrid Working

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on actual or perceived race, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy), marital status, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, mental or physical disability, religion, creed, colour, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (including transgender status), veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is a well known charity organisation throughout the UK and are currently going through a period of growth. They are looking to add a Data Manager with business intelligence experience to their team, on a permanent basis.




PURPOSE OF THIS POSITION:




A critical role to provide information and insights about the performance of the charity and to inform decisions about our future work.




To maintain the performance data system for the organisation, and liaising with all departments regularly to collect, format and present a wide range of information for both internal and external use.




Analyse business data, including that from crime reporting, to present useful insights which can support decision making and future plans.




Manage the relationship with the IT manged service provider and other suppliers as needed to oversee improvement projects to our network and systems.




MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:




Data / Intelligence analysis
Produce monthly performance reports
Through research in our database, provide campaign statistics and research, including examples of redacted reports for Regional Managers, Communications and Business Growth and Fundraising (BG&F).
Conduct analysis and present changes and/or trends to inform relationships with police forces, and the charity‚Äôs campaigns/community work.
Produce Monthly Management Information reports for Business Growth and Fundraising clients and Home Office, and other reports relating to performance and disseminations as needed. This includes quarterly reports to support Regional Manager funding.
Look for opportunities to improve data processing and analytics, working with data scientists and suppliers as needed to implement.
Support other departments to use ‚Äòself serve‚Äô tools to access data, including making sure they comply with data governance.
Work with Information Security Manager to make sure data held confidentially, is processed to ensure its integrity and available to those that need it.




Manage 3rd party vendors including data systems providers and managed service provider to oversee service delivery particularly on improvements to our network and systems.




Maintain regular communications with IT managed service provider, to make sure they provide service as needed.
Oversee improvement projects (part of agreed IT and Data strategies) for our network and systems.
Liaise with internal teams as necessary so all staff are informed and included in changes.
Work with Information Security Manager to make sure IT projects are implemented with due regard for security and change processes.




Skills, Knowledge and Qualifications




Able to analyse and present data well, using a variety of tools (Essential)
Well organised, able to manage a wide range of work from many different sources, with many routine tasks as well as regular requests for support. (Essential)
Good communicator, both written and verbal. Able to explain findings of research and data clearly. (Essential)
Excellent numeracy and competence in using tools such as Excel. High levels of attention to detail (Essential)
Able to deal with, on a daily basis, information which may be impactful. Must be discrete about this information. (Essential)
Able to identify and develop tools and processes to improve access to and management of data across the charity. (Essential)
Experience of managing suppliers to make sure services/ products supplied are working effectively. (Essential)
Knowledge/ experience of data science and tools (Desirable)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description:

Circadia Health is a medical device and data technology company that has developed the world's first FDA cleared contactless remote patient monitoring system. Powered by cutting-edge technology and AI, the system allows for the early detection of medical events such as Congestive Heart Failure, COPD Exacerbations, Pneumonia, Sepsis, UTIs, and Falls.

We're monitoring over 20,000+ lives daily and growing rapidly. As we scale our team, Circadia is looking for energetic, personable, and solutions-oriented individuals driven by creating the ultimate customer experience. Prior experience in healthcare is a big plus, but not required.

Our mission is to enhance patient outcomes and improve healthcare processes by providing cutting-edge solutions to healthcare providers and patients alike.




Job Description:

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for translating business requirements into actionable insights to influence business and operational strategy. Circadia sits on terabytes of data, most of which is still unexplored - and it‚Äôll be up to you to make sense of it all! Furthermore, you‚Äôll have a unique opportunity of working closely with operations, clinical, marketing, and R&D teams.




We seek a detail-oriented and strategic thinker with a passion for leveraging data to drive business decision-making.




Key Responsibilities:

Leverage SQL and data warehouse technologies such as Snowflake and Redshift to extract, transform, and analyze complex data sets.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product and engineering, to define key performance indicators and metrics.
Develop, maintain, and execute data transformations to support the organization's metrics and analytics needs.
Create and maintain dashboards to visualize data, providing insights that enable data-driven decision-making.
Effectively communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, and propose solutions to optimize processes or strategies based on those findings.




Requirements:

4-5+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst / BI Engineer at top tech startups or large companies.
Bachelor‚Äôs or higher in Mathematics, Engineering, Natural Sciences or a similar numerate degree.
SQL and Data Warehousing: Strong expertise in SQL and familiarity with data warehouse technologies like Snowflake, Redshift or similar. Proficiency in writing, optimizing, and debugging complex queries is required.
Basic knowledge of Python and related packages such as pandas and numpy.
Data Visualization: Proficient in data visualization tools (Preset, Tableau, PowerBI or similar), with the ability to create dynamic dashboards and reports that effectively present complex data sets.
Analytical Skills: Excellent analytical abilities with the capacity to collect, organize, and dissect large amounts of data with attention to detail and accuracy.
Problem-Solving Skills: Exceptional problem-solving capabilities to tackle complex business problems, and the ability to propose data-driven solutions.
Communication Skills: Strong communication skills to present findings and translate complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Our mission is to enhance patient outcomes and improve healthcare processes by providing cutting-edge solutions to healthcare providers and patients alike.


Job Description:

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for translating business requirements into actionable insights to influence business and operational strategy. Circadia sits on terabytes of data, most of which is still unexplored - and it‚Äôll be up to you to make sense of it all! Furthermore, you‚Äôll have a unique opportunity of working closely with operations, clinical, marketing, and R&D teams.


We seek a detail-oriented and strategic thinker with a passion for leveraging data to drive business decision-making.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Leverage SQL and data warehouse technologies such as Snowflake and Redshift to extract, transform, and analyze complex data sets.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product and engineering, to define key performance indicators and metrics.
  • Develop, maintain, and execute data transformations to support the organization's metrics and analytics needs.
  • Create and maintain dashboards to visualize data, providing insights that enable data-driven decision-making.
  • Effectively communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, and propose solutions to optimize processes or strategies based on those findings.


Requirements:

  • 4-5+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst / BI Engineer at top tech startups or large companies.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs or higher in Mathematics, Engineering, Natural Sciences or a similar numerate degree.
  • SQL and Data Warehousing: Strong expertise in SQL and familiarity with data warehouse technologies like Snowflake, Redshift or similar. Proficiency in writing, optimizing, and debugging complex queries is required.
  • Basic knowledge of Python and related packages such as pandas and numpy.
  • Data Visualization: Proficient in data visualization tools (Preset, Tableau, PowerBI or similar), with the ability to create dynamic dashboards and reports that effectively present complex data sets.
  • Analytical Skills: Excellent analytical abilities with the capacity to collect, organize, and dissect large amounts of data with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Problem-Solving Skills: Exceptional problem-solving capabilities to tackle complex business problems, and the ability to propose data-driven solutions.
  • Communication Skills: Strong communication skills to present findings and translate complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Title: ESG Data Analyst
Description:
ESG Data Analyst - Data Science - Investment Management - up to ¬£110,000




Our client, a leading Investment Management organisation based in the City of London, are looking for an ESG Data Analyst to join them on a permanent basis. You will be joining the ESG Data team and assist in the development of a Data Science model.




The successful candidate will be responsible for progressing the automation of ESG data production, analysis and systematic integration with other systems currently being utilised by the business. Alongside this, you will be enhancing ESG data through improving data quality and transparency as well as devising innovative approaches for ESG data analytics and insights through building robust data orientated solutions in Python.




The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset and demonstrate strong problem solving skills. You will also have experience working within Investment Management or a similarly regulated industry.




Key Skills:

3-7 years experience working as an ESG Data Analyst.
Strong knowledge of Python and building data orientated solutions for businesses.
Knowledge of ESG metrics is highly beneficial.
Experience working with modern data tools (e.g. Tableau, Jupyter Notebooks, Pandas etc.)
Exposure to machine learning approaches such as neural networks and generative AI is desirable
Experienced working in the Investment Management industry

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Marketing Data Scientist




Location: London üåÜ




Remuneration: Hourly rate ¬£35.58 üí∏




Contract Details: Temporary, until 28th February 2025 ‚åõ




Working Pattern: Full Time (Hybrid Model) ‚è∞




Are you a talented Marketing Data Scientist looking for an exciting opportunity in the thriving tech industry? Our client, a leading organisation in the tech sector, is seeking a motivated and skilled individual to join their EMEA Marketing team as a Marketing Data Scientist. üìà




Responsibilities:

Manage the workload of a large project or multiple projects to maximise impact and refine timelines in collaboration with stakeholders.
Exercise sound judgement in weighing input against anticipated impact and adapt to changes as needed.
Identify issues for defined problems, navigate unexpected complexity, and propose analytical and technical solutions.
Effectively frame and escalate issues to be addressed by managers and stakeholders.
Serve as a trusted partner within the team and with cross-functional teams, providing guidance and managing relationships with partners, agencies, or TVCs.
Contribute to shared team responsibilities and the broader analyst community, such as conducting interviews or presenting analysis findings.
Utilise expertise in data extraction and manipulation, dashboarding/visualisation, statistical analysis, predictive modelling, and research techniques to drive insights and solutions.
Develop strategies to drive incremental growth by addressing complex business challenges and collaborating with stakeholders across various functions.
Conduct market research and data analysis to influence business decisions, optimise performance, and deliver best-in-class execution.
Champion an inclusive culture, creating a supportive environment, role-modelling inclusive behaviour, and driving diversity change initiatives.
Provide ad-hoc research and data analysis support to senior leaders for specific data requests.




Skills/Experience/Education:

Strong knowledge of business operations and driving efficiency and effectiveness within organisations.
Excellent consultative skills to understand stakeholder needs and provide tailored analysis and recommendations.
Proficiency in dashboarding to link, report, and analyse metrics based on available data.
Ability to convert real-world business problems into trackable metrics and generate meaningful insights from data analysis.
Familiarity with experimental design principles and best practises.
Good understanding of the tech industry landscape, including key players and technology trends.
Experience in marketing analysis and applying analytical methods to generate actionable insights.
Project management skills and ability to plan and execute projects effectively.
Knowledge of statistical analysis methods to evaluate data adequacy and draw inferences.
Strong storytelling and presentation skills to communicate data-driven insights in an engaging manner.
Technical acumen and eagerness to learn and apply statistical and mathematical concepts.




Our client offers excellent perks, including hybrid working arrangements, pension contribution matching, employee discounts, and comprehensive well-being support. üåü




If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive strategies and make an impact in the tech industry, we would love to hear from you. Join our client's innovative team in London, and be a part of shaping the future of EMEA Marketing. Apply now! ‚ú®




Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.üíº




Adecco is a disability-confident employer. It is important to us that we run an inclusive and accessible recruitment process to support candidates of all backgrounds and all abilities to apply. Adecco is committed to building a supportive environment for you to explore the next steps in your career. If you require reasonable adjustments at any stage, please let us know and we will be happy to support you.

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
We are looking for three Insights Analysts to join our Digital team at Harrods. This role will sit within the Loyalty & CRM Insights team, led by the Senior Loyalty & CRM Insights Manager. This is an exciting opportunity that will support the areas of Partnerships, Campaign and Loyalty.




About The Role




As the Insights Analyst you will use your creativity and initiative to help internal clients to bring customer insight and relevance to their communications and promotions, and to truly understand what we can learn about the customer using analysis and evaluation. This role will sit within the Loyalty & CRM Insights team, led by the Senior Loyalty & CRM Insights Manager




You will:

You will work with stakeholders across CRM and Loyalty to support in designing reporting, campaign planning, and making suggestions on how we can improve on current campaigns.
Responsible for bringing project work together and developing new ways of looking into our campaigns
Responsible for determining short term performance, tracking KPIs, longer term projects, and working with a variety of stakeholders
Measuring impact versus control groups, A/B tests, and determining and explaining uplift where possible




About You




The successful candidate will have good knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint and SQL, and preferably experience of using Google Analytics too, ideally you will have a background in Statistics, Mathematics, Science or Marketing. We are also looking for someone who has the ability to translate insights from a complex analysis into easy to read insights for a technical and a non-technical audience




You will also;

Previous Stakeholder management skills
Experience using customer or consumer data
Some understanding of targeted and personalised Loyalty and/or CRM activity/ Marketing
Keen attention to detail
Passion for utilising data




About Us




Harrods is one of the world‚Äôs leading luxury department stores and we‚Äôre becoming a destination for top designers, and the most sought-after brands from around the globe. Our combined mission is to make visiting our iconic Knightsbridge store one of the world‚Äôs most inspiring shopping experiences.




Our Promise to You




Help us make the impossible possible for our customers and we‚Äôll do something remarkable for you. As well as offering a friendly environment to inspire your best work, we provide abundant opportunities and support to build an exceptional career across the varied specialisms of our business.




In return, you‚Äôll receive an excellent benefits package, including a company pension, flexible working, 25 days‚Äô holiday, and your birthday off, up to 33% in-store discount (including across our food hall and restaurants) and a season ticket loan.




Uniquely You




At Harrods we believe the personality and authenticity of our people sets us apart. We celebrate and invite applications from all cultures, backgrounds, tastes, and experiences and are proud of our culture where people from all walks of life can grow and thrive. What makes you unique makes us exceptional.




If you want to know more about our people and our culture, search #TogetherHarrods on LinkedIn, Facebook or follow us on Instagram @togetherharrods.




Harrods reserve the right to close applications early if we receive a high number of applications for this role.
