Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - ¬£30K-¬£40K - Cumbria - Hybrid




My client is looking for a Data Analyst to work with the large and complex datasets associated with their financial comparison products. The role has a broad remit encompassing analysis, interpretation, and prediction. The Data Analyst will also bring statistical rigor to their product teams‚Äô efforts as they continuously enhance comparison products.




Role




Dive into complex datasets and extract actionable insights, e.g.
Identify customer segments across our comparison services where no or very few quotes are provided.
Analyse the conversion funnel data to improve the click to sale conversion to make recommendations on segments that are being poorly served, and
Utilize multiway statistical techniques to identify trends and correlations.
Facilitate discussions with the wider business to gain insight into pain points, problems and opportunities where analysis could help us with these either for business or for our partners/customers.
Support AB/MVT test plans and assessing results independently.
Assist with new provider due diligence and performance issue investigations.
Use of analytics tools/applications to undertake multi factor analysis to generate robust, accurate analysis to inform decision making.
Pro-actively work with stakeholders and colleagues to find ways for continuous evolution and improvement of the use of data/insight, to ensure solutions are best in class, and that value is continually generated from the data asset.
Create clear and concise reports and visualizations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making.




Skills




Proven experience as a Data Analyst, handling large datasets and performing statistical analysis.
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Qlik).
Strong SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation.
Familiarity with Python, R or similar for data analysis.
Experience in filtering and cleaning complex datasets to provide actionable insights.
Experience working within the Financial Technology industry will be helpful.




Benefits




27 days holiday plus public holidays
Performance rated bonus
Enhanced pension
Generous private medical care
Sickness and insurance benefits
Share schemes.




If this sounds like your next role, apply today!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
You will join the team in delivering insight and analysis which allow ClearScore to rapidly scale and deliver a seamless experience for our users. Analysts play a key role within ClearScore, driving strategy and key decision-making, which ultimately benefits our users, partners, and other teams within the business.

ClearScore has an amazing analytical community which includes Data Analysts, Scientists and Engineers. The community works collaboratively to ensure a landscape in which team members can develop their full potential and deliver maximum business impact.

ClearScore is both a free credit score and report service and the UK‚Äôs leading consumer credit marketplace. Working in the Marketing Analytics team, you will play a key role in monitoring and reporting on campaign performance; supporting the marketing and CRM teams to run experiments to improve UX and monetization, and building analytics to support the leadership team in developing the overall strategy.

What you will be doing:


Build out new monitoring and reporting dashboards, using SQL and Domo
Work closely with our marketing teams across acquisition or retention (CRM) to help them understand the benefit of our marketing activity
Analyse AB tests and experiments to enable us to continuously improve our campaigns and user experience
Deliver in-depth analytics projects, using data to identify opportunities and to analyse and solve complex business problems
Support the ongoing growth of the marketplace, including carrying out analysis needed to launch new products, improve existing products and unlock growth across verticals


Skills We'd Love You To Have


You must possess advanced SQL and Excel skills. Knowledge of Python and analytical tools such as Amplitude is a plus
Experience using Domo or other data visualisation tools such as Tableau
Ability to plan and prioritise your own workload
You have a desire to learn and enjoy working collaboratively, with a desire to contribute to our culture.
You do not need to fit into a stereotype: we are really committed to closing our gender gap and are actively trying to create an environment where you, as an individual, can thrive.
Strong quantitative and numerical skills


Why ClearScore?

ClearScore is the UK's #1 credit score and report app. We are also present in South Africa, Australia and Canada, with more than 18 million users globally and growing fast. Someone joins ClearScore every 20 seconds. We have established relationships with over 50 of the main lenders in the U.K., and have been a trusted tool for customers to manage their credit and make better financial decisions.

Since October 2016 we have helped 1.8 million users take out a new credit card or loan. We are user-centric at our core and we believe in leveraging technology to enable positive financial choices. We are design-led and data-driven and we embed these behaviours in everything we do.

Our company culture is a fundamental part of all we have achieved. We believe in hiring smart, driven, passionate and diverse people who are keen on having a real impact in our organisation. We trust you to manage your own time so we offer flexible work and no fixed desk hours. We don't micromanage and we believe in measuring outcomes rather than effort. We have an inclusive culture where all, regardless of seniority, are encouraged to contribute with their ideas, look after their wellbeing and actively seek opportunities for career growth.

If you feel like this could be the place for you, apply and our Talent team will be happy to share more.

Benefits:


25 paid holidays and a ‚Äúduvet day‚Äù on your birthday
Hybrid Work Environment: flexible work-life balance allowing you to thrive both in the office and from the comfort of your own space.
Private health and dental cover
GP office visits
Life assurance scheme
Up to 6% matched pension
Brown bags with guest speakers
Dog-friendly office
Daily breakfast and free snacks
Free sports and social clubs
Generous training allowance
Fast progression
Leadership-led training
Regular well-being events
In-house psychotherapist
Financial coach to help you plan and achieve your goals
Physical and mental health support through BUPA
No clock-watching culture
Generous maternity and paternity plans
Culture and inclusion representatives
Transparent pay structure and a career growth plan


Inclusion Policy

We are always looking for talented individuals to join ClearScore. We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for our people. Please see our People Policy Notice at https://www.clearscore.com/people-notice.

  • Generous maternity and paternity plans
  • Culture and inclusion representatives
  • Transparent pay structure and a career growth plan

Inclusion Policy

We are always looking for talented individuals to join ClearScore. We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for our people. Please see our People Policy Notice at https://www.clearscore.com/people-notice.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Kantar is the world‚Äôs leading market-research and analytics company. We have a complete, outstanding, and rounded understanding of how people think, feel and act; globally and locally in over 90 markets. By combining the deep expertise of our people, our data resources and benchmarks and our innovative analytics and technology, we help our clients understand people and encourage growth.




Backed by industry-leading anti-fraud technology, our Profiles Audience Network comprises over 170 million individuals, in more than 100 markets worldwide. Our clients include many of leading brands, who trust us to collect reliable insights.




Join our expert team in survey design, sampling methodologies, and data science. We bring to bear ground breaking technology to provide our clients with seamless access to real people and unparalleled insights.




Job Summary

In this role, you will chip in to User Acquisition and User Engagement of our Panels using innovative data analytics and data science technology, evolving your skills and staying at the forefront of the data industry. We are seeking candidates with experience in a data-related role, possessing a proven foundation in programming (Python and SQL) and a passion for redefining data into actionable insights.




Responsibilities

Daily Evaluation: assess support tickets related to Machine Learning models/algorithms developed by the Data Science team.
Monitoring and Maintenance: lead all aspects of alerts to ensure the ecosystem's functionality, working with models for day-to-day operations and performance.
Data Analysis: analyse user acquisition and retention data, identifying weaknesses and bugs in existing models for resolution.
Analytics and Machine Learning: run analytics to extract statistics, patterns, and eventually craft machine learning models to improve existing technologies.
Work closely with the development team, contributing to data/statistics tasks for improving user engagement.
Collaborate with various partners (including the Developer team) to formulate pertinent questions, providing actionable insights and analyses to support decision-making efforts.
Communicate technical information with both technical and non-technical team members and collaborators.
Data Transformation: employ ETL tools like DBT to transform data, making it more accessible to the broader business.
Use time series graphing services such as Grafana to build visualisations, supervise trends, and identify patterns.
Define critical metrics to drive improvements in User acquisition and engagement performance.




What you‚Äôll bring‚Ä¶

Experience with data-related technologies, including database queries, programming, data mining/wrangling, analysis, and reporting.
Strong proficiency in SQL, with the ability to read, write, and query effectively.
A keen curiosity about data, statistics, machine learning, and data science is essential.
Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development, logical thinking, and critical analysis.
Experience with statistical computer languages such as Python, Scala, R, MATLAB.
Knowledge of statistical techniques and concepts, including regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests, and accurate usage.
Experience using web services and languages, including AWS, EC2, S3, Redshift, DigitalOcean, etc.
Detail orientated, with a good work ethic and the ability to collaborate across different teams.
Experience in Excel is a plus.




At Kantar, we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market driven and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.




Benefits include: starting with 25 days annual leave (increasing with tenure), private medical health cash plan, income protection, life assurance, enhanced employer pension contribution; plus award winning voluntary flexible benefits (lifestyle, health, wealth, wellbeing).




We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.




We are not able to offer visa sponsorship or assist with relocation support for this role. Please ensure you have the right to work in the country where this role is located before applying.

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Pelican Procurement Services - An Avendra Group Company
Description:
You will be joining our Tendering team and your role is internally referred to as Tender Support. Our team supports the growth and retention of our UK clients. Your role will be to provide support to Pelican‚Äôs tender team throughout the tendering process. To work closely with internal stakeholders and directly with clients and suppliers. To provide administrative support with public procurement tenders, update and publish notices and ensure that we are supporting clients to remain legally compliant.




You will come from an administrative, analytical background. You will have dealt with suppliers and customers as part of your role. You will enjoy building strong internal and external stakeholders. We are looking for someone with a creative commercial mindset who loves learning everyday and is open to coming up with creative ideas to help our customers.




What's the job

Support the supplier tender submissions process, ensuring submissions are acknowledged and appropriately managed within agreed systems and timescales
Contribute to the delivery of a programme of professional, transparent, and impartial supplier tenders, request for quotations and direct negotiations
Support with price comparison exercises and project fact finds
Partner with Tender Managers in pre-tender supplier engagement sessions
Liaise with the Pi (purchasing intelligence) team to ensure that the successful supplier can provide electronic invoice line data in the correct format and timelines
Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to ensure a smooth contract mobilisation
Supporting with post award supplier engagement to create a new contract pack
Post award ‚Äì supporting in various administrative tasks relating to public procurement contract management, publishing of notices, tender portal management and coordinating with internal stakeholders




Skills and qualities:

Highly commercial
Strong creative learning mindset
Good verbal and written communication skills
Excellent relationship building skills
Very organised and methodical
Analytical thinker and numerate
Microsoft Office - Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Must be able to use VLOOKUPS, Pivot Tables, Conditional Formatting and Formula
Demonstrable experience of meeting targets & delivering client satisfaction
Comfortable with some UK travel
Wants to develop a career within professional procurement services




Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer and we are determined to ensure that no applicant or employee receives less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender, age, disability, religion, belief, sexual orientation, marital status, or race, or is disadvantaged by conditions or requirements which cannot be shown. Please inform us of any required adjustments you may need during interviews.

Title: Graduate Investment Data Analyst
Description:
We are currently looking for 2024 graduates to join one of the most interesting and exciting investment managers in their London office for summer 2024. This is an amazing opportunity to kickstart your career in an organisation which has an inclusive culture where the contributions of all our people are recognised and valued.




At the heart of the firm's mission is the responsibility to safeguard and grow investors' capital. In alignment with investor expectations, they are dedicated to cultivating a culture that upholds the principles of diversity, equity and inclusion, alongside delivering financial returns




The Data Analytics and Business Solutions team is tasked with the capture, validation, manipulation and analysis of various investment-related datasets in order to deliver effective insights, reports, completion of targeted cross-functional projects to improve efficiency and reduce operational risk, implementation of solutions to business process challenges and provision of insights to assist with decision making. As such, candidates will gain broad exposure to various functions, teams and senior personnel including those within Investment Management, Operations, Valuation, Risk, Technology and Client Services/Reporting.




Key Responsibilities:




Management of investment attribution data.
Management of pricing feeds and validation
Development of processes to improve efficiency and reduce operational risk.
Ensuring data requirements of internal and external stakeholders (incl. recurring reports) are completed
Management of cash data and reconciliation for cash forecasting exercises.
Projection of future returns for each investment within the companies portfolios on a monthly basis.
Execution of portfolio analytics and the utilization of in-house aggregation tools to generate analytical reports.
Communication of monthly portfolio projection results to senior management and clients through monthly newsletters and bespoke reports.
Address ad-hoc portfolio-related analytical requests from investors and senior management.
Collaboration with the internal tech team in targeted cross-functional projects, offering exposure to different teams and enhancing business efficiency.




Requirements:




Drive and passion to build a career in investment management
Strong numerical degree from a reputable university.
Good IT skills, especially in Excel
Some experience with programming languages such as Python, R, and C# is beneficial but not mandatory.
Ability to work efficiently under pressure, delivering accurate results within strict deadlines.
Strong team mindset and excellent collaboration skills.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST

CENTRAL LONDON - HYBRID (2 DAYS IN OFFICE)

¬£40,000 - ¬£50,000

THE COMPANY

This rapidly growing entertainment park business had its initial success through four main sites and recently acquired 13 more, with a vision to grow up to 40 in the next four years. Due to this rapid expansion, they are quickly moving towards being at the forefront of innovation in the leisure industry.

The company has established a data warehouse in BigQuery through a third party and is beginning to utilise tools such as Looker for data visualisations. Now, there is a strong push to further enhance data analytics capabilities, particularly through the expansion of reporting.

With planned growth in the next few years, they are deeply committed to leveraging data for strategic advantage.

THE ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Reporting directly to the C-suite, this Data Analyst will take ownership of defining and building out the BI function, focusing on maximising the value of data insights to drive business growth. With the foundational data engineering work already completed, this role is suited for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.

The day-to-day will involve:

Developing and executing a comprehensive BI strategy aligned with business objectives.
Leading the implementation of a data visualization tool for advanced data visualisation and analysis.
Providing regular reports and presentations to senior management, translating complex data into clear, actionable insights.

YOUR EXPERIENCE

To qualify for this Data Analyst role, you will require:

Relevant experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related field.
Strong coding experience in SQL.
Proficiency in tools such as Power BI, Looker, or Tableau, with a preference for a demonstrated track record of successful implementation and utilisation.
Prior experience in the hospitality, leisure, or retail industries is beneficial.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to influence decision-making at all levels.

HOW TO APPLY

In order to apply for this Data Analyst role, please submit your CV through the Apply link on this website.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're hiring the very best data analysts to join our agile in-house team. You will be working on the fastest growing direct to consumer (e-commerce) brands and will have access to unlimited performance bonus.




What You'll Be Doing




Launch and optimize social, native and search advertising campaigns
Improve Conversion Rate across multiple funnels - multivariant and A/B testing
Design new funnels and analyse granular data using proprietary data warehouse
Manage unlimited budget while staying profitable. Compensation is directly correlated to your personal campaign performance and paid monthly
Optional managerial roles available




What You'll Need




Results-driven and numbers-oriented personality
High attention to detail
Flexibility and adaptability
Commitment to innovations




A little about us




We're passionate about building life changing consumer products and delivering them with astonishing service. We are also one of the UK's fastest growing direct to consumer companies.




The Benefits




Salary above market
All the latest tech you need
Pension plan

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join an insurtech, scale-up company with a fantastic culture and great branding.
Sit under the Head of Analytics.
Faced paced business with a strong data maturity.




Join a fast-paced scale up with an exciting USP and an amazing team!




What you‚Äôll be doing

Sitting in the retention tribe in this exciting company, you‚Äôll be working to better understand customers. You‚Äôll be helping customers who struggle to get fair car insurance, and then you‚Äôll be helping the company to retain those customers.




You‚Äôll be using customer data to better understand when and how to best communicate with their customers; better understand who the customers are and why they‚Äôre buying from the company. You‚Äôll be diving into the customer experience to understand the customer lifetime value, looking at marketing analysis and better understand the customer demographic by diving into trends and patterns.




They‚Äôve got a high-performance culture and amazing career opportunities while also having low egos throughout their cross functional teams. Unlike others, this insurance company prides themselves on having great customer service and an incredibly data driven environment. This company are revolutionising insurance by introducing technology driven environments into the insurance world. Want to be part of the revolution? You‚Äôll join a mature data team and help to bridge a gap in the team during a transition of one of their main team members, you‚Äôll be coming in to assist with the handover and fast paced work.




What experience you‚Äôll need to apply

3+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst
Excellent SQL experience
Looker experience
Ideally experience with DBT, or a similar data modelling tool
Experience with Snowflake
Experience working in start-ups/scale-up companies
Ideally working in a fintech or insurtech




What you‚Äôll get in return for your experience

They‚Äôre offering a salary of up to ¬£84,000 for the right person, plus bonus and excellent benefits! Please note there is a requirement of two days a week in the office.




What next

Apply using the above link or send your CV over to Tegan!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Zest has an exciting new opportunity for a Data Analyst to join our high performing Finance team at Zest.

You will work closely with our Customer teams to develop actionable insights and KPI dashboards while ensuring integrity of the data.

Main responsibilities:


Maintaining and updating existing suite of SQL-based Power BI and Excel reports
Developing new Power BI and Excel reports to support front line Sales, Operations and Marketing teams
Working across the business to ensure process changes are reported accurately and data integrity is maintained
Troubleshooting data anomalies and performance-related issues
Building strong relationships with front line teams
Developing awareness of current processes and planned improvements
Creating and maintaining documentation to support the reporting suite
Contributing to the continuous improvement of reporting methods and data integrity
Maintaining the ticket system with the status of reporting requests, communicating issues and recording time taken


How does the Data Analyst drive our four key values?

Do The Right Thing Empowering front line teams with decision-making data

Reach For The Sky Relentlessly focussing on simple and repeatable data processes

Win Together Working with project teams to track success criteria

Own It Managing reporting requests with clear communication

We offer you:


Salary ¬£35,000-¬£40,000
22 days holiday (increases annually up to +5) plus bank holidays
Modern offices and optional hybrid working pattern
Zest Chef creating homecooked food, games room and regular social events
Part of an established, forward thinking, and ambitious appliance care company
A talented and supportive team with a good sense of humour
Inclusive community and positive culture
Competitive benefits package with health cash plan and EAP


We are looking for:


Ability to drive at standardisation and build scalable, repeatable processes
Capability to collaborate and build trusted relationships
Ability to problem solve, utilising range of tools to find solutions
Excellent attention to detail, with an analytical and methodical approach
2+ years‚Äô experience of developing reports with Excel and Power BI
Advanced MS Excel essential (tables, pivots, SUMIFS, XLOOKUP, power query)
Data modelling to include integration of data from multiple sources and use of DAX calculations
Experience with SQL and a willingness to advance in this area
Ability to be based in our Bournemouth head office 3-4 days a week


Job role: Full time

Ref: DPB20241

Website: www.zestplan.com

All applications will receive a response within 7 days.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Newcastle Upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Our client is a highly profitable and ambitious financial service business that has grown from scratch to c.¬£400m annual sales and over 600 head office staff, servicing over ¬£30bn of assets under management and 20% of the UK financial adviser marker in approx. 17 years since inception. Its cutting-edge Technology function and people have grown and progressed with the company, now a team of c.50 developing robust and secure applications used internally and by its B2B and B2C customers throughout the UK. The company is on the next stage of its phenomenal journey and we‚Äôre now looking to help further strengthen the Data team, by appointing a first-rate Data Analyst.

Responsibilities

Reporting to the Head of Data, you will play a key team role in in developing insights across the organisation, building efficient decision-making capabilities for business leaders and managers. Your key responsibilities as Data Analyst will include:


Analysing behaviours, inputs, and outputs to identify trends - providing actionable insights which will inform strategic development and decision-making
Developing key performance indicators
Preparing regular, accurate weekly and monthly reports
Work closely with business leaders and managers
Ensuring data integrity, cleanliness, freshness
Market research and competitor analysis to inform decision-making


As Data Analyst You‚Äôll Offer


Previous experience in a similar Data Analyst role developing insights, visual reports, KPI scorecards and dashboards using Power BI, Fabric, Synapse, Tableau, Excel and similar
Bachelor's or equivalent Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Data Science, Engineering,Computer Science, Business, Economics
Proficiency with Business Intelligence, Data Modelling, Data Visualisation
Detail focus
Strong communication skills
Initiative, adaptability and strong problem-solving skills


Rewards And Benefits


Salary ¬£25,000 to ¬£40,000 + bonus (¬£6k) + pension + benefits
To secure maximum pay/rewards, you must possess all outlined experience, skills, knowledge and qualifications
Excellent career progression opportunities
Hybrid working (2 office days per week)
Free parking
Hours 8.30am - 5.30pm, hol. 22 days + stats, increasing with service


Please note: High levels of interest mean we will only contact you if your application is shortlisted and this will happen within five working days. You must also be eligible to work in the UK.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
hackajob is a matching platform partnering with Frasers Group helping them to hire the best talent and build the future. To get the chance to get matched to this role and other similar roles, click on Apply to set up your free profile.




Company Description




At Frasers Group they're rethinking retail. Through digital innovation and unique store experiences, they're serving their consumers with the world‚Äôs best sports, premium and luxury brands globally. As a leader in the industry, they're elevating the retail experience for their consumers through their collection of established brands, including Sports Direct, FLANNELS, USC, Frasers, and GAME.




They started as a small store in Maidenhead in 1982 and from there, grew to become a global powerhouse. They believe the higher the risk, the greater the reward, and they've never been afraid to strive forward and change the way the industry operates, diversifying their portfolio and elevating stores. As a PLC with a ¬£4bl turn over, this opportunity to grow your career in a fast paced and dynamic environment is one for the bold.







Job Description




As a Financial Analyst joining them at their Head Office in Shirebrook. You will operate as part of a centralised analyst function, focusing on the financial operation across the group. You will be part of a dynamic team working at the hub of the business, supporting high-level strategic decision making.




Working with various data sets within their property department - analysing, interpreting and drawing conclusions to support business critical decisions

Using learnings from data & analytics to optimise efficiency across all areas of the business

Identifying trends in data and making recommendations on operational improvements to a variety of stakeholders throughout the business

Supporting the analysis and decision making of the senior managers

Building relationships with different stakeholders

Striving for continuous business process improvement in everything you do

Creating, maintaining, and improving Excel reports




Qualifications




Degree/equivalent in Finance, Business, Economics, Mathematics or similar.

2+ years of experience in a similar role is required. Experience within a retail setting handling property data is advantageous but not necessary for the right person

Strong Microsoft Excel knowledge

Strong problem-solving ability and a pro-active can do attitude

Commercial mindset- able to operate in a global commercial business and translate technical data into business conclusions

Inquisitive nature, asking questions and strong interest in self development

Able to confidently communicate with wide range of stakeholders with various levels of technical understanding

Exceptional numerical and analytical skills with outstanding attention to detail and able to analyse large and complex datasets




Additional information




At Frasers Group, they fear less and do more. Their people are forward thinkers who are driven to operate outside of their comfort zone to change the future of retail, embracing challenges along the way. The potential to elevate your career is massive, the experience unrivalled. To be able to make the most of it you need to live and breathe their principles:




Think without limits - Think fast, think fearlessly, and take the team with you

Own it and back yourself - Own the basics, own your role and own the results

Be relevant - Relevant to their people, their partners and the planet

Title: Manager - Lead Data Analyst
Description:
East Coast of the United States, USA Req #26628

Friday, June 7, 2024

Company Overview And Culture

EXL (NASDAQ: EXLS) is a global analytics and digital solutions company that partners with clients to improve business outcomes and unlock growth. Bringing together deep domain expertise with robust data, powerful analytics, cloud, and AI, we create agile, scalable solutions and execute complex operations for the world‚Äôs leading corporations in industries including insurance, healthcare, banking and financial services, media, and retail, among others. Focused on creating value from data for driving faster decision-making and transforming operating models, EXL was founded on the core values of innovation, collaboration, excellence, integrity and respect. Headquartered in New York, our team is over 40,000 strong, with more than 50 offices spanning six continents. For information, visit www.exlservice.com.

For the past 20 years, EXL has worked as a strategic partner and won awards in its approach to helping its clients solve business challenges such as digital transformation, improving customer experience, streamlining business operations, taking products to market faster, improving corporate finance, building models to become compliant more quickly with new regulations, turning volumes of data into business opportunities, creating new channels for growth and better adapting to change. The business operates within four business units: Insurance, Health, Analytics, and Emerging businesses.

Job Description

Lead Data Analyst

The project involves discovery to identify impacted areas when creating a new data model for new credit card data. The downstream consumers of the data are to migrate to the new model which is the future state. The candidate would be required to do some structural data changes like primary key or field changes based on a new account hierarchy structure.

Responsibilities

Should experience working incomplex projectsand business analysis skills combined with data analysis and technical skills. Candidate needs to have some level of natural curiosity and self-starter. Python is also required.

Qualifications


Expert/strong data analysis and statistical background
Experience working with large sets of data in variety of formats/structures (including APIs)
Proficiencies in programming languages such as SQL/Python & ability to ETL data from various sources
Data conversion/migration experience is preferred.
Knowledgeable in data science, data warehousing/database design & management, data assessments, matching legacy data to new data structures, data modeling and data quality management/governance/standards
Strong attention to detail & problem-solving capabilities
Python, Pyspark, Hive and SQL skills required.
Data analysis experience required preferably with Credit card data
Ability to fact check information provided by the team that is doing data migration is required
Experience/involvement with large scale projects a must, but basic project management/organizational skills are required
Testing experience would be a plus


EEO/Minorities/Females/Vets/Disabilities

To view our total rewards offered click here ‚Äî> https://www.exlservice.com/us-careers-and-benefits

Base Salary Range Disclaimer: The base salary range represents the low and high end of the EXL base salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to: location and experience. The base salary range listed is just one component of EXL's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include bonuses, as well as a Paid Time Off policy, and many region specific benefits.

Please also note that the data shared through the job application will be stored and processed by EXL in accordance with the EXL Privacy Policy.

Application & Interview Impersonation Warning ‚Äì Purposely impersonating another individual when applying and / or participating in an interview in order to obtain employment with EXL Service Holdings, Inc. (the ‚ÄúCompany‚Äù) for yourself or for the other individual is a crime. We have implemented measures to deter and to uncover such unlawful conduct. If the Company identifies such fraudulent conduct, it will result in, as applicable, the application being rejected, an offer (if made) being rescinded, or termination of employment as well as possible legal action against the impersonator(s).

EXL may use artificial intelligence to create insights on how your candidate information matches the requirements of the job for which you applied. While AI may be used in the recruiting process, all final decisions in the recruiting and hiring process will be taken by the recruiting and hiring teams after considering a candidate‚Äôs full profile. As a candidate, you can choose to opt out of this artificial intelligence screening process. Your decision to opt out will not negatively impact your opportunity for employment with EXL.

Other details


Pay Type Salary


Apply Now


East Coast of the United States, USA

Title: Senior Data Governance Analyst
Description:
TransUnion's Job Applicant Privacy Notice

What We'll Bring

TransUnion is a major credit reference agency, and we offer specialist services in fraud, identity and risk management, automated decisioning and demographics. We support organisations across a variety of sectors including finance, retail, telecommunications, utilities, gaming, government and insurance.

What You'll Bring

The Senior Data Governance Analyst is responsible for supporting the delivery of the Data Management and Governance Framework and practices using their specialist knowledge and expertise.

Day To Day You‚Äôll Be


Supporting and improving compliance with data governance, data quality, data protection policies and standards
Ensuring new and existing product and data assets are well managed in accordance with the above and reporting on compliance
Maintaining the data asset catalogue
Maintaining and maturing the Data Ownership Framework. Proactively engaging Data Owners, Data Stewards and Data Users to ensure they are adequately supported and trained in their roles
Collaborating closely with Data Privacy and Data Quality teams
Contributing heavily to building the new data lineage and business glossary, liaising with project areas and utilising expertise from SMEs across the business
Supporting the resolution of data issues and incidents. Collaborating with stakeholders, liaising with Global Issue Management, Compliance and Data Issue Response teams, and reporting/escalating to relevant committees
Reporting on risks, issues and performance to the Data Quality and Governance Manager
Engaging with TU Data Governance teams across the global business (e.g. in Spain, US, Canada) to promote alignment and share best practice
Supporting the personal development of the (junior) Data Governance Analyst.


Essential Skills & Experience


Knowledge and understanding of data management and governance concepts and best practice
Knowledge and understanding of the GDPR, as well as other relevant legislation and regulations
Understanding of data quality concepts and how to measure data quality
Understanding of data cataloguing and data lineage
Ability to work and oversee a network of Data Stewards to meet the data governance requirements
Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact with a variety of technical and non-technical business stakeholders
Ability to articulate a business issue without resorting to technical language
Organisation and time management skills, including working to deadlines with multiple deliverables
Analytical and problem-solving capabilities.


Impact You'll Make

What‚Äôs In It For you?

At TransUnion you will be joining a friendly, forward thinking global business.

Benefits

As well as an excellent salary and bonus scheme or commission scheme (if joining our sales teams) our benefits package comes with:


26 days‚Äô annual leave + bank holidays (increasing with service)
Global paid wellness days off + a bonus day off to celebrate your birthday
A generous contributory pension scheme + access to the TransUnion Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Private health care + a variety of physical, mental and financial fitness wellbeing programmes such as access to mindfulness tools
Access to our diversity forums and communities so you can get involved in causes close to your heart


TransUnion ‚Äì a Place To Grow

If there‚Äôs something on the list of essential / desirable skills that you can‚Äôt quite tick off, don‚Äôt let that put you off applying. We are open to exploring training and development opportunities for the right candidate to ensure you are successful.

We know imposter syndrome is real, lets confront it so we can continue to grow and thrive together

Flexibility At TU

We recognise that our people need the freedom to balance their day-to-day lives with their work. This is why we‚Äôve set out to create inclusive and flexible policies and practices for you to accommodate all your responsibilities and needs: children, family and beyond. If the role is advertised as full time, don‚Äôt let this stop you from applying. Let us know if you‚Äôre looking for a part time or flexible working arrangement and we can discuss this with you.

Additional Support

At TransUnion, we‚Äôre committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where all individual‚Äôs talents and perspectives are valued. When you apply for a position with us, you‚Äôre not just joining a team, you‚Äôre becoming part of a community that celebrates differences and embraces equality. We understand that everyone has different needs, which is why we offer a range of reasonable adjustments to our recruitment process. Please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments to help you through the application process or to attend an interview with us by contacting ukrecruitment@transunion.com

Interview & Hiring Process

Most of our recruitment processes are virtual, so you‚Äôll get to know our hiring managers and teams over the phone and through video. If we need you to attend a physical in person interview your recruiter will inform you of this.

We do not accept any unsolicited CV‚Äôs from recruitment agencies.‚ÄØ If you are a recruitment agency on our PSL our talent team will contact you directly should we require any assistance.

‚ÄØ,

Find Out More About Life At TU UK

https://twitter.com/TransUnionUK

https://www.linkedin.com/company/transunion/life/

This is a hybrid position and involves regular performance of job responsibilities virtually as well as in-person at an assigned TU office location for a minimum of two days a week.

Title: SQL Database Developer
Description:
SQL Database Engineer | SaaS EdTech | Hybrid - Once/Twice a month in Huddersfield | Circa 45K

As a SQL Developer / Database Engineer for our award-winning SaaS client, you'll join an agile, Scrum-based team, contributing to the creation and maintenance of complex scripting for advanced analytics in the EdTech / tech4good sector. You will get the opportunity to help them build a new suite of inhouse analytics for the business and be part of their journey to invest in more BI.

Role Responsibilities:

Execute pre-existing SQL scripts and procedures for data analytics.

Optimize data extraction and processing operations in SQL Server.

Refine and improve existing procedures to enhance efficiency.

Perform ad hoc SQL queries to generate metrics and insights.

Develop new SQL Server functionality as part of ongoing product development.

Assist in the design and implementation of database structures.Required Skills:

Experienced Database Engineer, SQL Developer or BI professional with SQL Development experience

Strong skills in MS SQL Server, with experience in querying and developing stored procedures.

Proficiency in MS Excel, including complex formulas and macros.

Good relational database design skills.

Ability to work independently and follow defined processes diligently.

Great attention to detail and experience with complex data.Desired but not essential:

Azure SQL

SSRS

Power BI or other BI tools

Azure DevOps

MongoDBSalary / Benefits:

Circa ¬£45,000, with some flexibility for the right candidate

Remote working with occasional office travel (once a month)

25 days holiday + bank

Range of staff incentives and social activities.

Progression opportunities and supportive cultureIf you are a SQL Dev, BI Developer or similar looking for a new role, I would love to hear from you

Key words:

SQL Development, SQL Developer, BI Developer, Business intelligence developer, Database engineer, database developer, powerbi, sql server, ssrs, stored procudures, database design

SQL Development, SQL Developer, BI Developer, Business intelligence developer, Database engineer, database developer, powerbi, sql server, ssrs, stored procudures, database design

Title: Digital Analyst
Description:
Digital Insight Analyst | UK, Hybrid | ¬£40,000-50,000 + Benefits




If you‚Äôre looking for a Digital Insights Analyst role in a growing business where you'll work collaboratively to deliver actionable insights to senior stakeholders.




Here, you'll be sitting in an existing and experienced Web / Digital Analytics function in an established team of 5 - so you'll have support and colleagues to bounce ideas off. As the Digital Insight Analyst you will utilise Adobe Analytics and Adobe Target to drive CRO and customer experience.




What's on offer:

An opportunity to work for a business that invests massively in its people, you'll report to an experienced manager who‚Äôs passionate about developing their team ‚Äì this means progression for you!
You'll have access to some of the best Data and Digital tools on the market whilst also having the chance to work with different departments on their projects.
Surrounded by the cream of the crop! You'll be part of a growing business who have won awards for their work.




What you‚Äôll need:

Hands on, recent experience with Adobe Analytics
Experienced in gathering/extracting Data with SQL ‚Äì we‚Äôre talking about having used SQL commercially for your last 2-3 roles as the data is in multiple different sources.
Experience visualising data utilising tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Looker etc
Experience setting up experiments within Adobe Target & analysing the results.
Solid CRO background.
Strong communication skills ‚Äì you‚Äôll spend around 30% of your time dealing with stakeholders.




What should you expect in return?

10% annual bonus, amazing working environment ‚Äì (you‚Äôll need to get into Manchester 1-2 days per month, more if you‚Äôd like), industry-leading tools and access to wider Data business functions to truly collaborate - did we mention the team?




Expect to work in a collaborative environment, working with people who strive to make this business better. As well as this, you can expect a competitive salary and benefits.




Hit apply and we‚Äôll be in touch to go through your experience and discuss the opportunity & client in more detail with you.

As an employer and service provider, we are committed to Equity, Equality, Diversity and Inclusion. Please feel comfortable to let us know if you have a difference or disability that would require us or our clients to make any helpful adjustments for you.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer - Salary ¬£60,000-¬£70,000 - Remote




An innovative Professional Services company are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Azure Data Engineer to join their team and play a pivotal role in their data modernisation journey.




Amongst other initiatives, you will be a part of a wider team of data engineers who can design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines and solutions on the Microsoft Azure cloud platform.




Responsibilities:




Architect, design, and develop enterprise-grade data pipelines and data storage solutions
Implement data integration processes for seamless data flow across systems
Provision data storage solutions, ingesting streaming and batch data
Transform and cleanse data to ensure its accuracy and consistency
Implement security measures and data retention policies to safeguard sensitive information
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into technical specifications
Lead quality assurance (QA) activities to ensure the integrity of data solutions
Establish and maintain best practices for reusable code, libraries, patterns, and frameworks
Ensure data quality, security, and adherence to data governance standards
Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines, identifying and resolving potential issues
Mentor and train junior data engineers to foster knowledge sharing and expertise within the team

Skills:

Proven experience as a Senior Data Engineer with 5+ years of industry experience
In-depth knowledge of modern data architecture concepts and best practices
Expert-level proficiency in Azure Synapse pipelines, Spark pools, PySpark, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Pools, ADLS Gen 2, Purview, and Azure App Service - (MUST HAVE)
Familiarity with Microsoft Fabric is an asset
Expertise in designing and building robust data pipelines using both batch and streaming ingestion methods over a Medallion architecture
Strong understanding of Azure DevOps processes (including CI/CD)
Proven experience in common data warehouse modelling principles, including Kimball and OBT
Knowledge of Microsoft BI Stack
Expertise in data management, data integration, and data processing methodologies
Experience in developing and implementing security models to safeguard data integrity
Proven ability to lead and manage small and large data engineering teams
Experience with normalised and dimensional data modelling approaches
Demonstrable ability to guide the development of data requirements and drive user-friendly experiences
Expertise in working effectively in fast-paced agile environments




If this sounds like something you are interested in, please get in contact:

thomas.deakin@spgresourcing.com

SPG Resourcing is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to fostering an inclusive workplace which values and benefits from the diversity of the workforce we hire. We offer reasonable accommodation at every stage of the application and interview process.

Title: Support Analyst
Description:
Description

About System C

At System C, we create software that helps drive 21st century health and social care in the UK. Using leading-edge technology and data, our systems are trusted by hundreds of health and social care organisations, our work impacts millions of lives every day. What we do matters.

What will I be doing?

As a Support Analyst you will provide expert service desk to service desk support for our clients, ensuring that any issues with our clinical software are investigated and remedied as efficiently as possible. You will use your initiative to process and prioritise faults, working with product and development teams across the business to fix more complex problems. As one of our Support Analysts you will use your SQL skills to interrogate databases and examine the logs that sit in the back end of our leading solutions.

What are we looking for?

To Be a Successful Support Analyst You Should Have


Strong SQL skills
An ability to use your initiative and think creatively
Analytical, organised and methodical ways of working
Knowledge of ticketing systems or methodologies
Great attention to detail
The ability to explain and describe the investigations you carry out


Experience of working with JIRA or Confluence and Microsoft Azure skills would be advantageous.

If this sounds like the role for you then apply now!

Please note that this role will involve an element of on-call work and quarterly visits to our offices in either Leeds, Liverpool or Oxford dependent where you are based.

Title: Junior Developer
Description:
Purpose




At MQube, we're passionate about innovation and technology. We're a dynamic and innovative FinTech company committed to creating cutting-edge products that meet the diverse needs of our clientele. Our goal is to push the boundaries of technology and deliver exceptional solutions to our customers. We're excited to invite a highly motivated Junior Developer to join our team.

¬†

As a Junior Developer at MQube, you will be crucial in developing and enhancing our software products. We're looking for individuals genuinely interested in computers, engineering, and building products that people love. Your passion, drive to solve problems, and ability to think critically are more important to us than your specific programming skills.

¬†

Job Role Accountabilities




Work closely with stakeholders to understand business requirements and help translate these into technical requirements for other team members.
Identify and develop solutions to system problems and test their suitability

¬†

Examples of Key Activities




Collaborate with senior engineers and product managers to understand project requirements and objectives
Participate in the design, development, and testing of software products using languages such as Go, C#, Java, TypeScript, or other relevant languages.
Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code in your chosen language.
Contribute to product feature brainstorming and creativity.
Assist in optimizing and fine-tuning software applications for performance.
Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technologies through research.
Troubleshoot and resolve software defects and issues.
Provide support for product deployment and post-launch activities.




Key Relationships




CTO Close working

Graduate Developers Close working

Senior Developers Close working




Corporate Accountabilities




Ensuring conduct which is consistently and continuously in accordance with FCA Regulations
Always acting with integrity and ensuring all customers are treated fairly.
Complete all mandatory training as and when required.
Consistent adherence to and understanding of all policies, procedures, and obligations of the firm as part of its first line of defense of the firm.




Qualification, Skills, Knowledge and Experience




Essential

A Level or equivalent in IT

Minimum C-grade in both English and mathematics

Desirable

Any STEM subjects




Skills and Knowledge

A genuine interest in computers, engineering, and building products that people love.
Strong problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and a passion for solving complex challenges.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and concepts.
High attention to detail and a commitment to producing high-quality work.
Minimum of a C-grade in both English and Mathematics or equivalent qualifications. Higher grades are preferred.

¬†

Additional Skills (Preferred)

Familiarity with software development tools and frameworks in your chosen language.
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).
Knowledge of data structures and algorithms.
Understanding of user experience (UX) principles.
Experience with web development, mobile app development, or other software domains.

¬†

Benefits

Competitive salary.
Training and mentorship opportunities.
A friendly and collaborative work environment.
Career advancement possibilities.
Health and wellness benefits.
Flexible work hours and remote work options, with an expectation of spending a reasonable amount of time in our Leeds office.

¬†

Education Opportunity

¬†

We are excited to offer our Junior Developers the opportunity to further their education and skills through a Level 6 Digital and Technology Solutions apprenticeship. This apprenticeship program will be conducted in partnership with either Leeds Beckett University or Sheffield Hallam University, providing you with valuable academic and practical experience. We are committed to supporting your professional development and growth.

¬†

How to Apply

¬†

If you have a genuine interest in computers, engineering, and building products that people love, along with a passion for solving problems, and have achieved a minimum of a C-grade in both English and Mathematics, we encourage you to apply for the Junior Developer position at MQube. To apply, please send your resume detailing your qualifications and motivation for this role to jo.liggett@mqube.com

¬†

MQube is an equal-opportunity employer, and we welcome candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

To apply, please send your resume detailing your qualifications and motivation for this role to jo.liggett@mqube.com

Title: Digital Forensic Analyst
Company: MD5 Ltd - evidence you can trust
Description:
MD5 Limited, based in Normanton, West Yorkshire are excited to announce the opportunity for a Digital Forensic Analyst(s) to join one of the UK‚Äôs leading digital\ eForensic organisations.

Our clients include Law Enforcement and Government Agencies, Corporate and Legal firms. Casework may involve dealing with data of a sensitive nature which may be offensive and distressing (e.g. Images of Child abuse).

The role will cover all aspects of digital forensics\eforensics and the successful candidate will be responsible for acquiring & investigating a wide range of electronic evidence.

Desired Key Skills:

‚Ä¢ Have excellent knowledge of digital hardware, experience in different file systems & operating systems artefacts;

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of the laws & principles of computer forensics & electronic evidence

‚Ä¢ Be meticulous, have a highly analytical and enquiring mind, excellent communication skills and able to convey complex technical issues to a lay audience in writing & verbally

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with forensic software¬†

‚Ä¢ Able to work independently but also as a good team player

In return MD5 offers:

‚Ä¢ Long term career prospects & personal development

‚Ä¢ Good working environment

‚Ä¢ Competitive salary

‚Ä¢ Pension scheme

Appointments are subject to successful security vetting criteria and medical clearance.

MD5 is an equal opportunities employer and is particularly eager to encourage staff progression and development.

Please email your CV with a covering letter to Geoff@md5.uk.com

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Digital with Purpose.




DWP Digital is seeking a Data Engineer who is passionate about utilising cutting-edge technologies to deliver impactful data products.




DWP is the UK's largest department, every year we pay over ¬£195 billion to over 20 million citizens.




DWP services cover everything from helping children & families right through to supporting relatives of lost loved ones.




We help people find jobs, and support people financially when they are unable to work due to health conditions and make ensure everybody has the money they need to live during their retirement years.




The scale of what we do is outstanding, and our purpose is unique. We'd love you to join us.




Your role:




You'll be part of our DataWorks team. We deliver proactive, innovative, and insightful data products in an Agile environment.




DataWorks is an AWS platform that provides Universal Credit data to data scientists and analysts for reporting and statistical purposes.




The team is currently working on two key remits that involve technically standardising the platform to be DWP digitally compliant and providing users with the data they need to evaluate and improve the Universal Credit service's performance.




You'll play a vital role in code development activities for the delivery of data transformation products.




You'll decide the right approach, and integrate different data sources. You'll make sure that appropriate data quality, integrity and alerting is built into all solutions.




You'll conduct proof of concept and discovery work and evaluate proposed changes that might impact data performance, models, or reports.




You will also coach and mentor more junior colleagues, helping to build data engineering knowledge and capability within the team and across government.




Essential criteria:




Experience of developing, testing, maintaining, deploying, and supporting efficient, scalable, automated ETL pipelines in an AWS cloud environment using AWS S3 Cloud Object Storage
Strong coding skills using Python, PySpark, Hive SQL and Spark SQL
Experience of working with a wide variety of structured and unstructured data




It's also great if you have the following (if not, don't worry, you'll have lots of opportunity to learn skills like this here):




Knowledge or experience of the following tools: Hue, GitHub/Lab, Azkaban (or similar scheduling tools), CI/CD (Concourse or similar), R-Studio, Juypter-Lab, Kafka and Bash




Details. Wages. Perks.




You'll join us based at one of our brilliant digital hubs in either Blackpool, Leeds, Newcastle or Sheffield.




We also have all the tools and tech we need to enable our people to work flexibly. We operate a hybrid working model with a mix of home working and some time in the office.




In return for your skills, we offer a competitive salary of up to ¬£43,347. There is also a Digital Allowance of up to ¬£15,000 per annum available for exceptional candidates.




You'll be eligible for a brilliant civil service pension with employer contributions worth 28.97% (worth up to ¬£12,557 a year).




You'll get a generous leave package starting at 26 days, plus all the usual bank holidays, and the option to take extra days off on flexi leave.




We also have a broad benefits package built around your work-life balance which includes:




Flexible working, flexi hours and flexi days
Hybrid working: some time in a hub with the team, some time at home
Family-friendly policies
Time off volunteering and charitable giving
Bring your authentic self to work with 'I Can Be Me in DWP'
Discounts and savings on shopping, fun days out and more
Interest-free loans to buy a bike or a season ticket
Sports and social activities
Working in an award-winning environment and culture
Professional development, coaching, mentoring and career progression opportunities




Click 'Apply' for more information and to start an application on Civil Service Jobs.




Please note, this role requires you to pass Security Check clearance.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The role will be critical in ensuring data quality, consistency, and reliability for SPW. The role will also provide ample development opportunities, in particular progressing our new Data Lakehouse and implementing an iPaaS solution.

Location | Leeds, West Yorkshire

Salary | ¬£50,000 - ¬£55,000

Key Responsibilities


Maintenance of existing data pipelines; pre-empting issues and responding to any incidents in a timely, professional manner.
Development of new pipelines as per business requests or to stabilise the current operating environment.
Liaising with other areas across the business to help define requirements for new projects, including both pipeline and ETL requests.
Implementing and owning the monitoring on key processes.


Core Skills/Competencies


Languages - Expert in SQL (Postgres, Athena Presto SQL) and proficient in using Python to build, maintain and orchestrate data pipelines across the business.
Amazon AWS - Experience using a serverless approach primarily utilising Lambda Functions, Glue (Jobs, Crawlers, Catalogues), Step Functions, SNS (notifications), SQS (queue service) and S3 (object storage).
Data Engineering - Demonstrable experience (> 2 years) working within a Data Engineering function, building data pipelines in a cloud native environment with an in-depth understanding of best practice.
Communication skills - Able to communicate and engage with the business in a non-technical way to gather/replay requirements and ensure successful and timely delivery.
Documentation and deployment - Experience delivering in a controlled manner ensuring changes are tested, approved and deployed in accordance with agreed business protocols (GitHub). Documentation should be clear and easy to understand for all audiences (technical and non-technical).


Preferable But Not Essential


Infrastructure as Code (IAC) - Experience with Terraform (new/future infrastructure) and experience with CloudFormation (legacy infrastructure).
Integration Platform as a Service (iPaaS) - Any experience working with an iPaaS would be preferable, particularly MuleSoft.


We understand not everyone will meet 100% of the requirements, however we encourage you to apply if you think your skills are a good fit for this role.

The Next Step

To join a dynamic team and contribute to our mission of changing lives, click 'Apply' to complete your application.

You Belong Here

At SPW, we embrace individuality and encourage diversity of identity, experience, and thought. We actively strive for inclusive behaviours across our company and our work, including making appropriate adjustments for disabilities, long-term health conditions, or neurodiversities to ensure equal opportunities for all.

Benefits And Perks

In addition to a competitive salary, we offer these enticing benefits to employees:

Generous Holiday Entitlement: Enjoy 30 days of annual leave plus bank holidays, with the option to purchase 5 additional days.

Company Pension Contribution: A matched pension contribution of up to 15% of your base pay if you contribute 6%.

Additional Cash Allowance: Receive an extra 4% cash allowance that can fund various optional benefits, including Paid Sabbatical Leave, Dental Cover, Critical Illness Insurance, Gym Membership, or an electric/ULEV car.

Health & Wellbeing: We offer company-paid Private Medical Insurance, Life Insurance, and Health Screening.

Financial Advice: Access to free financial advice to help secure your financial future.

Annual Bonus: Eligible after 3 months' service, based on company/individual performance.

Title: Infrastructure Engineer
Description:
Infrastructure Engineer

Hybrid working - West Yorkshire/North of England (Occasional site visits required)

Competitive Salary




We are currently looking for an Infrastructure Engineer for a client going through a complete IT and Infrastructure transformation. You will be joining an established and close knit team of Analysts and Engineers, not just keeping the lights on but helping them completely upgrade to a modern day infrastructure estate. Some examples of the projects that they are undertaking are:




On Prem to Cloud (Azure)
Migration onto Office 365
Moving onto Azure AD
Moving onto SD WAN (Next generation Networks)
VOIP / Telephony upgrades and implementation
MFA
Enhancements to Security and anti-virus/spam




The successful applicant will have experience in the below;

2-4+ years as 3rd Line/Infrastructure Engineer or Analyst.
Expert across Windows OS, including strong MS Exchange and Office 365 experience.
On Prem and (ideally) exposure to Cloud hosted Infrastructure and Applications (Azure).
Experience/Exposure to other Tech (Including but not limited to); Active Directory, Anti-spam, Anti virus, Server management, DR planning and execution, file serve management, patching, hardware management, database ops, network design, MS 365 and more.
Familiar or ITIL Certified.
Excellent communication skills and stakeholder/3rd party management.




They are looking for passionate, can-do, positive people, that love working with technology, have a real passion for devices, equipment and fixing problems. Someone who wants to take the initiative to find solutions.




If you‚Äôd like to hear more then please get in touch!




Please note the client DO NOT currently offer sponsorship for this position.

Title: Contract Data Engineer
Description:
Contract Data Engineer

¬£500per day OUTSIDE OF IR35

6 months (with renewal opportunity)

WRK digital are delighted to be partnered with a leading Technical Consultancy who are looking for contract data engineers to join a new project team in Leeds.

You will be working with an expert team who are playing a huge part in ensuring their client takes full advantage of the data they capture and help build out a new Azure platform to further their capabilities.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in handling big data, cloud technologies, and unstructured data, along with a deep understanding of data warehouse design.

Experience


You will have good experience of Azure Data Factory and would be confident coaching existing team members who are not experienced with the tools yet.
Advanced skills in Databricks for data engineering tasks, including experience with Delta Lake, data processing, and optimization.
Proficiency in data modelling, ETL development, and data warehousing concepts.


Tech Stack

ADF, Databricks combination building out a Lakehouse architecture and utilising DeltaLake and DeltaLive tables, Unity Catalog and Purview for the metadata capture.

Other Tooling


Azure DevOps will be used for version control and promotions between environments
JIRA will be used for task management


You will have worked in an Scrum or Agile Framework environment.

Next Steps

If you are a contract Data Engineer looking to join a growing company working with the latest Tech and leading technology innovation, then please apply now or contact WRK digital for a confidential conversation around the next steps. We look forward to receiving your application.

Title: Platform and Data Engineer ‚Äì Leeds
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork ‚Äì the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

Location(s): UK, Europe & Africa : UK : Leeds

BAE Systems Digital Intelligence is home to 4,800 digital, cyber and intelligence experts. We work collaboratively across 16 countries to collect, connect and understand complex data, so that governments, nation states, armed forces and commercial businesses can unlock digital advantage in the most demanding environments.

About The Role

Are you passionate about working with cutting-edge technology? Are you self-motivated to find innovative solutions to complex challenges as part of a team who help keep the UK safe? We are growing our Data Engineering, DevOps and Platform Engineering capability in Leeds and are interested in hearing from Engineers at differing career levels. You‚Äôll play a key role within empowered teams to flexibly and efficiently design, develop, deploy and maintain applications and services. Working with our customers to build systems that support their mission you‚Äôll be encouraged to identify new ways of solving problems. You will work in a small team and will be given as much ownership and responsibility as you have the appetite for; whilst being part of a large Engineering community that can give you the support that you want in order to expand your knowledge and capabilities. We fully embrace Agile ways of working, and build a very broad range of solutions for our customers. We value Engineers who enjoy operating in roles with exposure to the full delivery lifecycle and have lifelong learning mindset.

Not only will you and the team be making an impact upon the systems you work with, you‚Äôll be doing it for an organisation that has a huge impact on the security and safety of the UK and other nations.

Security Clearance is required for this role, if you are not currently Security Cleared, you will need to be eligible for this and willing to go through the clearance process.

About You

You will have experience of working with Azure DevOps, and Azure Data Factory. You'll have great communication and problem solving skills, which are vital in this role, as is a desire to learn new technologies.

In Addition You Will Have


Scripting abilities with languages such as Shell, Bash, Python, JavaScript or Typescript
Experience with PowerBI


Skills

It would be great if you also had experience in some of the following, but if not we‚Äôll help you with developing those skills:


Broad understanding of Azure capabilities (Active Directory, VMs, RBAC etc).
Working within an Agile culture


What‚Äôs in it for you?You will find an environment that supports your personal development, giving you the opportunity to work on a variety of different projects and technologies. You'll be given flexibility in order to learn and pick up new technologies and approaches with access to training to help you do it. You‚Äôll work alongside talented engineers that are constantly looking at new ways to exploit technology for the benefit of our customers.

Life at BAE Systems Digital Intelligence

We are embracing Hybrid Working. This means you and your colleagues may be working in different locations, such as from home, another BAE Systems office or client site, some or all of the time, and work might be going on at different times of the day.

By embracing technology, we can interact, collaborate and create together, even when we‚Äôre working remotely from one another. Hybrid Working allows for increased flexibility in when and where we work, helping us to balance our work and personal life more effectively, and enhance well-being.

Diversity and inclusion are integral to the success of BAE Systems Digital Intelligence. We are proud to have an organisational culture where employees with varying perspectives, skills, life experiences and backgrounds ‚Äì the best and brightest minds ‚Äì can work together to achieve excellence and realise individual and organisational potential.

Division overview: Capabilities

At BAE Systems Digital Intelligence, we pride ourselves in being a leader in the cyber defence industry, and Capabilities is the engine that keeps the business moving forward. It is the largest area of Digital Intelligence, containing our Engineering, Consulting and Project Management teams that design and implement the defence solutions and digital transformation projects that make us a globally recognised brand in both the public and private sector.

As a member of the Capabilities team, you will be creating and managing the solutions that earn us our place in an ever changing digital world. We all have a role to play in defending our clients, and this is yours.

As a member of the Capabilities team, you will be creating and managing the solutions that earn us our place in an ever changing digital world. We all have a role to play in defending our clients, and this is yours.

Title: Graduate Software Developer
Description:
The Role

No coding experience required.

We‚Äôre looking for bright and geeky graduates to join our Software Developer team. No experience is required, and many of our successful applicants have never programmed before. If you think logically and enjoy problem solving, then you have the potential to become a great developer.

A career at TPP will challenge you every day. In your first few weeks you will be solving real-world problems as you help to develop software used by healthcare professionals and patients across the world.

You‚Äôll be part of an agile development team, working on one of the largest real-time databases in the world. You‚Äôll work on a wide variety of projects, ranging from AI assisting clinicians with early diagnosis of cancer to an iOS app helping patients manage their diabetes.

Developers at TPP are involved in the full software cycle, and work closely with all teams across the company to scope out new projects and design, develop and deploy our products.




About TPP




TPP is a world-leader in Digital Health. From apps enabling patients to manage their own care to comprehensive hospital solutions, TPP delivers technology that connects everyone involved in healthcare delivery. For over twenty years, we have been applying the most advanced technology to provide a safe and secure environment to deliver care. Our aim is to improve access to healthcare data, making sure it is available whenever and wherever it is needed. We want to help people make the best use of that data, to empower clinicians and citizens, and to create the healthcare systems of the future.




TPP has been consistently recognised as an outstanding graduate employer. Since 2017, we have consistently featured in The Job Crowds‚Äô ‚ÄúTop Company for Graduates to Work For‚Äù, and were the overall winners for 2022 in addition to being awarded ‚ÄòBest Salary‚Äô and ‚ÄòBest Benefits‚Äô. We have also been named in the Times Top 100 Graduate Employers list every year since 2019.




Salary and Benefits

We will give you an excellent starting salary of ¬£60,000 (depending on experience) with outstanding annual pay reviews and no crazy working hours! Your salary will increase rapidly during your time at the company.




You will also receive a range of benefits, including:

‚Ä¢ Fantastic holiday entitlement

‚Ä¢ Regular social events

‚Ä¢ Opportunities to travel internationally

‚Ä¢ Life insurance

‚Ä¢ BUPA Health, Dental and Travel cover

‚Ä¢ ¬£300 birthday meal allowance

‚Ä¢ Pub Fridays




To read what it‚Äôs like to work at TPP and to see our full list of benefits, visit www.tpp-careers.com




Requirements

‚Ä¢ 2:1 or above at degree level

‚Ä¢ A*AA at A-level (A* in Maths)




International equivalents are accepted, see below for details.




To apply, please visit https://tpp-careers.com/roles/graduate-software-developer/ and send your CV.




Successful candidates will usually be contacted within two weeks. Please be aware that applications will be kept on file for up to 12 months.




International Equivalents

Degree Level

‚Ä¢ GPA of 3.5 or above

A Level

‚Ä¢ 39 or above in the International Baccalaureate

‚Ä¢ AAAAA at Higher / AAB at Advanced Higher

‚Ä¢ 550/750 or above in Gaokao
